22.Sher Ali: On the day when they see the angels - there will be no good tidings on that day for the guilty; and they will cry in distress, `Would that there were a strong barrier

23.Sher Ali: And WE shall turn to the work they did and WE shall scatter it into particles of dust

24.Sher Ali: The inmates of Heaven on that day will be better off as regards their abode, and better off in respect of their place of repose

25.Sher Ali: And on that day when the heaven shall burst asunder with the clouds overhanging it, and the angels shall be sent down in large numbers

26.Sher Ali: The true Kingdom on that day shall belong to the Gracious, God; and it shall be a hard day for the disbelievers

27.Sher Ali: On that day the wrongdoer will bite his hands and will say, `O, would that I had taken a way along with the Messenger

28.Sher Ali: `O, woe is me !  would that I had never taken such a one for a friend

29.Sher Ali: `He led me astray from the Reminder after it had come to me.' And Satan always deserts man in the hour of need

30.Sher Ali: And the Messenger will say, `O my Lord, my people indeed treated this Qur'an as a thing to be discarded.

31.Sher Ali: Thus did WE make for every Prophet an enemy from among the sinners; And sufficient is thy Lord as a Guide and a Helper

32.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say, `Why was not the Qur'an revealed to him all at once?'  WE have revealed it in this manner that WE may strengthen thy heart therewith. And WE have arranged it in the Best form

33.Sher Ali: And they do not come to thee with an objection but WE provide thee with the truth and an excellent explanation

34.Sher Ali: Those who will be gathered unto Hell on their faces -they will be the worst in plight and most astray from the right path

35.Sher Ali: WE gave Moses the Book, and appointed with him his brother Aaron as his assistant

36.Sher Ali: And WE said to them, `Go both of you to the people who have rejected OUR Signs;' Then WE destroyed them utterly

37.Sher Ali: And the people of Noah, when they rejected the Messengers, WE drowned them, and WE made them a Sign for mankind. And WE have prepared a painful punishment for the wrongdoers

38.Sher Ali: And WE destroyed Ad and Thamud, and the People of the Well, and many a generation between them

39.Sher Ali: And to each one WE set forth examples; and each one WE utterly destroyed

40.Sher Ali: And these Meccans must have visited the town whereon was rained an evil rain. Have they not seen it?  Nay, they expect not to be raised after death

41.Sher Ali: And when they see thee, they only make a jest of thee, and say, `What !  is this he whom ALLAH has sent as a Messenger

42.Sher Ali: `He indeed had well-nigh led us astray from our gods, had we not steadily adhered to them.' And they shall no, when they see the punishment, who is most astray from the right path

43.Sher Ali: Hast thou seen him who takes his own evil desire for his god? Canst thou be a guardian over them

44.Sher Ali: Dost thou think that most of them hear or understand? They are like cattle - nay, they are worst than cattle in their behaviour

45.Sher Ali: Dost thou not see how thy Lord lengthens the shade?  And if HE had pleased, HE could have made it stationary. Then WE make the position of the sun an indicator thereof

46.Sher Ali: Them WE draw it in towards Ourselves, drawing in little by little

47.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who has made the night a covering for you, and Who has made sleep for rest, and HE has made the day to rise up and work

48.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who sends the winds as glad tidings before HIS mercy, and WE send down pure water from the clouds

49.Sher Ali: That WE may thereby give life to a dead land, and give it for drink to Our creation - cattle and men in large numbers

50.Sher Ali: And WE have expounded the Qur'an to them in diverse ways that they make take heed, but most men would reject everything but disbelief

51.Sher Ali: If WE had pleased, WE could have surely raised a Warner in every city

52.Sher Ali: So obey not the disbelievers and strive against them by means of the Qur'an with a mighty striving

53.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who has caused the two seas to flow, this palatable and sweet, and that salt and bitter; and between them HE has placed a barrier and an insurmountable partition

54.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who has created man from Water, and has made for him kindred by descent and kindred by marriage; and thy Lord is All-Powerful

55.Sher Ali: And they worship beside ALLAH that which can neither benefit them nor harm them. And the disbeliever is ever opposed to the designs of HIS Lord

56.Sher Ali: And WE have not sent thee but as a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner

57.Sher Ali: Say, `I ask of you no recompense for it, save that whoso chooses may take a way that leads to his Lord.

58.Sher Ali: And trust thou in the One, Who is Ever-Living and is the Source of all life, And Who dies not, and Glorify HIM with HIS praise. And sufficient is HE as the Knower of the sins of his servants

59.Sher Ali: HE Who created the Heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six periods, then HE settled Himself firmly on the Throne - the Gracious, God !  Ask thou then concerning HIM one who knows

60.Sher Ali: And when it is said to them, `Submit to the Gracious God,' they say, `And who is the Gracious, God?  Shall we submit to whatever thou biddest us?'  And it increases their aversion

61.Sher Ali: Blessed is HE Who has made in the heaven mansions of stars and has placed therein a Lamp producing light and a moon that reflects light

62.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who has made the night and the day, each following the other, for the benefit of him who desires to remember, or desires to be grateful

63.Sher Ali: And the true servants of the Gracious God are those who walk on the earth humbly and when the ignorant address them, they avoid them gracefully by saying, `Peace !

64.Sher Ali: And who spend the night in prostration and standing before their Lord

65.Sher Ali: And who say, `Our Lord, avert from us the punishment of Hell; for the punishment thereof is a most vehement torment

66.Sher Ali: `It is indeed evil as a place of rest and as an abode.

67.Sher Ali: And those who, when they spend, are neither extravagant nor niggardly but adopt a moderate position in the middle

68.Sher Ali: And those who call not on any other god along with ALLAH, nor slay a person whose slaying ALLAH has forbidden except for a just cause, nor commit adultery - and he who does that shall meet the punishment of his sin

69.Sher Ali: Doubled for him shall be the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein disgraced

70.Sher Ali: Except those who repent, and believe and do righteous deeds, for as to these, ALLAH will convert their evil deeds into good ones, and ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

71.Sher Ali: And those who repent and do righteous deeds, indeed turn to ALLAH with true repentance

72.Sher Ali: And those who bear not false witness, and when they pass by anything vain, they pass by with dignity

73.Sher Ali: And those who, when they are reminded of the Signs of their Lord, fall not down thereat deaf and blind

74.Sher Ali: And those who say, `Our Lord, grant us of our wives and children the delight of our eyes, and make us a model for the righteous.

75.Sher Ali: It is such as will be rewarded with lofty chambers in Paradise, because they were steadfast, and they will be received therein with greeting and peace

76.Sher Ali: Abiding therein. Excellent it is as a place of rest and as an abode

77.Sher Ali: Say to the disbelievers, `But for your prayer to Him my Lord would not care for you at all. But now that you have rejected HIS Message, HIS punishment will cleave to you.

1.Sher Ali: Ta Sin Mim

2.Sher Ali: These are verses of the Book that makes things clear

3.Sher Ali: Haply thou wilt grieve thyself to death because they believe not

4.Sher Ali: If WE please, WE can send down to them a Sign from the Heaven, so that their necks will bow down before it

5.Sher Ali: And there comes not to them a new reminder from the Gracious God, but they turn away from it

6.Sher Ali: They have, indeed, treated it as a lie but soon there will come to them the tidings of that at which they mocked

7.Sher Ali: See they not the earth, how many of every noble species have WE caused to grow therein

8.Sher Ali: In that is a Sign indeed; but most of these would not believe

9.Sher Ali: And verily thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

10.Sher Ali: And call to mind when thy Lord called Moses, and directed him: `Go to the wrongdoing people

11.Sher Ali: `The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear God

12.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, I fear that they will reject me

13.Sher Ali: `And my breast is not straitened and my tongue is not fluent; so send word to Aaron also

14.Sher Ali: `And they have a charge against me, so I fear that they will kill me.

15.Sher Ali: God said, `That shall not be, go both of you with Our Signs; We are with you hearing your prayers.

16.Sher Ali: `So go to Pharaoh and say, `We are the Messengers of the Lord of the World

17.Sher Ali: `To tell thee to send the children of Israel with us.

18.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said, `O Moses, did we not bring thee up among us as a child?  And thou didst stay among us many years of thy life

19.Sher Ali: `And thou didst do that deed which thou didst, and thou art one of the ungrateful.

20.Sher Ali: Moses said, `I did it then inadvertently, and I was in a perplexed state of mind

21.Sher Ali: `So I fled from you when I feared you; then my Lord granted me right judgment and made me one of the Messengers

22.Sher Ali: `And this favour of bringing me up as a child with which thou now tauntest me, dost thou put forward against thy having enslaved the Children of Israel?

23.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said, `And what is the Lord of the worlds?

24.Sher Ali: Moses said, `The Lord of the heavens and the earth and of all that is between the two, if you would believe.

25.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said to those around him, `Do you not hear?

26.Sher Ali: Moses said, `Your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of yore.

27.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said, `Most surely, this Messenger of yours who has been sent to you is a madman.

28.Sher Ali: Moses Said, `The Lord of the East and of the West, and of all that is between the two, if only you have sense.

29.Sher Ali: `Pharaoh said, `If thou takest a god other than me, I will, certainly, put thee in prison.

30.Sher Ali: Moses said, `What, even though I bring thee something that is manifest !

31.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said, `Bring it then, if thou speakest the truth.

32.Sher Ali: So Moses threw down his rod, and behold !  it was a serpent plainly visible

33.Sher Ali: And he drew out his hand, and lo ! it was white for the beholders

34.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said to the chiefs around him, `This is surely a skillful sorcerer

35.Sher Ali: `He seeks to turn you out of your land by his sorcery. Now, what do you advise?

36.Sher Ali: They said, `Put him off and his brother awhile and send into the cities summoners

37.Sher Ali: `Who should bring thee every skillful and cunning sorcerer.

38.Sher Ali: So the sorcerers were assembled together at the appointed time on a fixed day

39.Sher Ali: And it was said to the people, `Will you also gather together

40.Sher Ali: `So we may follow the sorcerers if they are the winners?

41.Sher Ali: And when the sorcerers came, they said to Pharaoh, `Shall we have a reward if we are the winners?

42.Sher Ali: He said, `Yes, and surely then you will be among my favourites.

43.Sher Ali: Moses said to them, `Now throw you what you have to throw.

44.Sher Ali: So they threw down their ropes and their rods and said, `By Pharaoh's honour, it is we who will surely win.

45.Sher Ali: Then Moses threw down his rod, and lo !  it swallowed up all that which they had fabricated

46.Sher Ali: Thereupon the sorcerers were impelled to fall down prostrate

47.Sher Ali: They said, `We believe in the Lord of the worlds

48.Sher Ali: `The Lord of Moses and Aaron.

49.Sher Ali: Pharaoh said, `You have believed in him before I gave you leave?  He is surely your chief who has taught you sorcery. But you shall know the consequences thereof. I will most surely cut off your hands and your feet on account of your disobedience and I will most surely crucify you all.

50.Sher Ali: They said, `It can do us no harm; to our Lord shall WE return

51.Sher Ali: `We do hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, since we are the first among the believers.

52.Sher Ali: And WE revealed to Moses, directing him, `Take away MY servants by night, you will surely be pursued.

53.Sher Ali: And Pharaoh sent summoners into the cities, announcing

54.Sher Ali: `Theses are a small party

55.Sher Ali: `Yet they have offended us

56.Sher Ali: `And we are a multitude fully prepared and vigilant.

57.Sher Ali: So WE turned them out of gardens and springs

58.Sher Ali: And treasures and an abode of honour

59.Sher Ali: Thus it was; and WE gave them as heritage to the children of Israel

60.Sher Ali: And the host of Pharaoh pursued and overtook them at sunrise

61.Sher Ali: And when the two host came in sight of each other, the companions of Moses said, `We are surely caught.

62.Sher Ali: `Never !' said he, `My Lord is with me; HE will guide me to safety.

63.Sher Ali: Then WE revealed to Moses: `Strike the sea with thy rod.' Thereupon it parted and every part looked like a huge mound

64.Sher Ali: And WE made the others approach nearer

65.Sher Ali: And WE saved Moses and those who were with him

66.Sher Ali: Then WE drowned the others

67.Sher Ali: In this, verily, there is a Sign; but most of these would not believe

68.Sher Ali: And surely thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

69.Sher Ali: And recite unto them the story of Abraham

70.Sher Ali: When he said to his father and his people, What do you worship

71.Sher Ali: They said, `We worship idols, and we shall continue to be devoted to them.

72.Sher Ali: He said, `Do they hear you when you call on them

73.Sher Ali: `Or, do you good or harm you?

74.Sher Ali: They said, `Not so, but we found our fathers doing likewise.

75.Sher Ali: Abraham said, `Do you know that those you have been worshiping

76.Sher Ali: `You and your fathers before you

77.Sher Ali: `They are all enemies to me but it is the Lord of the worlds

78.Sher Ali: `Who has created me, and it is HE Who guides me

79.Sher Ali: `And Who gives me food and gives me drink

80.Sher Ali: `And when I fall ill, it is HE who restores me to health

81.Sher Ali: `And Who will cause me to die, and then bring me to life again

82.Sher Ali: `And Who, I hope, will forgive me my faults on the Day of Judgment

83.Sher Ali: `My Lord, bestow wisdom on me and join me with the righteous

84.Sher Ali: `And grant me true and lasting reputation among posterity

85.Sher Ali: `And make me one of the heirs of the Garden of Bliss

86.Sher Ali: `And forgive my father, for he is of the erring ones

87.Sher Ali: `And disgrace me not on the day when they will be raised up

88.Sher Ali: `The day when wealth and sons shall not avail

89.Sher Ali: `Save him who comes to ALLAH with a sound heart.

90.Sher Ali: And Heaven shall be brought near to the righteous

91.Sher Ali: And Hell shall be placed in full view to those who have gone astray

92.Sher Ali: And it will be said to them, `Where are those that you worshipped

93.Sher Ali: `Beside ALLAH?  Can they help you or help themselves?

94.Sher Ali: Then will they be thrown headlong therein, they and those who have gone astray

95.Sher Ali: And the Hosts of Iblis, all together

96.Sher Ali: They will say, whilst they dispute between themselves therein

97.Sher Ali: `By ALLAH, we were in manifest error

98.Sher Ali: `When we held you as equal with the Lord of the worlds

99.Sher Ali: `And none led us astray but the guilty ones

102.Sher Ali: `Could we but return to the world, we would be among the believers !

103.Sher Ali: In this, verily, there is a Sign; but most of these would not believe

104.Sher Ali: And verily thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

105.Sher Ali: The people of Noah treated the Messengers as liars

106.Sher Ali: When their brother Noah said to them, `Will you not be God-Fearing

107.Sher Ali: `Surely I am unto you a Messenger, faithful to my trus

109.Sher Ali: `And I ask you no reward for it. My reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

111.Sher Ali: They said, `Shall we believe, in thee when it is the meanest of us who follow thee?

112.Sher Ali: He said, `And what knowledge have I as to what they have been doing

113.Sher Ali: `Their account is only with my Lord, if you only knew

114.Sher Ali: `And I am not going to drive away the believers

116.Sher Ali: They said, `If thou desist not, O Noah, thou shalt surely be stoned to death.

117.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, my people have treated me as a liar

118.Sher Ali: `Therefore judge Thou decisively between me and them; and save me and the believers that are with me.

119.Sher Ali: So WE saved him and those who were with him in the fully laden Ark

120.Sher Ali: Then WE drowned thereafter those who remained behind

121.Sher Ali: In this, verily, there is a Sign; but most of them would not believe

122.Sher Ali: And verily thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

123.Sher Ali: The tribe of Ad rejected the Messengers

124.Sher Ali: When their Brother Hud said to them, `Will you not fear God

125.Sher Ali: `Surely, I am unto you a Messenger, faithful to my trust

127.Sher Ali: `And I ask of you no reward for it. My reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

128.Sher Ali: `Do you build monuments on every high place, seeking vain glory

129.Sher Ali: `And do you erect palaces as if you will live for ever

130.Sher Ali: `And when you lay hands upon anyone, you lay hands as tyrants

132.Sher Ali: `And fear HIM Who has helped you with all that you know

133.Sher Ali: `He has helped you with cattle and sons

135.Sher Ali: `Indeed I fear for you the punishment of an awful day.

136.Sher Ali: They said, `It is the same to us whether thou admonish us or whether thou be not of those who admonish

137.Sher Ali: `This is nothing but the habit of the ancients

139.Sher Ali: So they rejected him, and WE destroyed them. In that, indeed, there is a Sign, but most of these would not believe

140.Sher Ali: And verily thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

141.Sher Ali: The tribe of Thamud also rejected the Messengers

142.Sher Ali: When their brother Salih said to them, will you not guard against evil?

143.Sher Ali: `Surely, I am unto you a Messenger, faithful to my trust

145.Sher Ali: `And I ask of you no reward for it. My reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

146.Sher Ali: `Do you think that you will be left secure amid the things that you have here

148.Sher Ali: `And cornfields, and date-palms with heavy spathes near breaking

149.Sher Ali: `And you hew out houses in the mountains, elated with your greatness

151.Sher Ali: `And obey not the bidding of those who exceed the bounds

152.Sher Ali: `Who create disorder in the earth, and do not promote order and security.

153.Sher Ali: They said, `Thou art but one of the bewitched

154.Sher Ali: `Thou art only a mortal like us. So bring a Sign, if thou art of the truthful.

155.Sher Ali: He said, `Here is a she-camel; she has her turn of drinking, and you have your turn of drinking on an appointed day

156.Sher Ali: And touch her not with evil lest there overtake you the punishment of an awful day.

157.Sher Ali: But they hamstrung her; and then they became remorseful

158.Sher Ali: So the punishment overtook them. In that verily there is a Sign, but most of these would not believe

159.Sher Ali: And surely thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

160.Sher Ali: The people of Lot rejected the Messengers

161.Sher Ali: When their brother Lot said to them, `Will you not fear God

162.Sher Ali: `Surely, I am unto you a Messenger, faithful to my trust

164.Sher Ali: `And I ask of you no reward for it. My reward is only with the Lord of the worlds

165.Sher Ali: `Do you, of all creatures, come to males

166.Sher Ali: And leave your wives whom your Lord created for you? Nay, you are a people who transgress all limits.

167.Sher Ali: They said, `If thou desist not, O Lot, thou wilt surely be banished.

168.Sher Ali: He said, `Certainly I hate your conduct.

169.Sher Ali: `My Lord, save me and my family from what they do.

170.Sher Ali: So WE saved him and his family, all of them

171.Sher Ali: Save an old woman, among those who stayed behind

173.Sher Ali: And WE rained upon them a rain; and evil was the rain that descended upon those who were warned

174.Sher Ali: In that, verily, there is a Sign; but most of these would not believe

175.Sher Ali: And surely thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

176.Sher Ali: The people of the Wood rejected the Messengers

177.Sher Ali: When Shu'aib said to them, `Will you not fear God

178.Sher Ali: `Surely, I am unto you a Messenger, faithful to my trust

180.Sher Ali: `And I ask of you no reward for it. My reward is with the Lord of the worlds

181.Sher Ali: Give full measure, and be not of those who give less

183.Sher Ali: `And diminish not unto people their things, nor go about the earth, creating disorder

184.Sher Ali: `And fear HIM Who created you and the earlier peoples.

185.Sher Ali: They said, `Thou art but a bewitched person

186.Sher Ali: `And thou art only a mortal like us, and we believe thee to be a liar

187.Sher Ali: `So cause fragments of the sky to fall on us, if thou art truthful.

188.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord knows best what you do.

189.Sher Ali: So they rejected him. Then the punishment of the day of overshadowing gloom overtook them. That was indeed the punishment of a dreadful day

190.Sher Ali: In that, verily, there is a Sign; but most of these would not believe

191.Sher Ali: And surely thy Lord - HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

192.Sher Ali: And verily this Qur'an is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds

193.Sher Ali: The Spirit, faithful to the trust, has descended with i

194.Sher Ali: On thy heart, that thou mayest be a Warner

195.Sher Ali: In plain and clear Arabic tongue

196.Sher Ali: And it is surely mentioned in the scriptures of the former peoples

197.Sher Ali: And is it not a sufficient Sign for them that the learned among the Children of Israel know it

198.Sher Ali: And if WE had sent it down to one of the non-Arabs

199.Sher Ali: And he had read it to them, they would never have believed in it

200.Sher Ali: Thus have WE caused disbelief to enter into the hearts of the sinful

201.Sher Ali: They will not believe in it until they see the grievous punishment

202.Sher Ali: Which will come upon them suddenly, while they are not aware of it

203.Sher Ali: And they will say, `Shall we be respited?

204.Sher Ali: What !  do they seek to hasten OUR punishment

205.Sher Ali: What thinkest thou that if WE let them enjoy the good things of this world for years

206.Sher Ali: Then there comes to them the punishment that they are promised

207.Sher Ali: Of what avail will be to them that which they were allowed to enjoy

208.Sher Ali: And never did WE destroy any township but it had its Warners

209.Sher Ali: So that they may be admonished; and WE are not unjust

210.Sher Ali: And the evil ones have not brought it down

211.Sher Ali: It does neither suit them nor have they the power to produce it

212.Sher Ali: Surely, they are debarred from listening to the Divine Word

213.Sher Ali: Call not, therefore, on any other god beside ALLAH, lest thou become one of those who are punished

215.Sher Ali: And lower thy wing of mercy to the believers who follow thee

216.Sher Ali: Then if they disobey thee, say, `I repudiate all connection with what you do.

217.Sher Ali: And put thy trust in the Mighty, the Merciful

218.Sher Ali: Who sees thee when thou standest in Prayer

219.Sher Ali: And Who sees thy movements among those who prostrate themselves before ALLAH

220.Sher Ali: HE is indeed the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing

221.Sher Ali: Shall I inform you on whom the evil ones descend

222.Sher Ali: They descend on every lying sinner

223.Sher Ali: They strain their ears towards heaven, and most of them are liars

224.Sher Ali: And as for the poets - it is the erring ones who follow them

225.Sher Ali: Dost thou not see how they wonder aimlessly in every valley

226.Sher Ali: And that they say what they do not

227.Sher Ali: Save those who believe and do righteous deeds, and remember ALLAH much, and defend themselves after they are wronged. And the wrongdoers shall soon know to what place of return they shall return

1.Sher Ali: Ta Sin. These are the verses of the Qur'an and an illuminating Book

2.Sher Ali: A guidance and good tidings to those who would believe

3.Sher Ali: Who observe Prayer and pay the Zakat, and have firm faith in the Hereafter

4.Sher Ali: As to those who believe not in the Hereafter, WE have made their deeds appear beautiful to them, so they wander blindly

5.Sher Ali: It is they who shall have a grievous torment, and they alone it is who shall be the greatest losers in the hereafter

6.Sher Ali: Verily, thou receivest the Qur'an from the One Wise, All-Knowing

7.Sher Ali: Call to mind when Moses said to his family, `I perceive a fire. I will bring you from there some news of great import, or I will bring you a flaming brand that you may warm yourselves.

8.Sher Ali: So when he came to it, he was called by a voice, `Blessed is he who is in the fire and also those around it, and glorified be ALLAH, the Lord of the worlds

9.Sher Ali: `O Moses, verily, I am ALLAH, the Mighty, the Wise

10.Sher Ali: `Throw down thy rod.' And when he saw it move as though it were a serpent, he turned back retreating and did not look back, whereupon WE said, `O Moses, fear not. Verily, I am the One in Whose presence the Messengers need have no fear

11.Sher Ali: `As to those who do wrong and then adopt good instead of evil; to them I am indeed Most Forgiving, Merciful

12.Sher Ali: And put thy hand into thy bosom; it will come forth white without evil. This is among the nine Signs unto Pharaoh and his people, for they are a rebellious people.

13.Sher Ali: But when Our sight-giving Signs came to them, they said, `This is manifest magic.

14.Sher Ali: And they rejected them wrongfully and arrogantly, while their souls were convinced of their truth. See then, how evil was the end of those who acted corruptly

15.Sher Ali: And WE gave knowledge to David and Solomon and they said, `All praise belongs to ALLAH, Who has exalted us above many of HIS believing servants.

16.Sher Ali: And Solomon was heir to David. And he said, `O ye people, we have been taught the language of birds, and we have had all necessary things bestowed upon us. This indeed is God's manifest Grace.

17.Sher Ali: And there were gathered together unto Solomon his hosts of jinn and men and birds, and they were formed into separate divisions

18.Sher Ali: Until when they came to the valley of Al-Naml, a Namlite said, `O ye Naml, enter your habitations, lest Solomon and his hosts crush you, while they know not.

19.Sher Ali: Thereupon he smiled wondering at her words and said, `My Lord, grant me that I may be grateful to Thee, for Thy favour which Thou hast bestowed upon me and upon my parents, and that I may do such good works as would please Thee, and admit me, by Thy mercy, among Thy righteous servants.

20.Sher Ali: And he reviewed the birds and said, `How is it that I do not see Hudhud?  Is he deliberately absent

21.Sher Ali: `I will surely punish him with a severe punishment or I will slay him, unless he brings me a clear reason for his absence

22.Sher Ali: And he did not tarry long before Hudhud came and said, `I have acquired knowledge of that of which thou hast no knowledge; and I have come to thee from Saba' with sure tidings

23.Sher Ali: `I found a woman ruling over them, and she has been given every necessary thing and she has a mighty throne

24.Sher Ali: `I found her and her people worshiping the sun instead of  ALLAH, and Satan has made their works look beautiful to them, and has thus hindered them from the right way, so they are not rightly guided

25.Sher Ali: `And they insist that they will not worship ALLAH, while ALLAH is HE who brings to light that which is hidden in the heavens and the earth, And Who knows what you conceal and what you disclose of your design

26.Sher Ali: `ALLAH !  there is no god but HE, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.

27.Sher Ali: Thereupon Solomon said, `We shall see whether thou hast spoken the truth or whether thou art a liar

28.Sher Ali: `Go thou, with this letter of mine, and lay it before them; then withdraw from them and see what answer they return.

29.Sher Ali: The Queen said, `Ye chiefs, there has been delivered to me a noble letter

30.Sher Ali: `It is from Solomon, and it is `In the name of ALLAH, the Gracious, the Merciful

31.Sher Ali: `Behave not arrogantly towards me, but come to me in submission.

32.Sher Ali: She said, `Ye chiefs, advise me concerning my affair. I never decide any affair until you are present to advise me.

33.Sher Ali: They replied, `We possess power and we possess great prowess in war, but it is for thee to command; so consider what thou wilt command.

34.Sher Ali: She said, `Surely, the kings, when they enter a country, despoil it, and turn the highest of its people into the lowest. And thus they always do

35.Sher Ali: `But I am going to send them a present and wait to see what answer the envoys bring back.

36.Sher Ali: So when the Queen's envoy came to Solomon, he said, `Do you presume to help me with your wealth?  But that which ALLAH has given me is better than that which HE has given you. Nay, you take pride in your gift

37.Sher Ali: `Go back to them, for we shall surely come to them with hosts against which they will have no power of resistance, and we shall drive them out of their land disgraced, and they will be humbled.

38.Sher Ali: He said, `O nobles, which of you will bring me her throne before they come to me submitting?

39.Sher Ali: A powerful chieftain from among the jinn said, `I will bring it to thee before thou strikest thy camp; and indeed I possess power therefor and I am trustworthy.

40.Sher Ali: Said one who had knowledge of the book, `I will bring it to thee before thy noble envoy returns to thee.' And when he saw it set before him, he said, `This is of the grace of my Lord, that HE may try me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whosoever is grateful is grateful for the good of his own soul; but whosoever is ungrateful, truly, my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Gracious.

41.Sher Ali: He said, `Make the throne so beautiful as to make her own throne appear quite ordinary to her, and let us see whether she follows the right way or whether she is one of those who follow not the right way.

42.Sher Ali: And when she came, it was said to her, `Is thy throne like this?'  She replied, `It is as though it were the same. And we had been given knowledge before this, and we have already submitted.

43.Sher Ali: And that which she used to worship beside ALLAH prevented her from believing; for she came of a disbelieving people

44.Sher Ali: It was said to her, `Enter the palace.' And when she saw it, she thought it to be a great expanse of water, and she bared her shanks.  Solomon said, `It is a palace paved smooth with slabs of glass.' She said, `My Lord, indeed I have wronged my soul; and I submit myself with Solomon to ALLAH, the Lord of the worlds.

45.Sher Ali: And WE sent to Thamud their brother Salih who said, `Worship ALLAH.' And at once they became two parties contending with each other

46.Sher Ali: He said, `O my people, why do you seek to hasten on evil rather than good?  Wherefore do you not ask forgiveness of ALLAH that you may be shown mercy?

47.Sher Ali: They said, `We augur ill of thee and of those that are with thee.' He said, `The true cause of your ill-fortune is with ALLAH, but you are a people who are on trial.

48.Sher Ali: And there were in the city a party of nine persons who made mischief in the land, and who would not reform

49.Sher Ali: They said, `Swear one to another by ALLAH that we will surely attack him and his family by night, and then we will say to his heir, `We witnessed not the destruction of his family, and most surely we are truthful.

50.Sher Ali: And they planned a plan, And WE also planned a plan, but they perceived it not

51.Sher Ali: Then see how evil was the end of their plan !  Verily, WE utterly destroyed them and their people all together

52.Sher Ali: And yonder are their houses fallen down because of their wrongdoing. In that verily is a Sign for a people who have knowledge

53.Sher Ali: And WE saved those who believed and feared God

54.Sher Ali: And WE sent Lot as a Messenger, when he said to his people, `Do you commit abomination while you see

55.Sher Ali: What !  do you approach men lustfully rather than women?  Nay, you are indeed an ignorant people.

56.Sher Ali: But the only answer of his people was that they said, `Drive out Lot's family from your city. They are a people who would keep pure

57.Sher Ali: So WE saved him and his family, except his wife; her WE decreed to be of those who stayed behind

58.Sher Ali: And WE rained upon them a rain; and evil was the rain that descended upon those who had been warned

59.Sher Ali: Say, `All praise belongs to ALLAH, and peace be upon those servants of HIS whom HE has chosen. Is ALLAH better or that which they associate with HIM

60.Sher Ali: Or, Who created the heavens and the earth, and Who sent down water for you from the sky wherewith WE cause to grow beautiful orchards?  You could not cause their trees to grow. Is there a god with ALLAH?  Nay, they are a people who deviate from the right path

61.Sher Ali: Or, Who made the earth a place of rest, and placed rivers in its midst, and placed upon it firm mountains, and put a barrier between the two waters?  Is there a god with ALLAH?  Nay, most of them know not

62.Sher Ali: Or, Who answers the cry of the distressed person when he calls upon HIM, and removes the evil, and makes you successors in the earth?  Is there a god with ALLAH?  Little is that you reflect

63.Sher Ali: Or, Who guides you in the depths of darkness on land and sea, and Who sends the winds as glad tidings before HIS mercy?  Is there a god with ALLAH?  Exalted is ALLAH above what they associate with HIM

64.Sher Ali: Or, Who originates creation, and then repeats it and Who provides for you from the heaven and the earth?  Is there a god with ALLAH?  Say, `Bring forward your proof if you are truthful.

65.Sher Ali: Say, `None in the heavens and the earth knows the unseen save ALLAH; and they do not know when they will be raised up.

66.Sher Ali: Nay, their knowledge respecting the Hereafter has reached its limit, rather they are in doubt about it; rather they are blind to it

67.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say, `What !  when we and our fathers have become dust, shall we indeed be brought forth again

68.Sher Ali: `We were surely promised this before - we and our fathers; this is nothing but tales of the ancients.

69.Sher Ali: Say, `Travel in the earth and see how evil was the end of the sinful.

70.Sher Ali: And grieve thou not for them nor be thou in distress because of what they devise

71.Sher Ali: And they say, `When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?

72.Sher Ali: Say, `May be that a part of that which you would hasten on is close behind you.

73.Sher Ali: And, truly, thy Lord is gracious to mankind, but most of them are not grateful

74.Sher Ali: And surely thy Lord knows what their bosoms conceal and what they disclose

75.Sher Ali: And there is nothing hidden in the heaven and the earth, but it is recorded in a clear Book

76.Sher Ali: Verily, this Qur'an explains to the Children of Israel most of that concerning which they differ

77.Sher Ali: And verily it is a guidance and a mercy for the believers

78.Sher Ali: Verily, thy Lord will decide between them by HIS judgment, and HE is the Mighty, the All-Knowing

79.Sher Ali: So put thy trust in ALLAH, surely, thou art on manifest truth

80.Sher Ali: Verily, thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call, when they retreat turning their backs

81.Sher Ali: And thou canst not guide the blind out of their error. Thou canst make only those to hear who believe in Our Signs, so they submit

82.Sher Ali: And when the sentence is passed against them, WE shall bring forth for them an insect out of the earth which shall wound them because people did not believe in Our Signs

83.Sher Ali: And remind them of the day when WE shall gather together from every people a party from among those who rejected Our Signs, and they shall be formed into separate groups

84.Sher Ali: Till, when they come, HE will say, `Did you reject MY Signs while you had not full knowledge concerning them?  Or, what was it that you were doing about them

85.Sher Ali: And the sentence shall come to pass against them because they did wrong, and they will be speechless

86.Sher Ali: See they not that WE have made the night that they may rest therein, and the day sight-giving?  In that verily are Signs for a people who believe

87.Sher Ali: And call to mind the day when the trumpet will be blown and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth will be struck with terror, save him whom ALLAH pleases. And all shall come unto HIM humbled

88.Sher Ali: And thou seest the mountains, which thou thinkest to be firmly fixed, pass away as the clouds pass away - the handiwork of ALLAH Who has made everything perfect. Verily, HE is full Aware of what you do

89.Sher Ali: Whoever does a good deed shall have a better reward than that, and such will be secure from terror that day

90.Sher Ali: And those who do evil, shall be thrown down on their faces into the Fire; and it will be said to them, `Are you not rewarded for what you have been doing?

91.Sher Ali: Say, `I am commanded only to serve the Lord of this City which HE has made sacred, and to HIM belongs all things; and I am commanded to be of those who submit to God

92.Sher Ali: `And to recite the Qur'an. So whoever follows guidance follows it only for the good of his own soul; and as to him who goes astray, say, `I am only a Warner.

93.Sher Ali: And say, `All praise belongs to ALLAH; HE will soon show you HIS Signs, and you will know them.'  And thy Lord is not unaware of what you do

1.Sher Ali: Ta Sin Mim

2.Sher Ali: These are verses of the perspicuous Book

3.Sher Ali: We rehearse unto thee a true account of Moses and Pharaoh for the benefit of a people who would believe

4.Sher Ali: Verily, Pharaoh behaved arrogantly in the earth, and divided the people thereof into sections; he sought to weaken one section of them, slaughtering their sons and sparing their women. Certainly, he was one of the mischief-makers

5.Sher Ali: And WE desired to show favour unto those who were considered weak in the earth, and to make them leaders and to make them inheritors of Our favours

6.Sher Ali: And to establish them in the earth, and to make Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts see from them that which they feared

7.Sher Ali: And WE directed the mother of Moses by revelation, `Suckle him; and when thou fearest for him, then cast him into the river and fear not, nor grieve; for WE shall restore him to thee, and shall make him one of the Messengers.

8.Sher Ali: She did accordingly and one of the family of Pharaoh picked him up so that he became for them an enemy and a source of sorrow. Verily, Pharaoh and Haman and their hosts were wrongdoers

9.Sher Ali: And Pharaoh's wife said, `He will be a joy of the eye for me and for thee. Slay him not. Haply he may prove to be useful for us, or we may adopt him as a son.' And they knew not Our purpose

10.Sher Ali: And the heart of the mother of Moses became free from anxiety. She had almost disclosed his identity, were it not that WE had strengthen her heart so that she might be of the firm believers

11.Sher Ali: And she said to his sister, `Follow him up.' So she observed him from afar; and they were unaware of this

12.Sher Ali: And WE had already decreed that he shall refuse the wet-nurse; so she said, `Shall I direct you to the people of a household who will bring him up for you and will be his sincere well-wishers?

13.Sher Ali: Thus WE restored him to his mother that her eye might be gladdened and that she might not grieve, and that she might know that the promise of ALLAH is true. But most of people know not

14.Sher Ali: And when he reached his age of full strength and attained maturity, WE bestowed wisdom and knowledge upon him; and thus do WE reward those who do good

15.Sher Ali: And one day he entered the city at a time when its inhabitants were in a state of heedlessness; and he found therein two men fighting - one of his own party and the other of his enemies. And he who was of his party sought his help against him who was of his enemies. So Moses struck the latter with his fist; and thereby caused his death. Then Moses said, `This is Satan's doing, he is indeed an enemy, a manifest misleader.

16.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, I have wronged my soul, so do thou forgive me.' So HE forgave him; HE is Most Forgiving, ever Merciful

17.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, because of the favour Thou hast bestowed upon me, I will never be a helper of the guilty.

18.Sher Ali: And morning found him in the city, apprehensive, watchful; and lo !  he who had sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses said to him, `Verily, thou art manifestly a misguided fellow.

19.Sher Ali: And when he made up his mind to lay hold of the man who was an enemy to both of them, he said, `O Moses, dost thou intend to kill me even as thou didst kill a person yesterday?  Thou only desirest to be a tyrant in the land, and thou desirest not to be a peace-maker.

20.Sher Ali: And there came a man from the far side of the city, running. He said, `O Moses, of a truth, the chiefs are taking counsel together against thee to kill thee. Therefore get thee away; surely;, I am thy well-wisher.

21.Sher Ali: So he went forth therefrom, fearful and watchful. He said, `My Lord, deliver me from the unjust people.

22.Sher Ali: And when he turned his face towards Midian, he said, I hope, my Lord will guide me to the right way.

23.Sher Ali: And when he arrived at the water of Midian, he found there a party of men, watering their flocks. And he found beside them two women holding back their flocks. He said, `What is your the problem?'  They replied, `We cannot water our flocks until the shepherds depart with their flocks, and our father is a very old man.

24.Sher Ali: So he watered their flocks for them. Then he turned aside into the shade and said, `My Lord, I stand in need of whatever good Thou mayest send down to me.

25.Sher Ali: And one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully. She said, `My father calls thee that he may reward thee for thy having watered our flocks for us.'  So when he came to him and told him the story, he said, `Fear not; thou hast escaped from the unjust people.

26.Sher Ali: One of the two women said, `O my father, take him into thy service; for the best man that thou canst employ is the one who is strong and trustworthy.

27.Sher Ali: Their father said to Moses, `I intend to marry to thee one of these two daughters of mine on condition that thou stay in my service for eight years. But if thou complete ten years, it will be of thine own accord. And I would not lay any hardship upon thee; thou wilt find me, if ALLAH wills, of the righteous.

28.Sher Ali: Moses said, `That is settled between me and thee. Whichever of the two terms I fulfill, there shall be no injustice to me; and ALLAH watches over what we say.

29.Sher Ali: And when Moses had fulfilled the term, and set forth with his family, he perceived a fire in the direction of the Mount. He said to his family, `Wait, I perceive a fire; haply I may bring you some useful information therefrom, or a burning brand from the fire that you may warm yourselves.

30.Sher Ali: And when he came to it, he was called by a voice from the right side of the Valley, in the blessed spot, out of the tree;  `O Moses, Verily, I am ALLAH, the Lord of the worlds

31.Sher Ali: Cast down thy rod.' And when he saw it move as though it were a serpent, he turned back retreating and did not look back. `O Moses,' said the voice, `Come forward and fear not; surely, thou art of those who are safe

32.Sher Ali: Insert thy hand into thy bosom; it will come forth white without evil effect, and draw back thy arm toward thyself in order to still thy fear. So these shall be two proofs from thy Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. Surely, they are a rebellious people

33.Sher Ali: Moses said, `My Lord, I killed a person from among them, and I fear that they will kill me

34.Sher Ali: `And my brother Aaron - he is more eloquent in speech than I; send him, therefore, with me as a helper that he may bear witness to my truth. I fear that they will charge me with falsehood.

35.Sher Ali: God said, `We will strengthen thine arm with thy brother, and WE will give power to you both so that they shall not reach you. So go with Our Signs. You two and those who follow you will prevail.

36.Sher Ali: And when Moses came to them with Our clear Signs, they said, `This is nothing but a forged sorcery, and we never heard the like of this among our forefathers.

37.Sher Ali: Moses said, `My Lord knows best who it is that has brought guidance from HIM, and whose will be the reward of the final abode. Verily, the wrongdoers never prosper

38.Sher Ali: And Pharaoh said, `O chiefs, I know of no god for you other than myself; so burn me bricks of clay, O Haman, and build me a tower, that I may, by climbing it, have a look at the God of Moses, for I think that he is a liar.

39.Sher Ali: And he and his hosts behaved arrogantly in the land without justification. And they thought that they would never be brought back to US

40.Sher Ali: So WE seized him and his hosts and cast them into the sea. See, then, how evil was the end of the wrongdoers

41.Sher Ali: And WE made them leaders who called people unto the Fire; and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped

42.Sher Ali: And WE caused them to be followed by a curse in this world; and on the Day of Resurrection they will be among those deprived of all good

43.Sher Ali: And WE gave Moses the Book, after WE had destroyed the earlier generations, as a source of enlightenment for men, and a guidance and a mercy, that they might reflect

44.Sher Ali: And thou wast not on the Western side of the Mount when WE committed the matter of Prophethood to Moses, nor wast thou among the witnesses

45.Sher Ali: But WE brought forth generations after Moses, and life became prolonged for them. And thou wast not a dweller among the people of Midian, rehearsing Our Signs unto them; But it is WE Who send Messengers

46.Sher Ali: And thou wast not on the side of the Mount with Moses, when WE called to him and revealed to him Our prophecy concerning thee. But WE have sent thee as a mercy from thy Lord, that thou mayest warn a people to whom no warner had come before thee, that they may be mindful

47.Sher Ali: And were it not that if an affliction should befall them because of what their hands have sent before them, they would say, `Our Lord, wherefore didst Thou not send a Messenger to us that we might have followed Thy commandments and been of the believers?' We would not have sent thee as a Messenger

48.Sher Ali: But now when the truth has come to them from US, they say, `Why has he not been given the like of what was given to Moses?'  Did they not reject that which was given to Moses before?'  They said, `Aaron and Moses are but two sorcerers who back up each other.' And they say, `We reject the claim of both.

49.Sher Ali: Say, `Then bring a Book from ALLAH which is a better guide than these two books - the Torah and the Qur'an - that I may follow it, if you are truthful.

50.Sher Ali: But if they answer thee not, then know that they only follow their own evil desires. And who is more erring than he who follows his evil desires without any guidance from ALLAH. Verily, ALLAH guides not the wrongdoing people

51.Sher Ali: And WE have, indeed, sent revelation to them continuously, that they may be admonished

52.Sher Ali: Those to whom WE gave the Book before the Qur'an - they believe in it

53.Sher Ali: And when it is recited unto them, they say, `We believe in it. Verily, it is the truth from our Lord. Indeed, even before it we had submitted to its teaching.

54.Sher Ali: These will be given their reward twice,  for they have been steadfast, and they repel evil with good, and spend out of what WE have given them

55.Sher Ali: And when they hear idle talk, they turn away from it and say, `For us are our works and for you your works. Peace be upon you. We have no concern with the ignorant.

56.Sher Ali: Surely, thou canst not guide whomsoever thou lovest; but ALLAH guides whomsoever HE pleases; and HE knows best those who would accept guidance

57.Sher Ali: And they say, `If we were to follow the guidance with thee, we should be snatched away from our land.' Say to them, `Have WE not established for them a safe sanctuary, to which are brought the fruits of all things, as a provision from US?' But most of them know not

58.Sher Ali: And how many a town have WE destroyed which exulted in its life of ease and plenty !  and these are their dwellings which have been but little inhabited after them. And it is WE Who became the inheritors thereof

59.Sher Ali: And thy Lord would never destroy the towns until HE has raised in the mother-town thereof a Messenger, reciting unto them Our Signs; nor would WE destroy the towns unless the people thereof were wrongdoers

60.Sher Ali: And whatever of anything you are given is only a temporary enjoyment of the present life and an adornment thereof; and that which is with ALLAH is better and more lasting. Will you not then understand

61.Sher Ali: Is he, then, to whom WE have promised a goodly promise, the fulfillment of which he will meet, like him whom WE have provided with the good things of this life only, and then on the Day of Resurrection he will be among those who are brought before God  to give an account of their deeds

62.Sher Ali: And on that day HE will call to them, and say, `Where are those whom you allege to be my associates?

63.Sher Ali: Then those, against whom the sentence of punishment will have become due, will say, `Our Lord, these are those whom we led astray. We led them astray even as we had gone astray ourselves. We now dissociate ourselves from them and turn to Thee. It was not us that they worshiped.

64.Sher Ali: And it will be said to the idolaters, `Now call upon your so-called partners.' And they will call upon them, but they will not answer them. And they will see the punishment and wish that they had followed the guidance

65.Sher Ali: And on that day ALLAH will call to them and say, `What answer gave you to the Messengers?

66.Sher Ali: Then all excuses will become obscure to them on that day and they shall not even ask each other

67.Sher Ali: But he who repents and believes and does righteous deeds, maybe, he will be among the prosperous

68.Sher Ali: And thy Lord creates whatever HE pleases, and chooses whomsoever HE pleases. It is not for them to choose. Glorified be ALLAH. HE is far above all that they associate with HIM

69.Sher Ali: And thy Lord knows what their breasts conceal, and what they disclose

70.Sher Ali: And HE is ALLAH; there is no god but HE. To HIM belongs all praise in the beginning and the Hereafter.  HIS is the dominion, and to HIM shall you be brought back

71.Sher Ali: Say, `Tell me, if ALLAH should make the night to continue perpetually over you till the Day of Resurrection, what god is there other than ALLAH who could bring you light?  Will you not then hearken?

72.Sher Ali: Say, `Tell me, if ALLAH should make the day to continue perpetually over you till the Day of Resurrection, what god is there other than ALLAH who could bring you night wherein you could rest?  Will you not then see?

73.Sher Ali: And of HIS mercy HE has made for you the night and the day, that you may rest therein and that you may seek of HIS bounty, and that you may be grateful

74.Sher Ali: And on that day HE will call to them and say, `Where are those whom you alleged to be my associates?

75.Sher Ali: And WE shall take out from every people a witness and WE shall say, `Bring your proof.'  Then they will know that the truth belongs to ALLAH alone. And that which they used to forge will all be lost unto them

76.Sher Ali: Verily, Korah was of the people of Moses, but he behaved tyrannically towards them. And WE had given him treasures of hoarded wealth so much that the keys thereof would have weighed down a party of strong men. When his people said to him, `Exult not, surely ALLAH loves not those who exult

77.Sher Ali: `And seek, in that which ALLAH has given thee, the Home of the Hereafter; and neglect not thy lot in this world; and do good to others as ALLAH has done good to thee; And seek not to create mischief in the land. Verily, ALLAH loves not those who create mischief;

78.Sher Ali: He said, `All this has been given to me because of the knowledge I possess.' Did he not know that ALLAH had destroyed before him generations that were mightier than he and greater in riches?  And the guilty shall not be asked to offer an explanation of their sins

79.Sher Ali: So he went forth before his people in all his pomp. Those who were desirous of the life of this world said, `Would that we had the like of what Korah has been given !  Truly, he is the master of great fortune.

80.Sher Ali: But those who had been given knowledge said, `Woe unto you, ALLAH's reward is best for those who believe and do good works; and it shall be granted to no one except those who are steadfast.

81.Sher Ali: Then WE caused the earth to swallow him up and his dwelling; And he had no party to help him against ALLAH, nor was he of those who can defend themselves

82.Sher Ali: And those who had coveted his position the day before began to say, `Ruin seize thee !  it is indeed ALLAH Who enlarges the provisions for such of HIS servants as HE pleases and straitens it for whom HE pleases. Had not ALLAH been gracious to us, HE would have caused it to swallow us up also. Ah !  the ungrateful never prosper.

83.Sher Ali: This is the home of the Hereafter. WE give it to those who seek not self-exaltation in the earth, nor corruption. And the good end is for the righteous

84.Sher Ali: He who does a good deed shall have a reward better than that; and as for him who does an evil deed - those who do  evil deeds shall not be rewarded but according to what they did

85.Sher Ali: HE who has made the teaching of the Qur'an binding on thee will most surely bring thee back to thy ordained place of return. Say, `My Lord knows best him who has brought the guidance, and him who is in manifest error.

86.Sher Ali: And thou didst never expect that the Book would be revealed to thee; but it is a mercy from thy Lord; so never be a helper of disbelievers

87.Sher Ali: And let them not turn thee away from the Signs of ALLAH, after they have been sent down to thee; and call mankind to thy Lord, and be not of those who associate partners with HIM

88.Sher Ali: And call not on any other god beside ALLAH.  There is no god but HE.  Everything will perish but HE.  HIS is the judgment, and to HIM will you all be brought back

1.Sher Ali: Alif, Lam, Mim

2.Sher Ali: Do men think that they will be left alone because they say, `We believe,' and that they will not be tried

3.Sher Ali: And WE did try those who were before them. So ALLAH will, assuredly, know those who are truthful and HE will, assuredly, know the liars

4.Sher Ali: Or, those who commit evil deeds imagine that they will escape US?  How ill they judge

5.Sher Ali: Whoso hopes to meet ALLAH, let him be prepared for it, for ALLAH's appointed time is certainly coming. And HE is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing

6.Sher Ali: And whoso strives, strives only for his own soul; verily, ALLAH is Independent of all HIS creatures

7.Sher Ali: And as to those who believe and do righteous deeds WE shall surely, remove from them their evils, and WE shall, surely, give them the best reward of their works

8.Sher Ali: And WE have enjoined on man kindness to his parents; but if they contend with thee to make thee associate that with ME of which thou hast no knowledge, then obey them not. Unto ME is your return, and I shall inform you of what you did

9.Sher Ali: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - them WE shall, surely, admit into the company of the righteous

10.Sher Ali: And of men there are some who say, `We believe in ALLAH;' but when they are made to suffer in the cause of ALLAH, they regard the persecution of men as if it were the punishment of ALLAH. And if help comes from thy Lord, they are sure to say, `Certainly, we were with you.' Is not ALLAH best aware of what is in the breasts of HIS creatures

11.Sher Ali: And ALLAH will, certainly, make manifest those who believe and HE will, surely, distinguish the hypocrites from the believers

12.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say to those who believe, `Follow our way, and we will, surely, bear the burden of your sins.' But they will bear none of the burden of their sins. They are, surely, liars

13.Sher Ali: But they shall, surely, bear their own burdens, and other burdens along with their own burdens. And they will, surely, be questioned on the Day of Resurrection concerning that which they fabricated

14.Sher Ali: And WE, certainly, sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years, short of fifty years. Then the deluge overtook them, while they were wrongdoers

15.Sher Ali: But WE saved him and those who were with him in the Ark; and WE made it a Sign for all peoples

16.Sher Ali: And WE sent Abraham when he said to his people, `Worship ALLAH and fear HIM. That is better for you, if only you knew

17.Sher Ali: `You only worship idols beside ALLAH, and you invent a lie. Those, whom you worship beside ALLAH, have no power to provide sustenance for you. Then seek sustenance from ALLAH, and worship HIM, and be Grateful to HIM.  Unto HIM will you be brought back.

18.Sher Ali: And if you reject the truth, then the generations before you also rejected it. And the Messenger is only responsible for the clear delivery of the Message

19.Sher Ali: See they not how ALLAH originates creation, then repeats it?  That, surely, is easy for ALLAH

20.Sher Ali: Say, `Travel in the earth, and see how HE originated the creation. Then will ALLAH create the second creation. Surely, ALLAH has power over all things

21.Sher Ali: HE punishes whom HE pleases and shows mercy unto whom HE pleases; and to HIM will you be turned back

22.Sher Ali: And you cannot frustrate the designs of ALLAH in the earth nor in the heaven; nor have you any friend or helper beside ALLAH.

23.Sher Ali: Those who disbelieve in the Signs of ALLAH and the meeting with HIM - it is they who despair of MY mercy. And they will have a grievous punishment

24.Sher Ali: And the only answer of his people was that they said, `Slay him or burn him.' But ALLAH delivered him from the fire. In that, surely, are, Signs for a people who believe

25.Sher Ali: And Abraham said, `Verily, you have taken for yourselves idols beside ALLAH, out of love for each other in the present life. Then on the Day of Resurrection you will deny each other, and curse each other. And your abode will be the Fire; and you will have no helpers.

26.Sher Ali: And Lot believed in him, and Abraham said, `I flee unto my Lord; surely, HE is the Mighty, the Wise.

27.Sher Ali: And WE bestowed on him Isaac and Jacob, and WE placed Prophethood and the Book among his descendants, and WE gave him his reward in this life, and in the Hereafter he will, surely, be among the righteous

28.Sher Ali: And call to mind Lot when he said to his people, `You commit an abomination such as no one among mankind has ever committed before you

29.Sher Ali: What !  Do you approach men with lust and commit robbery on the highway, and you commit abomination in your meetings?'  But the only answer of his people was that they said, `Bring upon us the punishment of ALLAH if thou speakest the truth.

30.Sher Ali: He said, `Help me, my Lord, against the wicked people.

31.Sher Ali: And when Our Messengers brought Abraham the tidings, they said, `The tidings is, `We were about to destroy the people of this town; surely, its people are wrongdoers.

32.Sher Ali: He said, `But Lot is there !'  They said, `We know very well who is there. We will surely, save him and his family, except his wife, who is of those who remain behind.

33.Sher Ali: And when Our Messengers came to Lot, he was distressed on their account and felt powerless with regard to them. And they said, `Fear not nor grieve, and we have been charged with the divine message: `We will, surely, save thee and thy family except thy wife, who is of those who remain behind

34.Sher Ali: And `We are, surely, going to bring down on the people of this town a punishment from heaven, for they have been rebellious.

35.Sher Ali: And WE have left thereof a clear Sign for a people who would understand

36.Sher Ali: And to Midian WE sent their brother Shu'aib who said, `O my people, worship ALLAH, and be mindful of the Last Day and commit not iniquity in the earth, creating disorder.

37.Sher Ali: But they called him a liar. So a violent earthquake seized them, and in their homes they lay prostrate upon the ground

38.Sher Ali: And WE destroyed Ad and Thamud; and it is evident to you from their dwelling places. And Satan made their deeds appear attractive to them, and thus turned them away from the right path, sagacious though they were

39.Sher Ali: And WE destroyed Korah and Pharaoh and Haman. And Moses did come to them with manifest Signs, but they behaved arrogantly in the land, yet they could not outstrip Us

40.Sher Ali: So each one of them WE seized for his sin; of them were those against whom WE sent a violent sandstorm, and of them were those whom a roaring blast overtook, and of them were those whom WE caused the earth to swallow up, and of them were those whom WE drowned. And ALLAH did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves

41.Sher Ali: The case of those who take helpers beside ALLAH is like unto the case of the spider that takes to itself a house; and, surely, the frailest of all houses is the house of the spider, if they but knew

42.Sher Ali: Verily, ALLAH knows whatever they call upon beside HIM; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

43.Sher Ali: And these are similitudes which WE set forth for mankind, but only those understand them who have knowledge

44.Sher Ali: ALLAH created the heavens and the earth in accordance with the requirements of wisdom. In that, surely, is a Sign for the believers

45.Sher Ali: Recite that which has been revealed of the Book and observe Prayer. Surely, Prayer restrains one from indecency and manifest evil; and the remembrance of ALLAH is the greatest virtue. And ALLAH knows what you do

46.Sher Ali: And argue not with the people of the Book except with what is best as an argument, but argue not at all with such of them as are unjust. And say, `We believe in that which has been revealed to us and that which has been revealed to you; and our God and your God is One, and to HIM we submit.

47.Sher Ali: And in like manner have WE sent down the Book to thee; so those to whom WE have given true knowledge of the Book (Torah) believe in it (the Qur'an); and of these Meccans also there are some who believe in it. And none but the disbelievers persist in rejecting Our Signs

48.Sher Ali: And thou didst not recite any Book before the Qur'an, nor didst thou write one with thy right hand; in that case the liars would have had cause to doubt

49.Sher Ali: Nay, it is a collection of clear Signs in the hearts of those who are given knowledge. And none but the wrongdoers deny Our Signs

50.Sher Ali: And they say, `Why are not Signs sent down to him from his Lord?'  Say, `The Signs are with ALLAH, and I am but a plain warner,

51.Sher Ali: Is it not enough for a Sign for them that WE have sent down to thee the perfect Book which is recited to them?  Verily, in this there is great mercy and a reminder for a people who believe

52.Sher Ali: Say, `ALLAH is sufficient as a Witness between me and you. HE knows what is in the heavens and the earth. And as for those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in ALLAH, they it is who are the losers.

53.Sher Ali: They ask thee to hasten on the punishment, and had there not been an appointed term, the punishment would have come upon them. And it shall, surely, overtake them unexpectedly, while they perceive not

54.Sher Ali: They ask thee to hasten on the punishment; but Hell will, certainly, encompass the disbelievers

55.Sher Ali: On the day when the punishment will overwhelm them from above them and from underneath their feet, and HE will say, `Taste ye the fruit of your actions.

56.Sher Ali: O MY servants who believe !  verily, MY earth is vast; so worship ME alone

57.Sher Ali: Every soul shall taste of death; then to US shall you all be brought back

58.Sher Ali: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - them shall WE, surely, house in lofty mansions of Paradise, beneath which streams flow. They will abide therein. Excellent is the reward of those who labour for good

59.Sher Ali: Those who are steadfast, and put their trust in their Lord

60.Sher Ali: And how many an animal there is that carries not its sustenance !  ALLAH provides for it and for you. And HE is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing

61.Sher Ali: And if thou ask them, `Who has created the heavens and the earth and pressed into service the sun and the moon?  They will, surely, say, `ALLAH.' How then are they being turned away from the truth

62.Sher Ali: ALLAH enlarges the means of sustenance for such of his servants as HE pleases, and straitens them for whom HE pleases. Surely, ALLAH has full knowledge of all things

63.Sher Ali: And if thou ask them, `Who sends down water from the sky and therewith gives life to the earth after its death?'  They will, surely, say, `ALLAH.'  Say, `All praise belongs to ALLAH.' But most of them understand not

64.Sher Ali: And the life of this world is nothing but a pastime and a sport, and the Home of the Hereafter - that indeed is Life, if they but knew

65.Sher Ali: And when they go on board a ship, they call on ALLAH, with sincere and single-minded faith in HIM. But when HE brings them safe to land, behold !  they associate partners with HIM again

66.Sher Ali: Being ungrateful for what WE have bestowed on them, and enjoying themselves for a time. But they will soon come to know the consequences of their conduct

67.Sher Ali: Do they not see that WE have made the sanctuary of Mecca secure for them, while people are snatched away from all around them?  Would they then believe in falsehood and deny the favour of ALLAH

68.Sher Ali: And who is more unjust than he who invents a lie concerning ALLAH, or rejects the truth when it comes to him?  Is there not an abode in Hell for disbelievers

69.Sher Ali: And as for those who strive to meet US - WE will, surely, guide them in OUR ways.  And, verily, ALLAH is with those who do good

1.Sher Ali: Alif, Lam, Mim

2.Sher Ali: The Romans have been defeate

3.Sher Ali: In the land nearby, and they, after their defeat, will be victoriou

4.Sher Ali: In a few years - ALLAH's is the dominion before and after that - and on that day the believers will rejoic

5.Sher Ali: In ALLAH's help. HE helps whom HE pleases; and HE is the Mighty, the Merciful

6.Sher Ali: ALLAH has made this promise. ALLAH breaks not HIS promise, but most men know not

7.Sher Ali: They know only the outer part of the life of this world, and of the Hereafter they are utterly unmindful

8.Sher Ali: Do they not reflect within themselves that ALLAH has not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between the two but in accordance with the requirements of wisdom and for a fixed term?  But many among men believe not in the meeting with their Lord

9.Sher Ali: Have they not traveled in the earth so that they might see how evil was the end of those who were before them?  They were stronger than these in power, and they tilled the soil and populated it more and better than these have populated it. And their Messengers came to them with manifest Signs. And ALLAH would not wrong them, but they wronged their own souls

10.Sher Ali: Then evil was the end of those who did evil, because, they rejected the Signs of ALLAH and scoffed at them

11.Sher Ali: ALLAH originates creation; then HE keeps repeating it; then to HIM shall you be brought back

12.Sher Ali: And on the day when the Hour will arrive the guilty shall be seized with despair

13.Sher Ali: And they shall have no intercessors from among those who they associate with ALLAH; and they will deny those whom they associate with HIM

14.Sher Ali: And on the day when the Hour will arrive - on that day they will become separated from one another

15.Sher Ali: Then those who believed and acted righteously will be honoured and made happy in stately gardens

16.Sher Ali: But as for those who disbelieved and rejected Our Signs and the meeting of the Hereafter, these shall be confronted with punishment

17.Sher Ali: So glorify ALLAH when you enter the evening and when you enter the morning

18.Sher Ali: And to HIM belongs all praise in the heavens and the earth - and glorify HIM in the afternoon and when you enter upon the time of the decline of the sun

19.Sher Ali: HE brings forth the living from the dead, and HE brings forth the dead from the living; and HE gives life to the earth after its death. And in like manner shall you be brought forth

20.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is that HE created you from dust; then behold, you are men spreading over the earth

21.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is that HE has created wives for you from among yourselves that you may find peace of mind in them, and HE has put love and tenderness between you. In that, surely, are Signs for a people who reflect

22.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your tongues and colours. In that, surely, are Signs for those who possess knowledge

23.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is your sleep by night, and by day, your seeking of HIS bounty. In that, surely, are Signs for a people who would listen

24.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is that HE shows you the lightning for fear and hope, and HE sends down water from the sky, and quickens therewith the earth after its death. In that, surely, are Signs for a people who understand

25.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is that the heavens and the earth stand firm by HIS command. Then when HE calls you by a single call to come forth from the earth, behold, you will come forth

26.Sher Ali: And to HIM belongs whosoever is in the heavens and the earth. All are obedient to HIM

27.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who originates the creation, then keeps repeating it, and it is most easy for HIM.  HIS is the most exalted state in the heavens and the earth; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

28.Sher Ali: HE sets forth for you a parable concerning yourselves. Have you, among those whom your right hands possess, partners in what WE have provided for you so that you become equal sharers therein, and you fear them as you fear each other?  Thus do WE explain the Signs to a people who understand

29.Sher Ali: Nay, but those, who are unjust, follow their own low desires without knowledge. Then who can guide him whom ALLAH lets go astray?  There will be no helpers for them

30.Sher Ali: So set thy face to the service of religion with single-minded devotion. And follow the nature made by ALLAH, the nature according to which HE has fashioned mankind. There is no altering the creation of ALLAH. That is the right religion - but most men know not

31.Sher Ali: So you all turn to HIM, in repentance, and seek HIS protection and observe Prayer, and be not of those who associate partners with ALLAH

32.Sher Ali: Of those who split up their religion and have become divided into sects, every party rejoicing in what they have

33.Sher Ali: And when an affliction befalls people, they cry unto their Lord, turning sincerely to HIM; then, when HE has made them taste of mercy from HIM, lo !  a section of them associate partners with their Lord

34.Sher Ali: So that they begin to deny that which WE have bestowed upon them. So enjoy yourselves awhile but soon you will come to know

35.Sher Ali: Have WE sent down to them any authority which speaks in favour of what they associate with HIM

36.Sher Ali: And when WE make people taste of mercy, they rejoice therein; but if some evil befalls them because of that which their own hands have sent on, behold !  they are in despair

37.Sher Ali: See they not that ALLAH enlarges the provision to whomsoever HE pleases and straitens it to whomsoever HE pleases? In that, truly, are Signs for a people who believe

38.Sher Ali: So give to the kinsman his due and to the needy and to the wayfarer. That is best for those who seek the favour of ALLAH, and it is they who will prosper

39.Sher Ali: Whatever you lay out at interest that it may increase the wealth of the people, it does not increase in the sight of ALLAH; but whatever you give in Zakat, seeking the pleasure of ALLAH - it is these who will increase their wealth manifold

40.Sher Ali: It is ALLAH Who has created you, and then HE has provided for you; then HE will cause you to die, and then HE will bring you to life. Is there any of your so-called associate-gods, who can do any of these things?  Glorified be HE and exalted far above that which they associate with HIM

41.Sher Ali: Corruption have spread on land and sea because of what men's hands has wrought, that HE may make them taste the fruit of some of their doings, so that they may turn back from evil

42.Sher Ali: Say, `Travel in the earth and see how evil was the end of those before you. Most of them were idolaters.

43.Sher Ali: So set thy face to the service of the right religion, before there comes the day from ALLAH for which there will be no averting. On that day believers and disbelievers will be separated from each other

44.Sher Ali: Those who disbelieve will bear the consequences of their disbelief; and those who do righteous deeds prepare good for their own souls

45.Sher Ali: That HE, out of HIS bounty, may reward those who believe and act righteously. Surely, HE loves not the disbelievers

46.Sher Ali: And of HIS Signs is that HE sends the winds as bearers of glad tidings and that HE may make you taste of HIS mercy, and that the ships may sail at HIS command, and that you may seek of HIS bounty, and that you may be grateful

47.Sher Ali: And, surely, WE sent Messengers before thee to their own people, and they brought them clear Signs. Then WE punished those who were guilty. And it was certainly incumbent upon US to help the believers

48.Sher Ali: It is ALLAH Who sends the winds so that they raise the vapours in the form of a cloud. Then HE spreads it in the sky as HE pleases, and then HE spreads it into fragments, and thou seest the rain issuing forth from its midst. And when HE causes it to fall on whom HE pleases of HIS servants, behold !  they rejoice

49.Sher Ali: Though before that - before it was sent down upon them -they were in despair

50.Sher Ali: Observe, then, the marks of ALLAH's mercy; how HE quickens the earth after its death. Verily, it is HE Who quickens the dead; for HE has power over all things

51.Sher Ali: And if WE had sent a wind and they saw their harvest turn yellow, they would, certainly thereafter, begin to deny Our favours

52.Sher Ali: And thou canst not make the dead to hear, nor canst thou make the deaf to hear the call, when they retreat turning their backs

53.Sher Ali: Nor canst thou guide the blind out of their error. Thou canst make only those to hear who would believe in Our Signs and submit

54.Sher Ali: ALLAH is HE Who created you in a state of weakness, and after weakness gave you strength; then, after strength, caused weakness and old age. HE creates what HE pleases. HE is the All-Knowing, the All-Powerful

55.Sher Ali: And on the day when the appointed Hour shall arrive, the guilty will swear that they tarried not save a brief period - thus are they turned away from the right path

56.Sher Ali: But those, who are given knowledge and faith, will say, `You have indeed tarried according to the Book of ALLAH, till the Day of Resurrection. And this indeed is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not care to know

57.Sher Ali: So on that day their excuses will not avail the wrongdoers; nor will they be allowed to make amends

58.Sher Ali: And, truly, WE have set forth for men in this Qur'an every type of parable, and indeed, if thou bring them a Sign, those who disbelieve will, surely, say, `You are but liars.

59.Sher Ali: Thus does ALLAH seal the hearts of those who have no knowledge

60.Sher Ali: So be thou patient. Surely, the promise of ALLAH is true; and let not those who have no certainty of faith hold thee in light estimation so as to move thee from the stand thou hast taken

1.Sher Ali: Alif, Lam, Mim

2.Sher Ali: These are the verses of the Book, full of wisdom

3.Sher Ali: A guidance and a mercy for those who do good

4.Sher Ali: Those who observe Prayer and pay the Zakat and who have firm faith in the Hereafter

5.Sher Ali: It is they who follow guidance from their Lord, and it is they who shall prosper

6.Sher Ali: And of men is he who takes idle tales in exchange for guidance to lead men astray from the path of ALLAH, without knowledge, and to make fun of it. For such there will be humiliating punishment

7.Sher Ali: And when Our Signs are recited to him, he turns away disdainfully, as though he heard them not, as if there were a heaviness in his ears.  So announce to him a painful punishment

8.Sher Ali: Surely, those who believe and do good works - they will have Gardens of Delight

9.Sher Ali: Wherein they will abide. ALLAH has made a true promise; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

10.Sher Ali: HE has created the heavens without any pillars that you can see, and HE has placed in the earth firm mountains that it may not quake with you, and HE has spread therein all kinds of creatures; and WE have sent down water from the clouds, and have caused to grow therein of every fine species

11.Sher Ali: This is the creation of ALLAH. Now show me what others beside HIM have created. Nay, but the wrongdoers are in manifest error

12.Sher Ali: And WE bestowed wisdom on Luqman and said, `Be grateful to ALLAH,' for, whoso is grateful, is grateful for the good of his own soul. And whoso is ungrateful, then, surely, ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy

13.Sher Ali: And call to mind when Luqman said to his son while he admonished him. `O my dear son !  Associate not partners with ALLAH.  Surely, associating partners with ALLAH is a grievous wrong
