14.Sher Ali: And we have enjoined on man to be good to his parents -his mother bears him in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning takes two years - and said, `Give thanks to ME and thy parents. Unto ME is the final return

15.Sher Ali: And if they contend with thee to make thee set up equals with ME concerning which thou hast no knowledge, obey them not, but be a kind companion to them in worldly affairs, and in spiritual matters follow the way of him who turns to ME. Then unto ME will be your return and I shall inform you of what you used to do

16.Sher Ali: `O my dear son, even though it be the weight of a grain of mustard seed, and even though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, ALLAH will, surely, bring it out. Verily, ALLAH is the knower of the most hidden secrets, and is All-Aware

17.Sher Ali: `O my dear son, observe Prayer and enjoin good and forbid evil and endure patiently whatever may befall thee. Surely, this is of those matters which require high resolve

18.Sher Ali: `And turn not thy cheek away from men in scorn, nor walk in the earth haughtily; Surely, ALLAH loves not the arrogant boaster

19.Sher Ali: `And walk thou at a moderate pace, and lower thy voice; verily, the most hateful of voices is the braying of the ass.

20.Sher Ali: Do you not see that ALLAH has pressed for you into service whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and has completed HIS favours on you, both visible and invisible? And among men there are some who dispute concerning ALLAH, without knowledge or guidance or an illuminating Book

21.Sher Ali: And when it is said to them, `Follow that which ALLAH has revealed,' they say, `Nay, we shall follow that which we found our fathers following.'  What !  even though Satan was inviting them to the punishment of the burning fire

22.Sher Ali: And he who submits himself wholly to ALLAH, and is a doer of good, he has, surely, grasped a firm handle. With ALLAH rest the end of all affairs

23.Sher Ali: And as for him who disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve thee. Unto US is their return and WE shall tell them that which they did. Surely, ALLAH knows full well what is in the breasts

24.Sher Ali: WE shall let them enjoy themselves for a while; then shall WE drive them to a severe torment

25.Sher Ali: And if thou ask them, `Who has created the heavens and the earth?' They will, surely, answer, `ALLAH.'  Say, `All praise belongs to ALLAH.' But most of them have no knowledge

26.Sher Ali: To ALLAH belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Verily, ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy

27.Sher Ali: And if all the trees that are in the earth were pens, and the ocean - seven more oceans to replenish it - were ink, the words of ALLAH would not be exhausted. Surely, ALLAH is Mighty, Wise

28.Sher Ali: Your creation and your resurrection are only like the creation and resurrection of a single soul. Verily, ALLAH is All-Hearing, All-Seeing

29.Sher Ali: Seest thou not that ALLAH makes the night pass into the day and makes the day pass into the night, and HE has pressed the sun and the moon into service; each pursuing its course till an appointed term, and that ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

30.Sher Ali: That is because it is ALLAH alone Who is the True God, and whatever they call upon beside HIM is false, and because it is ALLAH alone Who is the Most High, the Incomparably Great

31.Sher Ali: Dost thou not see that the ships sail on the sea by the favour of ALLAH, that HE may show you of HIS Signs?  Therein, surely, are Signs for every patient and grateful person

32.Sher Ali: And when waves engulf them like so many coverings, they call upon ALLAH, in full sincerity of faith; but when HE brings them to safe land, then some of them keep to the right course. And none denies Our Signs save every perfidious, ungrateful person

33.Sher Ali: O men, seek protection with your Lord and fear the day when the father will not be of any avail to his child, nor will the child at all be of any avail to his father. ALLAH's promise is, surely, true. So let not worldly life beguile you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you concerning ALLAH

34.Sher Ali: Verily, with ALLAH alone is the knowledge of the Hour. And HE sends down the rain, and HE knows what is in the wombs. And no soul knows what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul knows in what land it will die. Surely, ALLAH is All-Knowing, All-Aware

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Sher Ali: Alif, Lam, Mim

2.Sher Ali: The revelation of the Book - there is no doubt about it - is from the Lord of the worlds

3.Sher Ali: Do they say, `He has forged it?'  Nay, it is the truth from thy Lord, that thou mayest warn a people to whom no Warner has come before thee, that they may be guided

4.Sher Ali: ALLAH is HE Who created the heavens and the earth, and that which is between them, in six periods, then HE settled Himself on the Throne. You have no helper or intercessor beside HIM. Will you not then reflect

5.Sher Ali: HE will plan HIS ordinance from the heaven unto the earth, then will it go up to HIM in a day the duration of which is a thousand years according as you reckon

6.Sher Ali: Such is the knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Merciful

7.Sher Ali: Who has made perfect everything HE has created. And HE began the creation of man from clay

8.Sher Ali: Then HE made his progeny from an extract of an insignificant fluid

9.Sher Ali: Then HE endowed him with perfect faculties and breathed into him of HIS spirit. And HE has given you ears, and eyes, and hearts. But little thanks do you give

10.Sher Ali: And they say, `What !  when we are lost in the earth, shall we be raised up in the form of a new creation?'  Nay, but they disbelieve in the meeting with their Lord

11.Sher Ali: Say, `The angel of death that has been put in charge of you will cause you to die; then to your Lord will you be brought back.

12.Sher Ali: If only thou couldst see when the guilty ones will hang down their heads before their Lord, and say, `Our Lord, we have seen and we have heard, so send us back that we may do good works; for now we are convinced of the truth of what we were told.

13.Sher Ali: And if WE had enforced Our will, WE could have given every soul its appropriate guidance, but the word from ME has come true that I will fill Hell with jinn and men all together

14.Sher Ali: So taste ye the punishment of your evil deeds, for you forgot the meeting of this day of yours. We too, have forgotten you. Taste ye then the lasting punishment because of that which you used to do

15.Sher Ali: Only those really believe in Our Signs who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrate and celebrate the praises of their Lord, and they are not proud

16.Sher Ali: Their sides keep away from their beds; and they call on their Lord in fear and hope, and spend out of what WE have bestowed on them

17.Sher Ali: And no soul knows what joy of the eyes is kept hidden for them, as a reward for the good they used to do

18.Sher Ali: Is he, then, who is a believer like one who is disobedient?  they are not equal

19.Sher Ali: As for those who believe and do good works, they will have Gardens of Eternal Abode as an entertainment in return for what they used to do

20.Sher Ali: And as for those who are disobedient, their abode will be the Fire. Every time they desire to come out of it, they will be turned back into it, and it will be said to them, `Taste ye the punishment of the Fire which you used to deny.

21.Sher Ali: And most surely WE will make them taste of the lesser punishment before the greater punishment, that they may return to US with repentance

22.Sher Ali: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the Signs of his Lord and then turns away from them?  WE will, surely, exact retribution from the guilty

23.Sher Ali: And WE indeed gave Moses the Book - be not, therefore, in doubt about receiving a perfect Book thyself - and WE made it a guidance for the Children of Israel

24.Sher Ali: And WE appointed from among them leaders, who guided the people by Our command, because they were steadfast and had firm faith in Our Signs

25.Sher Ali: Verily, thy Lord - HE will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that in which they used to disagree

26.Sher Ali: Does it not furnish guidance to them how many a generation have WE destroyed before them, amid whose dwellings they now walk about?  In that, surely, are Signs. Will they not then listen

27.Sher Ali: Do they not see that WE drive the water to the dry land and produce thereby crops of which their cattle eat, and they themselves also?  Will they not then see

28.Sher Ali: And they say, `When will this victory come, if you are truthful?

29.Sher Ali: Say, `On the day of victory the faith of the disbelievers shall not avail them, nor will they be respited.

30.Sher Ali: So turn away from them, and wait. They are also waiting

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Sher Ali: O thou Prophet, seek protection in ALLAH, and follow not the wishes of the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Verily, ALLAH is All-Knowing, Wise

2.Sher Ali: And follow that which is revealed to thee from thy Lord. Verily, ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

3.Sher Ali: And put thy trust in ALLAH, and ALLAH is sufficient as a Guardian

4.Sher Ali: ALLAH has not made for any man two hearts in his breast; nor has HE made those of your wives from whom you keep away by calling them mothers, your mothers in fact, nor has HE made those whom you adopt as sons, your sons in fact. These are merely the words of your mouths; but ALLAH declares the truth, and HE guides to the right path

5.Sher Ali: Call them after their fathers. That is more equitable in the sight of ALLAH. But if you know not their fathers, then they are your brothers in Faith and your friends. And there is no blame on you in respect of any mistake you may unintentionally make in this matter; but you will be called to account for that which your hearts purpose. And ALLAH is Most Forgiving. Ever Merciful

6.Sher Ali: The Prophet is nearer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are as mothers to them. And blood-relations are nearer to one another, according to the Book of ALLAH, than other believers from among the Helpers and the Emigrants except that you show kindness to your friends. This is also written down in the Book

7.Sher Ali: And call to mind when WE took from the Prophets their covenant, and from thee, and from Noah and Abraham, and Moses and Jesus, son of Mary, and WE indeed, took from them a solemn covenant

8.Sher Ali: That ALLAH may question the truthful about their truthfulness. And for the disbelievers HE has prepared a painful punishment

9.Sher Ali: O ye who believe, remember the favour of ALLAH to you when there came against you hosts, and WE sent against them a wind and hosts that you saw not. And ALLAH sees what you do

10.Sher Ali: When they came upon you from above you, and from below you, and when your eyes became distracted, and your hearts reached up to your throats, and you thought diverse thoughts about ALLAH

11.Sher Ali: Then were the believers sorely tried, and they were shaken with a violent shaking

12.Sher Ali: And call to mind when the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts was a disease said, `ALLAH and HIS Messenger promised us only delusion;

13.Sher Ali: And when a party of them said, `O people of Yathrib, you can possibly make no stand against the enemy, therefore turn back. And a section of them even asked leave of the Prophet, say, `Our houses are exposed,' whereas they were not exposed. They only sought to flee

14.Sher Ali: If the enemy were to enter the Town from its environs, and then they were asked to join in the disturbance against the Muslims, they would certainly have done so, and would not have tarried in their houses save a little

15.Sher Ali: And truly they had already covenanted with ALLAH that they would not turn their backs. And a covenant with ALLAH will have to be answered for

16.Sher Ali: Say, `Flight shall not avail you if you flee from death or slaughter; and even then you will not be allowed to enjoy yourselves but a little.

17.Sher Ali: Say, `Who is it that can save you from ALLAH if it be HIS wish to do you harm, or can deprive you of it, if it be HIS wish to show you mercy?'  And they will not find for themselves any friend nor helper other than ALLAH

18.Sher Ali: Verily, ALLAH knows well those among you who hinder others from fighting and those who say to their brethren, `Come and be with us;' and they themselves come not to the fight but little

19.Sher Ali: Being niggardly of their help to you. But when danger comes, thou seest them looking towards thee, their eyes rolling like one who is fainting at the approach of death. But when the fear has passed away, they assail you with sharp tongues, being niggardly of any good coming to your way. These have never believed; so ALLAH has rendered their works null and void. And that is easy for ALLAH

20.Sher Ali: They still hope that the Confederates may not have gone away; and if the Confederates should come again, they would wish to be among the nomad Arabs in the desert, asking for news about you, they would fight but little

21.Sher Ali: Verily, you have in the Prophet of ALLAH an excellent model, for him who hopes to meet ALLAH and the Last Day and who remembers ALLAH much

22.Sher Ali: And when the believers saw the Confederates, they said, `This is what ALLAH and HIS Messenger promised us; and ALLAH and HIS Messenger spoke the truth.' And it only added to their faith and submission

23.Sher Ali: Among the believers are men who have been true to the covenant they had made with ALLAH. Some of them have fulfilled their vow, and there are others who wait, and they have not changed in the least

24.Sher Ali: That ALLAH may reward the truthful for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if HE so please, or turn to them in mercy. Verily, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

25.Sher Ali: And ALLAH turned back the disbelievers in their rage; they gained no good. And ALLAH sufficed the believers in their fight. ALLAH is Powerful, Mighty

26.Sher Ali: And HE brought those of the People of the Book who had aided them down from their fortresses, and cast terror into their hearts. Some you slew, and some you took captive

27.Sher Ali: And HE made you inherit their land and their houses and their wealth, and also a land on which you have not yet set foot. And ALLAH has power over all things

28.Sher Ali: O Prophet !  say to thy wives, `If you desire the life of this world and its adornment, come then, I will provide for you and send you away in a handsome manner

29.Sher Ali: `But if you desire ALLAH and HIS Messenger and the Home of the Hereafter, then, truly, ALLAH has prepared for those of you, who do good, a great reward.

30.Sher Ali: O wives of the Prophet ! if any of you be guilty of manifestly dishonourable conduct, the punishment will be doubled for her. And that is easy for ALLAH

31.Sher Ali: But whoever of you is obedient to ALLAH and HIS Messenger and does good works, WE shall give her reward twice over; and WE have prepared for her an honourable provision

32.Sher Ali: O wives of the Prophet ! you are not like any other women if you are righteous. So be not soft in speech, lest he, in whose heart is a disease, should feel tempted; and speak decent words

33.Sher Ali: And stay in your houses with dignity, and display not your beauty like the displaying of the former days of ignorance, and observe Prayer, and pay the Zakat, and obey ALLAH and HIS Messenger. Surely, ALLAH desires to remove from you all uncleanness, O Members of the Household, and purify you completely

34.Sher Ali: And remember what is rehearsed in your houses of the Signs of ALLAH and wisdom. Verily, ALLAH is Subtle, All-Aware

35.Sher Ali: Surely, men who submit themselves to GOD and women who submit themselves to HIM, and believing men and believing women, and obedient men and obedient women, and truthful men and truthful women, and men steadfast in their faith and steadfast women, and men who are humble and women who are humble, and men who give alms and women who give alms, and men who fast and women who fast, and men who guard their chastity and women who guard their chastity and men who remember ALLAH much and women who remember HIM - ALLAH has prepared for all of them forgiveness and a great reward

36.Sher Ali: And it behoves not a believing man or a believing woman, when ALLAH and HIS Messenger have decided a matter, that they should exercise their own choice in the matter concerning them. And whoso disobeys ALLAH and HIS Messenger, surely, strays away in manifest error

37.Sher Ali: And call to mind when thou didst say to him on whom ALLAH had bestowed favours and on whom thou also hadst bestowed favours: `Keep thy wife to thyself, and fear ALLAH,' and thou didst conceal in thy heart what ALLAH was going to bring to light, and thou didst fear the people, whereas ALLAH has better right that thou shouldst fear HIM. Then, when Zaid had accomplished his want concerning her, WE joined her in marriage to thee, so that there may be no difficulty for the believers with regard to marriage with the wives of their adopted sons, when they have accomplished their wants concerning them. And ALLAH's decree was bound to be fulfilled

38.Sher Ali: No blame can attach to the Prophet with respect to that which ALLAH has made incumbent upon him. Such, indeed, was the way of ALLAH with those who have passed before - and the command of ALLAH is a decree ordained

39.Sher Ali: Those who delivered the Messages of ALLAH and feared HIM, and feared none but ALLAH.  And sufficient is ALLAH as a reckoner

40.Sher Ali: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of ALLAH, and the seal of the Prophets and ALLAH has full knowledge of all things

41.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  remember ALLAH much

42.Sher Ali: And glorify HIM morning and evening

43.Sher Ali: HE it is Who sends down HIS blessing on you, and HIS angels pray for you, that HE may bring you forth from all kinds of darkness into light. And HE is Merciful to the believers

44.Sher Ali: Their greeting on the day, when they meet HIM, will be `Peace.' And HE has prepared for them an honourable reward

45.Sher Ali: O Prophet !  truly WE have sent thee as a Witness and a Bearer of glad tidings, and a Warner

46.Sher Ali: And as a Summoner unto ALLAH by HIS command, and as a light-giving Lamp

47.Sher Ali: And announce to the believers the glad tidings that they will have great bounty from ALLAH

48.Sher Ali: And follow not the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and overlook their annoying talk and put thy trust in ALLAH; for ALLAH is sufficient as a guardian

49.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then you have no right to reckon the period of waiting with regard to them. So make some provision for them and send them away in a handsome manner

50.Sher Ali: O Prophet !  WE have made lawful to thee thy wives whom thou hast paid their dowries, and those whom thy right hand possesses from among those whom ALLAH has given thee as gains of war, and the daughters of thy paternal uncle, and the daughters of thy paternal aunts, and the daughters of thy maternal uncle, and the daughters of thy maternal aunts who have emigrated with thee and any other believing woman if she offers herself for marriage to the Prophet provided the Prophet desires to marry her; this provision is only for thee, and not for other believers - WE have already made known what WE have enjoined on them concerning their wives and those whom their right hands possess - in order that there may be no difficulty for thee in explaining the Law to them. And ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

51.Sher Ali: Thou mayest put aside any of them that thou pleasest, and keep with thyself whom thou pleasest; and if thou desirest to take back any of those whom thou hast put aside, there is no blame on thee. That is more likely that their eyes may be cooled, and that they may not grieve, and that they may all be pleased with that which thou hast given them. And ALLAH knows what is in your hearts; and ALLAH is All-Knowing, Forbearing

52.Sher Ali: It is not allowed to thee to marry women after that, nor to change them for other wives even, though their goodness please thee, except any that thy right hand possesses. And ALLAH is Watchful over all things

53.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  enter not the houses of the Prophet unless leave is granted to you for a meal, not waiting till it is cooked. But enter when you are invited, and when you have had your meal, disperse, without seeking to engage in talk. That causes inconvenience to the Prophet, and he feels shy of asking you to leave, but ALLAH is not shy of saying what is true. And when you ask them - the wives of the Prophet - for anything, ask them from behind a curtain. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it behoves you not to cause inconvenience to the Messenger of ALLAH, nor that you should ever marry his wives after him. That, indeed, is a monstrous thing in the sight of ALLAH

54.Sher Ali: Whether you disclose a thing or conceal it, ALLAH knows all things well

55.Sher Ali: There is no blame on them in this respect with regard to their fathers or their sons or their brothers, or the sons of their brothers, or the sons of their sisters, or their womenfolk or those whom their right hands possess. And fear ALLAH, O wives of the Prophet. Verily, ALLAH is a Witness over all things

56.Sher Ali: ALLAH sends down HIS blessings on the Prophet and HIS angels pray for him. O ye who believe, you too should invoke HIS blessings on him and salute him with the salutation of peace

57.Sher Ali: Verily, those who malign ALLAH and HIS Messenger - ALLAH has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter, and has prepared for them an abasing punishment

58.Sher Ali: And those, who malign believing men and believing women for what they have not earned, shall bear the guilt of a calumny and a manifest sin

59.Sher Ali: O Prophet ! tell thy wives and thy daughters, and the women of the believers, that they should pull down upon them of their outer cloaks from their heads over their faces. That is more likely that they may thus be recognized and not molested. And ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

60.Sher Ali: If the Hypocrites and those in whose hearts is a disease and those who cause agitation in the City by spreading false rumours, desist not, WE shall, surely, urge thee on against them; then they will not dwell therein as thy neighbours save for a little while

61.Sher Ali: They are accursed. Wherever they are found they will be seized, and cut into pieces

62.Sher Ali: Such has been the way of ALLAH with those who passed away before, and never thou wilt find a change in the way of ALLAH

63.Sher Ali: People ask thee concerning the Hour. Say, `The knowledge of it is with ALLAH alone.' And what will make thee know that the Hour may be nigh

64.Sher Ali: ALLAH has, surely, cursed the disbelievers, and has prepared for them a blazing fire

65.Sher Ali: Wherein they will abide forever. They will find therein no friend, nor helper

66.Sher Ali: On the day when their faces are turned over into the fire they will say, `O, would that we had obeyed ALLAH and obeyed the Messenger !

67.Sher Ali: And they will say, `Our Lord, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones and they led us astray from the way

68.Sher Ali: `Our Lord, give them double punishment and curse them with a mighty curse.

69.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  be not like those who maligned Moses; but ALLAH cleared of what they said about him. And he had a great position in the sight of ALLAH

70.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  Fear ALLAH and say the straightforward word

71.Sher Ali: HE will set right you actions for you and forgive you your sins. And whoso obeys ALLAH and HIS Messenger shall, surely, attain a supreme triumph

72.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have offered the trust of the Divine Law to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to bear it and were afraid of it. But man bore it. Indeed, he is capable of being unjust to, and neglectful of, himself

73.Sher Ali: The consequence is that ALLAH will punish hypocritical men and hypocritical women, and idolatrous men and idolatrous women; and ALLAH turns in Mercy to believing men and believing women; and ALLAH is Most forgiving Merciful

1.Sher Ali: All praise is due to ALLAH, to Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth. And HIS is All praise in the Hereafter; and HE is the Wise, the All-Aware

2.Sher Ali: He knows whatever goes into the earth and whatever comes forth from it, and whatever descends from the heaven and whatever ascends into it; and HE is Merciful, Most Forgiving

3.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say, `The Hour will never come upon us.' Say, `Yea, by my Lord who knows the unseen, it will, surely, come upon you. Not an atom's weight in the heavens or in the earth or anything less than that or greater escapes HIM , but all is recorded in a perspicuous Book

4.Sher Ali: That HE may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. It is these who will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.

5.Sher Ali: But as to those who strive against Our Signs, seeking to frustrate Our plans, it is they for whom there will be the torment of a painful punishment

6.Sher Ali: And those who are given knowledge see that whatever has been revealed to thee from thy Lord is the truth, and that it guides unto the path of the Mighty, the Praiseworthy

7.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say, `Shall we show you a man who will tell you that when you are broken up into pieces, you shall be raised as a new creation?

8.Sher Ali: `Has he forged a lie against ALLAH or is he afflicted with madness?'  Nay, but those who believe not in the Hereafter are already suffering the punishment and are too far gone in error

9.Sher Ali: Do they not see how they are encompassed by that which is before them and that which is behind them of the heaven and the earth?  If WE please, WE could cause the earth to sink with them, or cause pieces of the sky to fall upon them. In that verily is a Sign for every repentant servant of ALLAH

10.Sher Ali: And certainly, We bestowed grace upon David from US and said, `O ye mountains, celebrate the praises of ALLAH with him, and O birds, ye also.' And WE made the iron soft for him

11.Sher Ali: And WE said, `Make thou full-length coats of mail, and make the rings of a proper measure. And act righteously, surely I see all that you do.

12.Sher Ali: And to Solomon WE subjected the wind; its morning course was a month's journey and its evening course was a month's journey too. And WE caused a fount of molten copper to flow for him. And of the jinn were some who worked under him by the command of his Lord. And WE said that whoever of them turned away from Our command, WE would make him taste the punishment of the burning fire

13.Sher Ali: They made for him what he desired - places of worship and statues, and basins like reservoirs, and large cooking vessels fixed in their places. And WE said, act gratefully, O House of David, but few of MY servants are grateful

14.Sher Ali: And when WE decreed his (Solomon's) death, nothing indicated to them that he was dead save a worm of the earth that ate away his staff.  So when it fell down, the jinn plainly realized that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in a state of degrading torment

15.Sher Ali: There was, indeed, a Sign for Saba in their homeland -two gardens, one on the right hand and one on the left; and WE said to them, `Eat of the provision of your Lord and give thanks to HIM. Your town is a beautiful town and your Lord Most Forgiving

16.Sher Ali: But they turned away; so WE sent against them a devastating flood. And WE gave them, in place of their two excellent gardens, two gardens bearing bitter fruit and containing tamarisk and a few lote-trees

17.Sher Ali: Thus WE requited them because of their ingratitude; and it is only the ungrateful that WE requite in this manner

18.Sher Ali: And WE placed, between them and the towns which WE had blessed, other towns that were prominently visible, and WE fixed easy stages between them and said: `Travel in them by night and day in security.

19.Sher Ali: But instead of giving thanks to God, they said, `Our Lord, place longer distances between the stages of our journeys.' And they wronged themselves; so WE made them bywords and WE broke them into pieces, an utter breaking up. In that, verily, are Signs for every steadfast and grateful person

20.Sher Ali: And Iblis, indeed, found true his judgment concerning them, so they followed him, all except a party of true believers

21.Sher Ali: And he had no power over them, but it was so that WE might distinguish those who believed in the Hereafter from those who were in doubt about it. And thy Lord is watchful over all things

22.Sher Ali: Say, `Call upon those whom you assert to be gods beside ALLAH. They control not even the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth, nor have they any share in either, nor has HE any helper among them.

23.Sher Ali: No intercession avails with HIM, except of him whom HE permits it, until when the hearts of those who are granted permission to intercede are relieved of awe, others would say, `What is that your Lord said?'  They will answer, `The truth.' And HE is the High, the Great

24.Sher Ali: Say, `Who gives you sustenance from the heavens and the earth?'  Say, `ALLAH. Either WE or you are on right guidance or in manifest error

25.Sher Ali: Say, `You will not be questioned as to our sins, nor shall we be questioned as to what you do.

26.Sher Ali: Say, `Our Lord will bring us all together, then HE will judge between us with truth, and HE is the Best Judge, the All-Knowing.

27.Sher Ali: Say, `Show me those whom you have joined with HIM as associates.' Nay !  that cannot be, for HE is ALLAH, the Mighty, the Wise

28.Sher Ali: And WE have not sent thee but as a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner for all mankind, but most men know not

29.Sher Ali: And they say, `When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truthful?

30.Sher Ali: Say, `For you is the promise of a day from which you cannot remain behind a single moment, nor can you get ahead of it.

31.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve say, `We will never believe in this Qur'an nor in what is before it.' Couldst thou but see when the wrongdoers will be made to stand before their Lord, casting the blame on one another?  Those who were deemed weak will say to those who were arrogant, `Had it not been for you, we should, surely, have been believers

32.Sher Ali: Those who were big with pride will say to those who were considered weak, `Was it we that kept you away from the guidance, after it had come to you?  Nay, it was you yourselves who were guilty.

33.Sher Ali: And those who were deemed weak will say to those who were proud, `Nay, but it was your scheming night and day, when you bade us disbelieve in ALLAH and set up equals with HIM.'  And they will conceal their remorse when they see the punishment; and WE shall put chains round the necks of those who disbelieved. They will not be requited but for what they did

34.Sher Ali: And WE never sent a Warner to any city but the wealthy ones thereof said, `Surely, we disbelieve in what you have been sent with.

35.Sher Ali: And they say, `We have more wealth and children; and we shall not be punished.

36.Sher Ali: Say, `Verily, my Lord enlarges the provision for whomsoever HE pleases, and straitens it for whomsoever HE pleases; but most men do not know.

37.Sher Ali: And it is not your wealth, nor your children that will bring you near US in rank but those, who believe and do good works, will have a double reward for what they did. And in lofty mansions will they be secure

38.Sher Ali: And as to those who strive to frustrate the purpose of Our Signs, it is they who will be brought to face punishment

39.Sher Ali: Say, `Surely, my Lord enlarges the provision for such of HIS servants as HE pleases and straitens it for such of them as HE pleases. And whatever you spend, HE will replace it; and HE is the Best of providers

40.Sher Ali: And remember the day, when HE will gather them all together; then HE will say to the angels, `Was it you that they worshiped?

41.Sher Ali: They will say, `Holy art Thou. Thou art our Protector against them. Nay, but they worshiped the jinn; it was in them that most of them believed.

42.Sher Ali: It will be said to disbelievers, `So, this day, you will have no power either to profit or harm one another. And WE shall say to those who did wrong:  `Taste ye the punishment of the Fire that you denied.

43.Sher Ali: And when Our manifest Signs are recited to them, they say, `This is but a man who seeks to turn you away from that which your fathers worshiped.' And they say, `This Qur'an is but a forged lie.' And those who disbelieve say about the truth when it comes to them, `This is nothing but manifest sorcery.

44.Sher Ali: And WE gave them no Books which they studied, nor did WE send to them any Warner before thee

45.Sher Ali: And those who were before them also rejected the truth and these have not attained even to a tenth of the power which WE gave them, but they rejected MY Messengers. So they shall see how terrible are the consequences of denying ME

46.Sher Ali: Say, `I only exhort you to do only one thing: that you stand up before ALLAH in twos and singly and reflect. You will then realize that there is no insanity in your companion; he is only a Warner to you of an impending severe punishment.

47.Sher Ali: Say, `Whatever reward I might have asked of you - let it be yours. My reward is only with ALLAH; and HE is Witness over all thing.

48.Sher Ali: Say, `Truly, My Lord hurls the Truth at falsehood and breaks it into pieces. HE is the Great knower of the unseen.

49.Sher Ali: Say, `The truth has come and falsehood could neither originate anything, nor reproduce it

50.Sher Ali: Say, If I err, I err only against myself; and if I am rightly guided, it is because of what my Lord revealed to me. Verily, HE is All-Hearing, Nigh.

51.Sher Ali: Couldst thou but see when they will be smitten with fear? Then there will be no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby

52.Sher Ali: And they will say, `We now believe therein.' But how can they attain faith from a position so far off

53.Sher Ali: They had disbelieved in it before, while they indulged in conjectures with regard to the unseen from a far off-place

54.Sher Ali: And a barrier will be placed between them and that which they long for, as was done with the like of them before. They too were in disquieting doubt

1.Sher Ali: All praise belongs to ALLAH, the originator of the heavens  and the earth, Who employs the angels as Messengers, having wings, two, three, and four. HE adds to HIS creation whatever HE pleases; for ALLAH has power over all things

2.Sher Ali: Whatever sources of mercy ALLAH lays open for mankind -there is none to withhold them; and whatever of such sources HE withholds, there is none who can release them after that; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

3.Sher Ali: O ye men, remember the favour of ALLAH that HE has bestowed upon you. Is there any creator other than ALLAH who provides for you from the heaven and the earth?  There is none worthy of worship but HE. Wither then are you turned away

4.Sher Ali: And if they reject thee, verily, God's Messengers have been rejected before thee; and unto ALLAH all matters are brought back for decision

5.Sher Ali: O ye men, assuredly the promise of ALLAH is true, so let not the present life deceive you, nor let the Deceiver deceive you with respect to ALLAH

6.Sher Ali: Surely, Satan is an enemy to you; so treat him as an enemy. He calls his followers only that they may become the inmates of the burning Fire

7.Sher Ali: For those who disbelieve there is a severe punishment. And for those who believe and do righteous deeds there is forgiveness and a great reward

8.Sher Ali: Can he, then, to whom the evil of his conduct is made to appear pleasing, so that he looks upon it as good, be like him who believes and does good deeds?  Surely, ALLAH lets go astray whom HE wills and guides whom HE wills. So let not thy soul waste away in sorrow for them. Surely, ALLAH know what they do

9.Sher Ali: And ALLAH is HE who sends the winds which raise the clouds; then do WE drive them to a lifeless tract of land, and quicken therewith the earth after its death. Likewise shall the Resurrection be

10.Sher Ali: Whoso desires honour, let him know that all honour belongs to ALLAH. Unto HIM ascend pure words, and righteous deeds does HE exalt, and those who plan evils - for them is a severe punishment; and the planning of such will perish

11.Sher Ali: And ALLAH created you from dust, then from a sperm drop, then HE made you pairs. And no female conceives, nor does she bring forth a child save with HIS knowledge. And no one is granted long life who is granted long life, nor is anything diminished of his life, but it is all recorded in a  Book. That surely is easy for ALLAH

12.Sher Ali: And the two seas are not alike: this one palatable, sweet and pleasant to drink and this other saltish, bitter. And yet from each you eat fresh meat, and take forth ornaments which you wear. And thou seest the ships therein ploughing the waves that you may seek of HIS bounty, and that you may be grateful

13.Sher Ali: HE merges the night into the day, and HE merges the day into the night. And HE has pressed into service the sun and the moon, each runs its course to an appointed term. Such is ALLAH, your Lord; His is the Kingdom, and those whom you call upon beside ALLAH own not even a whit

14.Sher Ali: If you call on them, they will not hear your call; and even if they heard it, they could not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your having associated them with ALLAH. And none can inform thee like the One Who is All-Aware

15.Sher Ali: O men, it is you who are dependent upon ALLAH, but ALLAH is HE Who is Self-Sufficient, the Praiseworthy

16.Sher Ali: If HE please, HE could destroy you, and bring a new creation instead

17.Sher Ali: And that is not at all difficult for ALLAH

18.Sher Ali: And no burdened soul can bear the burden of another; and if a heavily laden soul call another to bear its load, naught of it shall be carried by the other, even though he be a kinsman. Thou canst warn only those who fear their Lord in secret and observe Prayer, And whoso purifies himself, purifies himself only to his own good; and to ALLAH shall be the return

19.Sher Ali: The blind and the seeing are not alike

20.Sher Ali: Nor the darkness and the light

21.Sher Ali: Nor the shade and the heat

22.Sher Ali: Nor alike are the living and the dead. Surely, ALLAH causes him to hear whom HE pleases; and thou canst not make those hear who are in the graves

23.Sher Ali: Thou art only a warner

24.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have sent thee with the Truth, as a bearer of glad tidings and as a Warner; and there is no people to whom a Warner has not been sent

25.Sher Ali: And if they treat thee as a liar, those who were before them also treated their Messengers as liars. Their Messengers came to them with clear Signs, and with the Scriptures, and with the illuminating Book

26.Sher Ali: Then I seized those who disbelieved, and how terrible were the consequences of denying ME

27.Sher Ali: Dost thou not see that ALLAH sends down water from the sky, and WE bring forth therewith fruits of different colours; and in the mountains are streaks white and red, of diverse hues, and others raven black

28.Sher Ali: And in the like manner, there are men and beasts and cattle, of various colours. Only those of HIS servants who are endowed with knowledge fear ALLAH. Verily, ALLAH is Mighty, Most forgiving

29.Sher Ali: Surely, only those who follow the Book of ALLAH and observe Prayer and spend out of what WE have provided for them, secretly and in public, look for a bargain which will never fail

30.Sher Ali: In order that HE may give them their full rewards, and even increase them out of HIS bounty. HE is, surely, Most Forgiving, Most Appreciating

31.Sher Ali: And the Book which WE have revealed to thee is the truth itself, fulfilling that which is before it. Surely, ALLAH is All-Aware of HIS servants, All-Seeing concerning HIS servants

32.Sher Ali: Then WE have always made inheritors of the Book those of Our servants whom WE choose. Some of them are hard upon themselves and of them are some who take the middle course, and of them are some who excel others in deeds of goodness by ALLAH's leave. And that indeed is the great grace from ALLAH

33.Sher Ali: Their reward will be Gardens of Eternity. They will enter them and will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl; and their garments therein will be of silk

34.Sher Ali: And they will say, `All praise belongs to ALLAH Who has removed all grief from us. Surely, our Lord is Most Forgiving, Most Appreciating

35.Sher Ali: `Who has, out of HIS bounty, settled us in the Abode of Eternity, where no toil will touch us, nor any sense of weariness affect us therein.

36.Sher Ali: But as for those who disbelieve, for them is the fire of Hell. Death will not be decreed for them so that they may die; nor will the punishment thereof be lightened for them. Thus do WE requite every ungrateful person

37.Sher Ali: And they will cry for help therein: `Our Lord, take us out, we will do righteous deeds other than those we used to do.' ALLAH will say to them, `Did WE not give you a life long enough so that he, who would take heed, could take heed therein?  And there came unto you a Warner too. So taste ye the punishment; for the wrongdoers have no helper.

38.Sher Ali: Verily, ALLAH knows all that is hidden in the heavens and the earth and HE knows well what passes in the minds of people

39.Sher Ali: He it is Who made you successors in the earth of those who have passed away. So he, who disbelieves, will himself suffer the consequences of his disbelief. Their disbelief will bring the disbelievers no increase in the sight of their Lord except HIS displeasure, and their disbelief will increase for the disbelievers nothing but loss

40.Sher Ali: Say, `Have you seen your associate-gods whom you call on beside ALLAH?  Show me, then, what they have created of the earth. Or they have a share in the creation of the heavens?  Or, have WE given them a Book so that they have an evidence therefrom?'  Nay, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusion

41.Sher Ali: Surely, ALLAH holds the heavens and the earth lest they deviate from their positions. And if they did deviate, none can hold them back but HE. Verily, HE is Forbearing, Most Forgiving

42.Sher Ali: And they swore by ALLAH their strongest oaths, that if a Warner came to them, they would follow guidance better than any other people. But when a Warner did come to them, it only increased them in aversion

43.Sher Ali: For, they sought exaltation in the earth and devised evil schemes. But the evil schemes encompass none but the authors thereof. Do they, then, look for anything other than ALLAH's way of dealing with the people of old?  But thou wilt never find any change in the way of ALLAH; nor wilt thou ever find any alteration in the way of ALLAH

44.Sher Ali: Have they not traveled in the earth and seen how evil was the end of those who were before them?  And they were stronger than these in power. And ALLAH is not such that anything in the heavens or the earth can frustrate HIS plans; verily, HE is All-Knowing, All-Powerful

45.Sher Ali: And if ALLAH were to punish people for what they do, HE would not leave a living creature on the surface of the earth; but HE gives them respite until an appointed term; and when their appointed time comes they find that ALLAH has all HIS servants well under HIS eyes

1.Sher Ali: Ya Sin

2.Sher Ali: By the Qur'an, full of wisdom

3.Sher Ali: Thou art, indeed, one of the Messengers

4.Sher Ali: On the right path

5.Sher Ali: This is a revelation from the Mighty, the Merciful

6.Sher Ali: That thou mayest warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and so they are heedless

7.Sher Ali: Surely, the word has proved true against most of them, for they believe not

8.Sher Ali: WE have put round their necks collars reaching unto their chins, so that their heads are raised up

9.Sher Ali: And WE have set a barrier before them and a barrier behind them, and have covered them over, so that they cannot see

10.Sher Ali: Alike it is to them whether thou warn them or warn them not; they will not believe

11.Sher Ali: Thou canst warn only him who would follow the Reminder and fear the Gracious God in secret. So give him the glad tidings of forgiveness and a noble reward

12.Sher Ali: Surely, WE alone give life to the dead, and WE write down that which they send forward and that which they leave behind; and all things WE have recorded in a clear Book

13.Sher Ali: And set forth to them the parable of a people of the town, when the Messengers came to it

14.Sher Ali: When WE sent to them two Messengers they rejected them both; so WE strengthened them by a third; and they said, `Verily, we have been sent to you as Messengers.

15.Sher Ali: They replied, `You are only human beings like us and the Gracious God has not revealed anything. You are only lying.

16.Sher Ali: They said, `Our Lord knows that we are, indeed HIS Messengers to you

17.Sher Ali: `And our duty is only plain delivery of the Message.

18.Sher Ali: The disbelievers said, `Surely, we augur evil fortune from you; if you desist not, we will, certainly, stone you, and a painful punishment will, surely, befall you at our hands.

19.Sher Ali: The Messengers replied, `Your evil fortune is with your ownselves. Do you say this because you have been admonished?  Nay, you are a people transgressing all bounds.

20.Sher Ali: And from the farthest part of the town there came a man running. He said, `O my People, follow the Messengers

21.Sher Ali: `Follow those who ask of you no reward, and who are rightly guided

22.Sher Ali: `And why should I not worship HIM Who has created me, and unto Whom you will be brought back

23.Sher Ali: `Shall I take others beside HIM as gods?  If the Gracious God should intend me any harm, their intercession will avail me naught, nor can they rescue me

24.Sher Ali: `In that case I should, indeed, be in manifest error

25.Sher Ali: `I believe in your Lord; so listen to me.

26.Sher Ali: It was said to him, Do thou enter Paradise.'  He said, `O, would that my people knew

27.Sher Ali: `How graciously my Lord has granted me forgiveness and has made me of the honoured ones !

28.Sher Ali: And WE sent not down against his people, after him, any host from heaven, nor do WE send down any such

29.Sher Ali: It was but a single blast and lo !  they were extinct

30.Sher Ali: Alas for my servants !  there comes not a Messenger to them but they mock at him

31.Sher Ali: Do they not see how many generations WE have destroyed before them, and that they never come back to them

32.Sher Ali: And all of them, gathered together, will certainly be brought before US

33.Sher Ali: And the dead earth is a Sign for them; WE quicken it and bring forth therefrom grain, of which they eat

34.Sher Ali: And WE have placed in it Gardens of date-palms and grapes, and WE have caused springs to gush forth therein

35.Sher Ali: That they may eat of the fruit thereof, and it was not there hands that made them grow up. Will they not then be grateful

36.Sher Ali: Holy is HE Who created all things in pairs, of what the earth grows and of themselves, and of what they know not

37.Sher Ali: And a Sign for them is the night from which WE strip off the day, and lo !  they are left in darkness

38.Sher Ali: And the sun is moving on to its determined goal. That is the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing God

39.Sher Ali: And for the moon WE have appointed stages, till it becomes again like an old dry twig of a palm-tree

40.Sher Ali: It is not for the sun to overtake the moon, nor can the night outstrip the day. All of them float smoothly in an orbit

41.Sher Ali: And a Sign for them is that WE carry their offspring in the laden ships

42.Sher Ali: And WE will create for them the like thereof whereon they will ride

43.Sher Ali: And if WE so willed, WE could drown them; then they would have no one to succour them, nor would they be rescued

44.Sher Ali: Except through mercy from US and a provision for a time

45.Sher Ali: And when it is said to them, `Guard yourselves against that which is before you through Prayer and that which is behind you through repentance, that you may receive mercy,' they turn away

46.Sher Ali: And there comes not to them any Sign out of the Signs of their Lord, but they turn away from it

47.Sher Ali: And when it is said to them, `Spend out of that which ALLAH has given you,' those who disbelieve say to those who believe, `Shall we feed him whom ALLAH would have fed, if HE had so willed?  You are but in manifest error.

48.Sher Ali: And they say, `When will this promise of punishment be fulfilled, if you are truthful?

49.Sher Ali: They are waiting only for a single blast which will seize them while they are still disputing

50.Sher Ali: And they will not be able to make a will nor will they return to their families

51.Sher Ali: And the trumpet shall be blown, and lo !  from the graves they will hasten on to their Lord

52.Sher Ali: They will say to one another, `O woe to us !  who has raised us from our place of sleep?  This is what the Gracious God had promised, and the Messengers, indeed, spoke the truth.

53.Sher Ali: It will be one blast and lo !  they will all be brought before US

54.Sher Ali: And on that day no soul will be wronged in aught; nor will you be requited but for what you used to do

55.Sher Ali: Verily, the inmates of heaven will, on that day, be happy in their occupation

56.Sher Ali: They and their wives will be in pleasant shades, reclining on raised couches

57.Sher Ali: They will have fruits therein, and they will have whatever they call for

58.Sher Ali: They will be greeted with Peace - a word of greeting from the Merciful Lord

59.Sher Ali: And God will say, `Separate yourselves from the righteous this day, O ye guilty ones

60.Sher Ali: `Did I not enjoin on you, O ye sons of Adam, that you worship not Satan - for he is to you an open enemy

61.Sher Ali: `And that you worship ME?  This is the right path

62.Sher Ali: `And he did lead astray a great multitude of you. Why did you not then understand

63.Sher Ali: `This is Hell which you were promised

64.Sher Ali: `Enter it this day because you disbelieved.

65.Sher Ali: This day we shall put a seal on their mouths, and their hands will speak to US, and their feet will bear witness to what they had earned

66.Sher Ali: And if WE had so willed, WE could have put out their eyes, then they would have rushed unseeing to find the way. But, how could they see

67.Sher Ali: And if WE had so willed, WE could have transformed them in their places, then they would not be able to move forward or turn back

68.Sher Ali: And him whom WE grant long life - WE revert him to a weak state in creation. Will they not then understand

69.Sher Ali: And WE have not taught him poetry, nor does it behove him to be a poet. It is but a reminder and a Qur'an that expounds and makes things plain

70.Sher Ali: That it may warn all who are alive, and that the decree of ALLAH may be fulfilled concerning the disbelievers

71.Sher Ali: Do they not see that, among the things which Our hands have wrought, WE have created for them cattle of which they are masters

72.Sher Ali: And WE have subjected the same to them, so that some of them they use for riding, and of the flesh of some they eat

73.Sher Ali: And in them they have other uses, and also drinks. Will they not, then, be grateful

74.Sher Ali: And they have taken other gods beside ALLAH that they might be helped

75.Sher Ali: But they are not able to help them. On the contrary, they will be brought before God in a body to bear witness against them

76.Sher Ali: So let not their speech grieve thee. Verily, WE know what they conceal and what they proclaim

77.Sher Ali: Does not man see that WE have created him from a mere sperm-drop?  Then lo !  he is an open quarreler

78.Sher Ali: And he coins similitudes for US and forgets his own creation. He says, `Who can quicken the bones when they are decayed?

79.Sher Ali: Say, `HE, Who created them the first time, will quicken them; and HE knows well the condition of every created thing

80.Sher Ali: HE Who produces for you fire out of the green tree, and behold, you kindle from it

81.Sher Ali: Has not HE who created the heavens and the earth the power to create the like of them?'  Yea, and HE is, indeed, the Supreme Creator, the All-Knowing

82.Sher Ali: Verily, HIS command, when HE intends a thing, is only that HE says concerning it, `Be,' and it comes into being

83.Sher Ali: So Holy is HE, in Whose hand is the dominion of all things. And to HIM will you be brought back

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Sher Ali: By those who range themselves in close ranks

2.Sher Ali: And those who repel evil vigorously

3.Sher Ali: And those who recite the Reminder - the Qur'an

4.Sher Ali: Surely, your God is One

5.Sher Ali: Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them and the Lord of the places from which light spreads forth

6.Sher Ali: WE have adorned the lowest heaven with an adornment - the planets

7.Sher Ali: And have guarded it against all rebellious satans

8.Sher Ali: They cannot listen to anything from the Exalted Assembly of angels - and they are pelted from every side

9.Sher Ali: Repulsed, and for them is a perpetual punishment

10.Sher Ali: But if any of them snatches away something by stealth, he is pursued by a piecing flame

11.Sher Ali: So ask them whether it is they who are harder to create, or those others whom WE have created?  Them WE have created of cohesive clay

12.Sher Ali: Nay, thou dost wonder at what they say, and they ridicule what thou sayest

13.Sher Ali: And when they are admonished, they pay no heed

14.Sher Ali: And when they see a Sign, they mock at it

15.Sher Ali: And they say, this is nothing but plain sorcery

16.Sher Ali: `What !  when we are dead and have become dust and broken bones, shall we then be raised up again

17.Sher Ali: `And our fathers of yore also?

18.Sher Ali: Say, `Yea; and you will, then, be abased.

19.Sher Ali: It will be but one stern call, and lo !  they will be up and seeing

20.Sher Ali: And they will say, `Alas for us !  this is the Day of Requital.

21.Sher Ali: ALLAH will say, `This is the day of the final Decision which you used to deny.

22.Sher Ali: The angels will be commanded: `Assemble those who acted wrongfully along with their companions and what they used to worshi

23.Sher Ali: `Beside ALLAH; and lead them along the path of Hell

24.Sher Ali: `And stop them, for they shall be questioned.

25.Sher Ali: They will be asked, `What is the matter with you that you help not one another?

26.Sher Ali: Nay, on that day they will surrender themselves completely

27.Sher Ali: And some of them will address others, questioning one another

28.Sher Ali: They will say, `Verily you used to come to us from the right.

29.Sher Ali: The others will answer, `Nay, you yourselves were not believers

30.Sher Ali: `And we had no power over you; but you yourselves were a transgressing people

31.Sher Ali: `Now the word of our Lord has been fulfilled against us that we must taste the punishment

32.Sher Ali: `And we caused you to go astray for we ourselves had gone astray.

33.Sher Ali: Truly, on that day they will all be sharers in the punishment

34.Sher Ali: Surely, thus do WE deal with the guilty

35.Sher Ali: For when it was said to them, `There is no god but ALLAH, they behaved arrogantly

36.Sher Ali: And said, `Shall we give up our gods for a mad poet?

37.Sher Ali: Nay, he has brought the truth and has testified to the truth of all the Messengers

38.Sher Ali: You shall, surely, taste the painful punishment

39.Sher Ali: And you will be requited only for what you have wrought

40.Sher Ali: Save the chosen servants of ALLAH

41.Sher Ali: They will have a known provision

42.Sher Ali: Fruits; and they shall be honoured

43.Sher Ali: In the Gardens of Bliss

44.Sher Ali: Seated on thrones, facing one another

45.Sher Ali: They will be served round with a cup from a flowing fountain

46.Sher Ali: Sparkling white, delicious to the drinkers

47.Sher Ali: Wherein there will be no intoxication, nor will they be exhausted thereby

48.Sher Ali: And with them will be chaste women, with restrained looks and large beautiful eyes

49.Sher Ali: As though they were sheltered eggs

50.Sher Ali: Then some of them will address the others, questioning one another

51.Sher Ali: A speaker from among them will say, `I had an intimate companion

52.Sher Ali: `Who used to say, `Art thou, indeed, among those who believe the Resurrection to be true

53.Sher Ali: `When we are dead, and have become dust and broken bones, shall we indeed, be requited?

54.Sher Ali: The speaker will then ask those around him, `Will you have a look and find out about him?

55.Sher Ali: Then he will look himself and see him in the midst of the Fire

56.Sher Ali: And will say to him, `By ALLAH, thou hadst almost caused my ruin

57.Sher Ali: But for the grace of my Lord, I should, surely, have been of those who are called up before Hell

58.Sher Ali: `Tell me, is it not so that we are not going to suffer death again

59.Sher Ali: `Save our first death, and that we are not to be punished

60.Sher Ali: Surely, this is the supreme triumph.

61.Sher Ali: For the like of this, then, let the workers work

62.Sher Ali: Is that better as an entertainment, of the tree of Zaqqhm?

63.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have made it a trial for the wrongdoers

64.Sher Ali: It is a tree that springs forth in the bottom of Hell

65.Sher Ali: The fruit thereof is as though it were the heads of serpents

66.Sher Ali: And they shall eat of it and fill their bellies therewith

67.Sher Ali: Then will they have in addition to it a mixture of boiling water to drink

68.Sher Ali: Then, surely, their return shall be Hell

69.Sher Ali: They found their fathers erring

70.Sher Ali: And they hurried on in their footsteps

71.Sher Ali: And most of the ancient peoples had erred before them

72.Sher Ali: And WE had sent Warners among them

73.Sher Ali: Behold, then, how evil was the end of those who were warned

74.Sher Ali: Save the chosen servants of ALLAH

75.Sher Ali: And Noah, indeed, did cry unto US, and how excellent Answerer of Prayers are WE

76.Sher Ali: And WE saved him and his family from the great distress

77.Sher Ali: And WE made his offspring the only survivors

78.Sher Ali: And WE left for him a good name among the later generations

79.Sher Ali: Peace be upon Noah among the peoples

80.Sher Ali: Thus, indeed, do WE reward those who do good

81.Sher Ali: He was, surely, one of our believing servants

82.Sher Ali: Then WE drowned the others

83.Sher Ali: And, verily, of his party was Abraham

84.Sher Ali: When he came to his Lord with a pure heart

85.Sher Ali: When he said to his father and to his people, `What is it that you worship

86.Sher Ali: `A lie - false gods beside ALLAH do you desire

87.Sher Ali: `What think ye of the Lord of the worlds?

88.Sher Ali: Then he cast a glance at the stars

89.Sher Ali: And said, `I am feeling unwell.

90.Sher Ali: So they went away from him, turning their backs

91.Sher Ali: The he went quietly to their gods and addressing them said, `Will you not eat

92.Sher Ali: `What is the matter with you that you speak not?

93.Sher Ali: The he turned upon them, striking them with the right hand

94.Sher Ali: Thereupon the people came towards him, hastening

95.Sher Ali: He said, `Do you worship that which you yourselves carve out

96.Sher Ali: `Whereas ALLAH has created you and also your handiwork?

97.Sher Ali: They said, `Build for him a structure and cast him into the fire.

98.Sher Ali: Thus they designed an evil design against him, but WE made them most humiliated

99.Sher Ali: And he said, `I am going to my Lord. HE will, surely, guide me.

100.Sher Ali: And he prayed, `My Lord, grant me a righteous son

101.Sher Ali: So WE gave him the glad tidings of a forbearing son

102.Sher Ali: And when he was old enough to run along with him, he said, `O my dear son, I have seen in a dream that I offer thee in sacrifice. So consider what thou thinkest of it !'  He replied, `O my father, do as thou art commanded; thou wilt find me, if ALLAH please, steadfast in my faith.

103.Sher Ali: And when they both submitted to the will of God, and Abraham had thrown him down on his forehead

105.Sher Ali: `Thou hast, indeed, fulfilled the dream.'  Thus, indeed, do WE reward those who do good

106.Sher Ali: That, surely, was a manifest trial

107.Sher Ali: And WE ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice

108.Sher Ali: And WE left for him a good name among the succeeding generations

110.Sher Ali: Thus do WE reward those who do good

111.Sher Ali: Surely, he was one of our believing servants

112.Sher Ali: And WE gave him the glad tidings of Isaac, a Prophet, and one of the righteous

113.Sher Ali: And WE bestowed blessings on him and on Isaac. And among their progeny are some who do good and others who clearly wrong themselves

114.Sher Ali: And, indeed, WE bestowed favours on Moses and Aaron

115.Sher Ali: And WE saved them both and their people from the great distress

116.Sher Ali: And WE helped them, and it was they who were victorious

117.Sher Ali: And WE gave them the Book that made everything clear

118.Sher Ali: And WE guided them to the right path

119.Sher Ali: And WE left for them a good name among the succeeding generations.

120.Sher Ali: Peace be on Moses and Aaron

121.Sher Ali: Thus, indeed, do WE reward those who do good

122.Sher Ali: Surely, they were both among Our believing servants

123.Sher Ali: And, assuredly, Elias also was one of the Messengers

124.Sher Ali: When he said to his people, `Will you not be God-fearing

125.Sher Ali: `Do you call on Ba`l and forsake the Best of creators

126.Sher Ali: ALLAH, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers of old?

127.Sher Ali: But they rejected him, and they will, surely, be brought before God to render an account of their deeds

128.Sher Ali: Except the chosen servants of ALLAH

129.Sher Ali: And WE left for him a good name among the later generations.

130.Sher Ali: Peace be on Elias and his people

131.Sher Ali: Thus, indeed, do WE reward those who do good

132.Sher Ali: Surely, he was one of Our believing servants

133.Sher Ali: And assuredly, Lot, too, was one of the Messengers

134.Sher Ali: When WE delivered him and all his family

135.Sher Ali: Except an old women who was among those who stayed behind

136.Sher Ali: Then WE utterly destroyed the others

137.Sher Ali: And, surely, you pass by them in the morning

138.Sher Ali: And by night, Will you not understand

139.Sher Ali: And, surely, Jonah also was one of the Messengers

140.Sher Ali: When he fled to the laden ship

141.Sher Ali: And he cast lots with the crew of the ship and was of the losers

142.Sher Ali: And the fish swallowed him while he was reproaching himself

143.Sher Ali: And had he not been of those who glorify God

144.Sher Ali: He would, surely, have tarried in its belly till the Day of Resurrection

145.Sher Ali: Then WE cast him on a bare tract of land, and he was sick

146.Sher Ali: And WE caused a gourd plant to grow over him

147.Sher Ali: And WE sent him as a Messenger to a hundred thousand people or more

148.Sher Ali: And they all believed; so WE permitted them to enjoy life for a long while

149.Sher Ali: Now ask them whether thy Lord has daughters, whereas they have sons

150.Sher Ali: Did WE create the angels females while they were witnesses

151.Sher Ali: Now, surely, it is of their fabrications that they say

152.Sher Ali: `ALLAH has begotten children;' and they are certainly liars

153.Sher Ali: Has HE chosen daughters in preference to sons

154.Sher Ali: What is the matter with you?  How judge ye

156.Sher Ali: Or, have you a clear authority

157.Sher Ali: Then produce your book, if you are truthful

158.Sher Ali: And they assert a kinship between HIM and the jinn while the jinn themselves know well that they will be brought before ALLAH for judgment

159.Sher Ali: Holy is ALLAH and free from what they attribute to HIM

160.Sher Ali: But the chosen servants of ALLAH do not attribute anything derogatory to HIM

161.Sher Ali: Verily, you and what you worship

162.Sher Ali: None of you can mislead anyone against HIM

163.Sher Ali: Except only him who shall burn in Hell

164.Sher Ali: They say, `There is not one of us but has known a station

165.Sher Ali: `And, verily, we are those who stand ranged in rows

166.Sher Ali: And we, verily, are those who glorify ALLAH.

167.Sher Ali: And, surely, the Meccan disbelievers used to say

168.Sher Ali: `If we had with us a Reminder like that of the people of old

169.Sher Ali: `We would, surely, have been ALLAH's chosen servants.

170.Sher Ali: Yet when it has come to them they disbelieve therein, but they will soon come to know

171.Sher Ali: And, surely, Our word has gone forth to Our servants, the Messengers

172.Sher Ali: That it is, certainly, they who will be helped

173.Sher Ali: And that it is Our host that will, certainly, be victorious

174.Sher Ali: So turn thou away from them for a while

175.Sher Ali: And watch them, for they will soon see their own end

176.Sher Ali: Is it then Our punishment that they seek to hasten on

177.Sher Ali: But when it descends into their courtyard, it shall be an evil morning for those who were warned

178.Sher Ali: So turn thou away from them for a while

179.Sher Ali: And watch, for they will soon see their own end

180.Sher Ali: Holy is thy Lord, the Lord of Power, far above that which they assert

181.Sher Ali: And peace is ever upon the Messengers

182.Sher Ali: And all praise belongs to ALLAH, the Lord of the worlds

1.Sher Ali: Sad, WE cite as proof the Qur'an, which is full of exhortation, that it is Our revealed Word

2.Sher Ali: But those who disbelieve are steeped in false pride and enmity

3.Sher Ali: How many a generation have WE destroyed before them ! they cried out for help, but it was no longer the time for escape

4.Sher Ali: And they wonder that a Warner has come to them from among themselves; and the disbelievers say, `This is a sorcerer, a great liar

5.Sher Ali: `What !  has he made all the gods into one God?  This is, indeed, an astounding thing.

6.Sher Ali: And the leaders among them went about saying `Go and stick to your gods. This is a thing to be desired

7.Sher Ali: `We have not heard of anything like this in any previous creed. This is nothing but a forgery

8.Sher Ali: `Has the reminder been sent down to him alone out of us all?'  Nay, they are in doubt concerning MY Reminder. Nay, they have not yet tasted MY punishment

9.Sher Ali: Do they possess the treasures of the mercy of thy Lord, the Mighty, the Great Bestower

10.Sher Ali: Or, is theirs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them?  Then let them ascend with the means at their disposal

11.Sher Ali: They are a host of the confederates which shall be routed here

12.Sher Ali: Before them too the people of Noah, and the tribe of Ad and Pharaoh, the Lord of stakes, rejected the Messengers as liars

13.Sher Ali: And the tribe of Thamud, and the People of Lot, and the dwellers of the Wood - these were the confederates too

14.Sher Ali: Not one of them but treated their Messengers as liars, so MY punishment justly overtook them

15.Sher Ali: And these now wait only for a single blast, and there shall be no delaying it

16.Sher Ali: They say, `O Lord, hasten to us our portion of the punishment before the Day of Reckoning.

17.Sher Ali: Bear patiently what they say, and remember Our servant David, the man of might; surely he was always turning to God

18.Sher Ali: WE subjected to him the mountains - they celebrated God's praises with him at nightfall and sunrise

19.Sher Ali: And WE subjected to him the birds gathered together; all constantly turned to him

20.Sher Ali: And WE strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and decisive judgment

21.Sher Ali: And has the story of the disputants reached thee when they climbed over the wall of his private chamber?

22.Sher Ali: When they entered in upon David, and he was afraid of them. They said, `Fear not. We are two disputants; one of us has transgressed against the other; so judge between us with justice, and deviate not from the right course and guide us to the right way.

23.Sher Ali: `Now this my brother has ninety-nine ewes, and I have only one ewe. Yet he says, `Give it to me,' and he has been overbearing to me in his address.

24.Sher Ali: David said, `Surely, he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe to add to his own ewes. And certainly many partners transgress against one another, except those who believe in ALLAH and act righteously; and these are but few.' And David thought that WE had tried him; so he asked forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down bowing in worship and turned to HIM

25.Sher Ali: So WE forgave him his default; and, indeed, he had a position of nearness with US and an excellent resort

26.Sher Ali: Then WE said to him, `O David, WE have made thee a viceregent in the earth; so judge between men with justice, and follow not vain desire, lest it should lead thee astray from the way of ALLAH.' Surely, those, who go astray from the way of ALLAH, will have a severe punishment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning

27.Sher Ali: And WE have not created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in vain. That is the view of those who disbelieve. Woe, then, to the disbelievers because of the punishment of the Fire that shall overtake them

28.Sher Ali: Shall WE treat those who believe and do good works like those who act corruptly in the earth?  Shall WE treat the righteous like the wicked

29.Sher Ali: This is a Book which WE have revealed to thee, full of excellences, that they may reflect over its verses, and that those gifted with understanding may take heed

30.Sher Ali: And WE bestowed on David Solomon who was an excellent servant of Ours. He was always turning to US

31.Sher Ali: When there were brought before him at eventide steeds of noblest breed and swift of foot

32.Sher Ali: He said, `I love the love of good things because they remind me of my Lord.' And when they were hidden behind the veil

33.Sher Ali: He said, `Bring them back to me.' Then he started stroking their legs and their necks

34.Sher Ali: Certainly, WE tried Solomon and WE placed on his throne a mere body. Then he turned to God, seeking his mercy

35.Sher Ali: He said, `O my Lord, grant me forgiveness and bestow on me a kingdom that may not be inherited by anyone after me; surely, Thou art the Great Bestower.

36.Sher Ali: So WE subjected to him the wind, blowing gently by his command withersoever he would go

37.Sher Ali: And the giants, all sorts of architects and builders, and divers

38.Sher Ali: And others bound in fetters

39.Sher Ali: `This is Our gift - so give freely or withhold - without reckoning.

40.Sher Ali: And certainly he had a position of nearness with US and an excellent resort

41.Sher Ali: And remember Our servant Job, when he cried unto his Lord; `Satan has afflicted me with toil and torment.

42.Sher Ali: WE directed him: `Urge thy riding beast with thy foot and depart swiftly. Yonder is cool water to wash with, and a drink.

43.Sher Ali: And WE bestowed on him, his family and as many more with them, by way of mercy from US, and as a reminder for men of understanding

44.Sher Ali: And WE commanded him: `Take in thy hand a handful of dry twigs and strike therewith, and incline not towards falsehood.' Indeed, WE found him steadfast. An excellent servant was he. Surely, he was constantly turning to God

45.Sher Ali: And remember Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, men of might and vision

46.Sher Ali: WE chose them for a special purpose - to remind people of the abode of the Hereafter

47.Sher Ali: And truly, they are in Our sight among the elect and the best

48.Sher Ali: And remember Ishmael and Elisha and Dhu'l-Kifl, they were all the best

49.Sher Ali: This is a reminder. And the righteous will, surely, have an excellent resort

50.Sher Ali: Gardens of Eternity, with their gates thrown open to them

51.Sher Ali: Reclining therein on cushions; they will therein call at pleasure for plenteous fruit and drink

52.Sher Ali: And with them will be chaste women with their eyes downcast, companions of equal age

53.Sher Ali: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning

54.Sher Ali: Verily, this is Our provision which will never be exhausted

55.Sher Ali: This is for the believers. But for the rebellious there is an evil place of return

56.Sher Ali: Hell, wherein they will burn. What an evil resting place

57.Sher Ali: This is what they will have. So let them taste it - a boiling fluid, and an intensely cold and stinking drink

58.Sher Ali: And various kinds of other torments of a similar nature

59.Sher Ali: It will be said to the leaders of disbelief: `This is an army rushing headlong with you. No welcome for them. They shall burn in the Fire

60.Sher Ali: The followers will say, `Nay, it is you. No welcome for you either. It is you who prepared this for us by leading us astray.' What an evil resting place it is

61.Sher Ali: They will also say, `Our Lord, whosoever prepared this for us, do thou multiply manifold his punishment in the Fire.

62.Sher Ali: And the inmates of Hell will say, `What is the matter with us that we see not the men whom we used to reckon among the wicked

63.Sher Ali: `It is because we unjustly took them for a laughing stock, or have the eyes missed them?

64.Sher Ali: Surely, this is the truth - the disputing together of the dwellers in the Fire

65.Sher Ali: Say, I am only a Warner; and there is no God but ALLAH, the One, the Most Supreme

66.Sher Ali: The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that is between the two, the Mighty, the Great Forgiver.

67.Sher Ali: Say, `It is a big news

68.Sher Ali: From which you are turning away

69.Sher Ali: `I had no knowledge of the Exalted Assembly when they discussed the matter among themselves

70.Sher Ali: `But this that it has been revealed to me, that I am a plain Warner.

71.Sher Ali: Call to mind when thy Lord said to the angels, I am about to create man from clay

72.Sher Ali: `And so when I fashioned him in perfection, and have breathed into him of My Spirit, fall ye down into submission to him.

73.Sher Ali: So the angels submitted, all of them together

74.Sher Ali: But Iblis did not. He behaved proudly, and was of those who disbelieved

75.Sher Ali: God said, `O Iblis, what hindered thee from submitting to what I had created with MY two hands?  Is it that thou art too proud, or art thou really above obeying my command?

76.Sher Ali: He said, `I am better than he. Thou hast created me of fire and him hast Thou created of clay.

77.Sher Ali: God said, `Then get out hence, for, surely, thou art rejected

78.Sher Ali: And, surely, on thee shall be MY curse till the Day of Judgment.

79.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, then grant me respite till the day when they shall be raised.

80.Sher Ali: God said, `Certainly, thou art of the respited ones

81.Sher Ali: `Till the day of the known time.

82.Sher Ali: He said, `So be Thy glory, I will surely, lead them all astray

83.Sher Ali: `Except thy chosen servants from among them.

84.Sher Ali: God said, `The truth is, and the truth alone I speak

85.Sher Ali: `That I will, certainly, fill Hell with thee and with those who follow thee, all together.

86.Sher Ali: Say, `I ask not of you any reward for it, nor am I of those who are given to affection

87.Sher Ali: `The Qur'an is nothing but a Reminder for all peoples

88.Sher Ali: `And you shall, surely, know the truth of it after a while,

1.Sher Ali: The revelation of this Book is from ALLAH, the Mighty, the Wise

2.Sher Ali: Surely, it is WE Who have revealed the Book to thee comprising the whole truth, so worship ALLAH, being sincere to HIM in obedience

3.Sher Ali: Remember, it is to ALLAH alone that sincere obedience is due. And those who take as protectors others beside HIM, say, `We serve them only that they may bring us near to ALLAH in station.' Surely, ALLAH will judge between them concerning that wherein they differ. Surely, ALLAH guides not him who is an ungrateful liar

4.Sher Ali: If ALLAH had desired to take to Himself a son, HE could have chosen whom HE pleased out of what HE creates. Holy is HE ! HE is ALLAH, the One, the Most Supreme

5.Sher Ali: HE created the heavens and the earth in accordance with the requirements of wisdom. HE makes the night to cover the day, and HE makes the day to cover the night; and he has pressed the sun and the moon into service; each pursues its course until an appointed time. Remember, it is HE alone Who is the Mighty, the Great Forgiver

6.Sher Ali: HE created you from a single being; then from that HE made its mate; and HE has sent down for you of the cattle eight pairs. HE creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, through three stages of darkness. This is ALLAH, your Lord. HIS is the Kingdom. There is no god but HE. Wither then are you being turned away

7.Sher Ali: If you are ungrateful, surely ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, being independent of you. And HE is not pleased with ingratitude in HIS servants. But if you are grateful, HE likes it in you. And no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return; and HE will inform you of what you have been doing. Surely, HE knows full well all that is hidden in the breasts

8.Sher Ali: And when an affliction befalls man, he calls upon his Lord, turning penitently to HIM.  Then, when HE confers upon him a favour from Himself, he forgets what he used to pray for before, and starts assigning rivals to ALLAH, that he may lead people astray from HIS way. Say, `Profit from thy disbelief a little; while in the end thou art, surely, of the inmates of the Fire.

9.Sher Ali: Is he who prays devoutly to ALLAH in the hours of the night, prostrating himself and standing in Prayer and fears the Hereafter and hopes for the mercy of his Lord, like him who is disobedient?  Say, `Are those who know equal to those who know not?'  Verily, only those endowed with understanding will take heed

10.Sher Ali: Say, `O ye MY servants who believe, fear your Lord. There is good for those who do good in this life. And ALLAH's earth is spacious. Verily, the steadfast will have their reward without measure.

11.Sher Ali: Say, `Verily, I am commanded to worship ALLAH with sincere devotion

12.Sher Ali: `And I am commanded to be the foremost of those who submit to HIM.

13.Sher Ali: Say, `Indeed I fear, if I disobey my Lord, the punishment of a grievous day.
