20.Sher Ali: And those who believe say, `Why is not a Surah revealed?'   But when a decisive Surah is revealed and fighting is mentioned therein, thou seest those in whose hearts is a disease, looking towards thee like the look of one who is fainting on account of approaching death. So woe to them

21.Sher Ali: Their attitude should have been one of obedience and of calling people to good. And when the matter was determined upon, it was good for them if they were true to ALLAH

22.Sher Ali: Would you not then, if you are placed in authority, create disorder in the land and sever your ties of kinship

23.Sher Ali: It is these whom ALLAH has cursed, so that HE has made them deaf and has made their eyes blind

24.Sher Ali: Will they not, then, ponder over the Qur'an, or, is it that there are locks on their hearts

25.Sher Ali: Surely, those who turn their backs after guidance has become manifest to them, Satan has seduced them and holds out false hopes to them

26.Sher Ali: That is because they said to those who hate what ALLAH has revealed, `We will obey you in some matters, and ALLAH knows their secrets

27.Sher Ali: But how will they fare when the angels will cause them to die, smiting their faces and their backs

28.Sher Ali: That is because they followed that which displeased ALLAH, and disliked the seeking of HIS pleasure. So HE rendered their works vain

29.Sher Ali: Do those in whose hearts is a disease suppose that ALLAH will not bring to light their malice

30.Sher Ali: And if WE pleased, WE could show them to thee so that thou shouldst know them by their marks. And thou shalt, surely, recognize them by the tone of their speech. And ALLAH knows your deeds

31.Sher Ali: And WE will, surely, try you, until WE make manifest those among you who strive for the cause of ALLAH and those who are steadfast. And WE will make known the true facts about you

32.Sher Ali: Those, who disbelieve and hinder men from the way of ALLAH and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become manifest to them, shall not harm ALLAH in the least; and HE will make their works fruitless

33.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  obey ALLAH and obey the Messenger and make not your works vain

34.Sher Ali: Verily, those who disbelieve and hinder people from the way of ALLAH, and then die while they are disbelievers - ALLAH certainly, will not forgive them

35.Sher Ali: So be not slack and sue not for peace, for you will, certainly, have the upper hand. And ALLAH is with you, and HE will not deprive you of the reward of your actions

36.Sher Ali: The life of this world is but a sport and a pastime, and if you believe and be righteous, HE will give you your rewards, and will not ask of you your wealth

37.Sher Ali: Were HE to ask it of you and press you, you would be niggardly, and HE would bring to light your malice

38.Sher Ali: Behold !  You are those who are called upon to spend in the way of ALLAH; but of you there are some who are niggardly. And whoso is niggardly, is niggardly only against his own soul. And ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, and it is you who are needy. And if you turn your backs, HE will bring in your place another people; then they will not be like you

1.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have given thee a clear Victory

2.Sher Ali: That ALLAH may cover up for thee thy shortcomings, past and future, and that HE may complete HIS favour upon thee on a right path

3.Sher Ali: And that ALLAH may help thee with a mighty help

4.Sher Ali: HE it is Who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they might add faith to their faith - and to ALLAH belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth, and ALLAH is All-Knowing, Wise

5.Sher Ali: That HE may cause the believing men and the believing women to enter the Gardens beneath which streams flow, wherein they will abide, and that HE may remove their evils from them - and that, in the sight of ALLAH, is the supreme achievement

6.Sher Ali: And that HE may punish the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women, and the idolatrous men and the idolatrous women, who entertain evil thoughts concerning ALLAH. On them shall fall an evil calamity, and the wrath of ALLAH is upon them. And HE has cursed them. And has prepared Hell for them. And that, indeed, is an evil destination

7.Sher Ali: And to ALLAH belong the hosts of the heavens and the earth and ALLAH is Mighty, Wise

8.Sher Ali: WE have sent thee as a witness and a bearer of glad tidings and a Warner

9.Sher Ali: That you should believe in ALLAH and HIS Messenger, and may help him, and honour him, and that you may glorify ALLAH morning and evening

10.Sher Ali: Verily, those who swear allegiance to thee, indeed, swear allegiance to ALLAH. The hand of ALLAH is over their hands. So whoever breaks his oath, breaks it to his own loss; and whoever fulfills the covenant that HE has made with ALLAH, HE will, surely, give him a great reward

11.Sher Ali: Those of the desert Arabs, who contrived to be left behind, will say to thee, `Our possessions and our families kept us occupied, so ask forgiveness for us.'  They say with their tongues that which is not in their hearts. Say,  `Who can avail you aught against ALLAH, if HE should attend you some harm, or if HE should intend you some benefit?  Nay, ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do.

12.Sher Ali: `Nay, you though that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and that was made to appear pleasing to your hearts, and you thought an evil thought, and you were a ruined people.

13.Sher Ali: And as for those who believe not in ALLAH and HIS Messenger - WE have, surely, prepared for the disbelievers a blazing fire

14.Sher Ali: And to ALLAH belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. HE forgives whom HE pleases, and punishes whom he pleases. And ALLAH is Most Forgiving, ever Merciful

15.Sher Ali: Those who contrived to be left behind, will say, when you go forth to the spoils to take them, `Let us follow you.' They seek to change the decree of ALLAH.  Say, `You shall not follow us. Thus has ALLAH said beforehand.'  Then they will say, `Nay, but you envy us.'  That is not so; in fact they understand not except a little

16.Sher Ali: Say to the desert Arabs who contrived to be left behind, `You shall be called to fight against a people of mighty valour; you shall fight them until they surrender. Then, if you obey, ALLAH will give you a good reward, but if you turn your backs, as you turned your backs before, HE will punish you with a painful punishment.

17.Sher Ali: There is no blame on the blind, nor is there blame on the lame, nor is there blame on the sick, if they go not forth to fight. And whoso obeys ALLAH and HIS Messenger, HE will cause them to enter the Gardens beneath which streams flow; but whoso turns his back, him will HE punish with a grievous punishment

18.Sher Ali: Surely, ALLAH was well-pleased with the believers when they were swearing allegiance to thee under the Tree, and HE knew what was in their hearts, and HE sent down tranquility on them, and HE rewarded them with a victory at hand

19.Sher Ali: And great spoils that they will take. ALLAH is Mighty, Wise

20.Sher Ali: ALLAH has promised you great spoils that you will take and HE has given you this in advance, and has restrained the hands of men from you, that it may be a Sign for the believers, and that HE may guide you on a right path

21.Sher Ali: And HE has promised you another victory which you have not been able to achieve yet, but ALLAH has, surely, compassed it. And ALLAH has power over all things

22.Sher Ali: And if those who disbelieve should fight you, they would, certainly, turn their backs; then they would find neither protector nor helper

23.Sher Ali: Such has ever been the law of ALLAH; and thou shalt not find any change in the law of ALLAH

24.Sher Ali: And HE it is Who withheld their hands from you and your hands from them in the valley of Mecca, after HE had given you victory over them. And ALLAH sees all that you do

25.Sher Ali: It is they who disbelieved and debarred you from the Sacred Mosque and also prevented the dedicated offerings from reaching their place of sacrifice. And had it not been for some believing men and believing women who were then in Mecca and whom, not having known, you might have trampled down, and thus might have, on their account, incurred an unwitting guilt, HE would have permitted you to fight, but HE withheld you that HE might admit into HIS mercy whom HE will. If they had been clearly separated from the disbelievers, WE would have, surely, punished those of them who disbelieved with a grievous punishment

26.Sher Ali: When those who disbelieved harboured in their hearts prideful indignation - indignation of the Days of Ignorance, ALLAH sent down HIS tranquility on HIS Messenger and on the believers, and made them adhere firmly to the principle of righteousness, and they were better entitled to it and more worthy of it. And ALLAH knows everything well

27.Sher Ali: ALLAH, indeed, fulfilled for HIS Messenger the Vision: You shall certainly enter the Sacred Mosque, if ALLAH will, in security, some of you having their heads shaven and others having their hair cut short, you will have no fear. But HE knew what you knew not. HE has, in fact, ordained for you, besides that, a victory near at hand

28.Sher Ali: HE it is Who has sent HIS Messenger with guidance and the true Religion, That HE may cause it to prevail over all other religions. And sufficient is ALLAH as a Witness

29.Sher Ali: Muhammad is the Messenger of ALLAH. And those who are with him are hard against the disbelievers but tender among themselves. Thou seest them bowing and prostrating themselves in Prayer, seeking ALLAH's grace and pleasure. Their marks are upon their faces, being the traces of prostrations. This is their description in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is like unto a seed-produce that sends forth its sprout, then makes it strong; it then becomes stout, and stands firm on its stem, delighting the sowers - That HE may cause the disbelievers to boil with rage at the sight of them. ALLAH has promised, unto those of them, who believe and do good works, forgiveness and a great reward

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  be not forward in the presence of ALLAH and HIS Messenger, but fear ALLAH. Verily, ALLAH is All-Hearing, All-Knowing

2.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  raise not your voices above the voice of the Prophet, nor speak loudly to him as you speak loudly to one another, lest your works come to naught while you perceive not

3.Sher Ali: Verily, those who lower their voices in the presence of the Messenger of ALLAH - those are they whose hearts ALLAH has purified for righteousness. For them is forgiveness and a great reward

4.Sher Ali: Those who call out to thee from without thy private apartments - most of them have no sense

5.Sher Ali: And if they had waited patiently until thou camest out to them, it would be better for them. But ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

6.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  if an unrighteous person brings you any news, investigate it fully, lest you harm a people in ignorance, and then you repent of what you did

7.Sher Ali: And know that among you is the Messenger of ALLAH; if he were to follow your wishes in many matters, you would, surely, come to trouble; but ALLAH has endeared the faith to you and has made it look beautiful to your hearts, and HE has made disbelief, wickedness and disobedience hateful to you. Such, indeed, are those who follow the right cours

8.Sher Ali: By ALLAH's grace and HIS favour. And ALLAH is ALL-Knowing, Wise

9.Sher Ali: And if two parties of believers fight each other, make peace between them; then if after that, one of them transgresses against the other, fight the party that transgress until it returns to the command of ALLAH. Then if it returns, make peace between them with equity, and act justly. Verily, ALLAH loves the just

10.Sher Ali: Surely, all believers are brothers. So make peace between your brothers, and fear ALLAH that mercy may be shown to you

11.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  let not one people deride another people, haply they may be better than they, nor let one group of women deride other women, haply they may be better than they. And do not defame your people nor call one another by nick-names. It is an evil thing to be called by bad name after having believed; and those who repent not, such are the wrongdoers

12.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  avoid much suspicion; for suspicion in some cases is a sin. And spy not on one another, neither back-bite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother?  Certainly, you would loath it. And fear ALLAH, surely, ALLAH is oft-Returning with compassion and is Merciful

13.Sher Ali: O mankind, WE have created you from a male and a female; And WE have made you tribes and sub-tribes that you may know one another. Verily, the most honourable among you, in the sight of ALLAH, is he who is the most righteous among you. Surely, ALLAH is All-Knowing, All-Aware

14.Sher Ali: The Arabs of the desert say, `We believe.'  Say, `You have not truly believed yet, but rather say, `We have submitted, for true faith has not yet entered into your hearts.' But if you obey ALLAH and HIS Messenger, HE will not detract anything from your deeds. Surely, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

15.Sher Ali: The believers are only those who truly believe in ALLAH and HIS Messenger, and then doubt not, but strive with their possessions and their persons in the cause of ALLAH. It is they who are truthful

16.Sher Ali: Say, `Would you acquaint ALLAH with your faith, while ALLAH knows whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and ALLAH knows all things full well?

17.Sher Ali: They presume to regard it a favour to thee that they have embraced Islam.  Say, `Deem not your embracing Islam as a favour unto me. On the contrary, ALLAH has bestowed a favour upon you in that HE has guided you to the true Faith, if you are truthful.

18.Sher Ali: Verily, ALLAH knows the secrets of the heavens and the earth. And ALLAH sees all what you do.

1.Sher Ali: Qaf.  WE cite the glorious Qur'an (as a proof that the great Resurrection is sure to take place)

2.Sher Ali: But they wonder that there has come to them a Warner from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, `This is a strange thing

3.Sher Ali: `What ! when we are dead and have become dust, shall we be raised up again?  That is a return far from possible.

4.Sher Ali: WE know how much the earth diminishes of them and how much it adds to them, and with US is a Book that preserves everything

5.Sher Ali: Nay, they rejected the truth when it came to them, and so they are in a state of confusion

6.Sher Ali: Do they not look at the sky above them, how WE have made it and adorned it, and there are no flaws in it

7.Sher Ali: And the earth - WE have spread it out, and placed therein firm mountains; and WE have made to grow therein every kind of beautiful species

8.Sher Ali: As a means of enlightenment and as a reminder to every servant that turns to US

9.Sher Ali: And WE send down from the clouds water which is full of blessings, and WE produce therewith gardens and crops

10.Sher Ali: And tall palm-trees with spathes piled one above the other

11.Sher Ali: As a provision for Our servants; and WE quicken thereby a dead land. Even so shall be the Resurrection

12.Sher Ali: The people of Noah rejected the truth before them and so did the people of the Well and the tribe of Thamud

13.Sher Ali: And the tribe of AD, and Pharaoh and the brethren of Lot

14.Sher Ali: And the dwellers of the Wood, and the people of Tubba. All of them rejected the Messengers with the result that MY threatened punishment befell them

15.Sher Ali: Were WE then wearied by the first creation?  Nay, but they are in confusion about the new creation

16.Sher Ali: And assuredly, WE have created man and WE know what his mind whispers to him, and WE are nearer to him than even his jugular vein

17.Sher Ali: When the two Recording angels record everything, sitting on his right and on his left

18.Sher Ali: He utters not a word but there is by him a guardian angel ready to record it

19.Sher Ali: And the stupor of death, certainly comes. `this is what thou wast striving to run from.

20.Sher Ali: And the trumpet shall be blown. That will be the Day of Promise

21.Sher Ali: And every soul shall come forth and along with it there will be an angel to bear witness

22.Sher Ali: Then WE shall say, `Thou wast heedless of this; now WE have removed from thee thy veil, and keen is thy sight this day.

23.Sher Ali: And his companion will say, `This is what I have ready of his record.

24.Sher Ali: WE shall say to his two companions, cast ye twain into Hell every disbelieving enemy of truth

25.Sher Ali: Hinderer of good, transgressor, doubter

26.Sher Ali: `Who sets up another god beside ALLAH, so do, ye twain, cast him into the severe torment.

27.Sher Ali: His associate will say, `O Lord, it was not that I caused him to rebel; but he himself was too far gone in error.

28.Sher Ali: ALLAH will say, `Quarrel not in MY presence; I gave you the warning beforehand

29.Sher Ali: `The sentenced passed by ME cannot be changed, and I am not in the least unjust to MY servants.

30.Sher Ali: On that day WE will say to Hell, `Art thou filled up?' And it will answer, `Are there any more?

31.Sher Ali: And Heaven will be brought near to the righteous, no longer remote

32.Sher Ali: And it will be said, `This is what was promised to you -to every one who constantly turned to God and was watchful of his actions

33.Sher Ali: `Who feared the Gracious God in private and came to HIM with a penitent heart

34.Sher Ali: `Enter ye therein in peace. This is the Day of Eternity.

35.Sher Ali: They will have therein whatever they desire, and with US is a good deal more

36.Sher Ali: And how many a generation, who were mightier than they in prowess, have WE destroyed before them !  But when the punishment came, they went about in the lands, devising plans to escape it. But was there any place of refuge for them

37.Sher Ali: Therein, verily, is a reminder for him who has an understanding heart, or, who gives ear and is attentive

38.Sher Ali: And, verily, WE created the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in six periods and no weariness touched US

39.Sher Ali: So bear with patience what they say, and celebrate the praises of thy Lord, before the rising of the sun and before its setting

40.Sher Ali: And in parts of the night also do thou glorify HIM, and after the prescribed prostrations

41.Sher Ali: Hearken !  On the day when the caller will call from a place nearby

42.Sher Ali: The day when they will hear the inevitable blast; that will be the day of coming forth from the graves

43.Sher Ali: Verily, it is WE Who give life and cause death, and to US is the final return

44.Sher Ali: On the day when the earth will cleave asunder and in consequence of their misdeeds they will come forth hastening - that will be a raising up of the dead easy for US

45.Sher Ali: WE know best what they say; and thou art not to compel them in any way. So admonish, by means of the Qur'an, him who fears MY warning

1.Sher Ali: By those that scatter with a true scattering

2.Sher Ali: Then carry the load

3.Sher Ali: Then speed lightly along

4.Sher Ali: And then distribute by Our command

5.Sher Ali: Surely, that which you are promised is true

6.Sher Ali: And Judgment will, surely, come to pass

7.Sher Ali: And by the heaven full of tracks

8.Sher Ali: Truly you at variance in what you say

9.Sher Ali: He alone is turned away from the truth who is decreed to be turned away

10.Sher Ali: Cursed be the liars

11.Sher Ali: Who are heedless of truth in the depths of ignorance

12.Sher Ali: They ask, when will the Day of Judgment be?

13.Sher Ali: Say, `It will be the day when they will be tormented with the torment of the Fire.

14.Sher Ali: And it will be said to them, `Taste ye your torment. This is what you asked to be hastened.

15.Sher Ali: But surely, the righteous will be in the midst of gardens and springs

16.Sher Ali: Taking what their Lord will bestow upon them; for they used to do good before that

17.Sher Ali: They slept but a little of the night

18.Sher Ali: And at dawn they prayed for divine pardon

19.Sher Ali: And in their wealth was a share for those who asked for help and for those who could not

20.Sher Ali: And in the earth are Signs for those who have certainty of faith

21.Sher Ali: And also in your ownselves. Will you not then see

22.Sher Ali: And in heaven is your sustenance, and also that which you are promised

23.Sher Ali: And by the Lord of the heaven and the earth it is certainly the truth, just as it is true that you speak

24.Sher Ali: Has the story of Abraham's honoured guests reached thee

25.Sher Ali: When they came to him and said, `Peace !' he said in reply, `On you be peace.' He thought that they were strangers

26.Sher Ali: And he went quietly to his household, and brought a fatted calf

27.Sher Ali: And he placed it before them and said, `Will you not eat?

28.Sher Ali: And he conceived a fear of them. They said, `Fear not.' And they gave him glad tidings of the birth of a son who would be blessed with knowledge

29.Sher Ali: Then his wife came forward extremely embarrassed and smote her face and said, `I am but a barren old woman !

30.Sher Ali: They said, `Even so has thy Lord said. Surely, HE is the Wise, the All-Knowing.

31.Sher Ali: Abraham said, `Now what is your errand, O ye who have been sent?

32.Sher Ali: They said, `We have been sent to a sinful people

33.Sher Ali: That we may send down upon them stones of clay

34.Sher Ali: Marked, with thy Lord, for those guilty of excesses.

35.Sher Ali: And we brought forth therefrom such of the believers as were there

36.Sher Ali: And WE found there only one house of those who were obedient to US

37.Sher Ali: And WE left therein a Sign for those who fear painful punishment

38.Sher Ali: And in the story of Moses also there was a Sign when WE sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority

39.Sher Ali: But he turned away from Moses in pride of his might, and said, `A sorcerer, or a madman.

40.Sher Ali: So WE seized him and his hosts and threw them into the sea; and he was to blame

41.Sher Ali: And there was a Sign in the story of the tribe of AD, when WE sent against them the destructive wind

42.Sher Ali: It spared nothing whatever that it came upon but made it like a rotten bone

43.Sher Ali: And a Sign there was in the story of the tribe of Thamud when it was said to them, `Enjoy yourselves for a while.

44.Sher Ali: But they rebelled against the command of their Lord. So the thunderbolt overtook them while they gazed

45.Sher Ali: And they were not able to rise up, nor were they able to defend themselves

46.Sher Ali: And WE destroyed the people of Noah before them; they were a disobedient people

47.Sher Ali: And WE have built the heavens with Our own hands, and, verily, WE have vast powers

48.Sher Ali: And the earth WE have spread out, and how excellently do WE spread it out

49.Sher Ali: And of everything have WE created pairs that you may reflect

50.Sher Ali: Flee ye, therefore, unto ALLAH. Surely, I am a plain Warner unto you from Him

51.Sher Ali: And do not set up another god along with ALLAH. Surely, I am a plain Warner unto you from HIM

52.Sher Ali: Even so there came no Messenger to those before them, but they said,  `A sorcerer or a madman.

53.Sher Ali: Have they bequeathed this attitude to one another?  Nay, they are all a rebellious people

54.Sher Ali: So turn away from them; and thou will not be to blame for what they do

55.Sher Ali: And keep on exhorting; for, verily, exhortation benefits those who would believe

56.Sher Ali: And I have not created the jinn and the men but that they may worship ME

57.Sher Ali: I desire of them no provision, neither do I desire that they should feed ME

58.Sher Ali: Surely, it is ALLAH Himself Who is the Great Sustainer, the Lord of Power, the Strong

59.Sher Ali: So the fate of those who do wrong shall, surely, be like the fate of their fellows of old; so let them not challenge ME to hasten on the punishment

60.Sher Ali: Woe, then, to those who disbelieve, because of that day of theirs which they have been promised

1.Sher Ali: By the Mount

2.Sher Ali: And by the Book inscribe

3.Sher Ali: On parchment unfolded

4.Sher Ali: And by the ever Frequented House

5.Sher Ali: And by the Elevated Roof

6.Sher Ali: And by the Swollen Sea

7.Sher Ali: The punishment of thy Lord shall, certainly, come to pass

8.Sher Ali: There is none to avert it

9.Sher Ali: On the day when the heaven will be in a state of terrific commotion

10.Sher Ali: And the mountains shall move fast

11.Sher Ali: Then woe that day to those who reject the Truth

12.Sher Ali: Who sportingly indulge in idle talk

13.Sher Ali: The day when they shall be trust into the fire of Hell with a violent trust

14.Sher Ali: And they will be told: `This is the Fire which you denied as a lie

15.Sher Ali: `Is this then magic, or do you still not see

16.Sher Ali: `Burn ye therein; and whether you show patience or you show it not, it will be the same for you. You are requited only for what you used to do.

17.Sher Ali: Verily, the righteous will, surely, be in Gardens and in bliss

18.Sher Ali: Rejoicing in what their Lord will have bestowed on them; and their Lord will save them from the torment of the Fire

19.Sher Ali: And HE will say to them, `Eat and drink with happy enjoyment because of what you used to do.

20.Sher Ali: On that day they will be reclining on couches arranged in rows. And WE shall give them as companions fair maidens, having wide, beautiful eyes

21.Sher Ali: And those who believe and whose children follow them in faith - with them will WE join their children. And WE will not diminish anything from the reward of their works. Every man stands pledged for what he has earned

22.Sher Ali: And WE shall bestow upon them every kind of fruit and meat such as they will wish for

23.Sher Ali: There they will pass from one to another a cup wherein is neither levity nor sin

24.Sher Ali: And there will wait upon them youths of their own, pure as though they were pearls well preserved

25.Sher Ali: And they will turn one to another, asking questions

26.Sher Ali: They will say, `Before this, when we were among our families, we were very much afraid of ALLAH's judgment

27.Sher Ali: `But ALLAH has been gracious unto us and has saved us from the torment of the scorching blast

28.Sher Ali: `We used to pray to HIM before. Surely, HE is the Beneficent, the Merciful.

29.Sher Ali: So keep on admonishing. By the grace of thy Lord thou art neither a soothsayer, nor a madman

30.Sher Ali: Do they say `He is a poet; we are waiting for some calamity which time will bring upon him?

31.Sher Ali: Say, `Await ye then, I am, too, with you among those who are waiting.

32.Sher Ali: Does their reason enjoin this upon them or are they a rebellious people

33.Sher Ali: Do they say, `He has forged it?'  Nay, but they have no faith

34.Sher Ali: Let them, then produce a discourse like this, if they speak the truth

35.Sher Ali: Have they been created without a purpose, or are they themselves the creators

36.Sher Ali: Did they create the heavens and the earth?  Nay, but they have no faith in the Creator

37.Sher Ali: Do they have the treasures of thy Lord with them, or are they the guardians thereof

38.Sher Ali: Have they a ladder by means of which they can ascend into heaven and overhear the Divine words?  Then let their listener bring a manifest proof

39.Sher Ali: Has HE only daughters and you have sons

40.Sher Ali: Dost thou ask a reward from them, so that they are weighed down with a load of debt

41.Sher Ali: Do they possess knowledge of the unseen, so that they write it down

42.Sher Ali: Do they intend to devise a plot?  But the disbelievers themselves will be the victims of their plot

43.Sher Ali: Have they a god other than ALLAH?  Exalted is ALLAH above all that which they associate with HIM

44.Sher Ali: And if they should see a fragment of the sky falling down, they would say, just clouds piled up

45.Sher Ali: So leave them until they meet that day of theirs, on which they will be thunder-struck

46.Sher Ali: The day when their scheming shall avail them naught, nor shall they be helped

47.Sher Ali: And, verily, for those, who do wrong, there is a punishment besides that. But most of them know not

48.Sher Ali: So wait patiently for the judgment of thy Lord; for, assuredly, thou art before Our eyes; and celebrate the praises of thy Lord when thou risest up for prayer

49.Sher Ali: And for part of the night also do thou glorify HIM and at the setting of the stars

1.Sher Ali: By the star when it falls

2.Sher Ali: You companion has neither erred, nor has he gone astray

3.Sher Ali: Nor does he speak out of his own desire

4.Sher Ali: It is nothing but pure revelation revealed by God

5.Sher Ali: The Lord of the Mighty Powers has taught him

6.Sher Ali: The One Possessor of Powers which manifest themselves repeatedly. So HE settled Himself on the Throne

7.Sher Ali: And HE revealed His Word when he was on the uppermost horizon

8.Sher Ali: Then the Prophet drew near to ALLAH; then ALLAH leaned down towards him

9.Sher Ali: So that HE became, as it were, one chord to two bows, or closer still

10.Sher Ali: Then ALLAH revealed to HIS servant that which HE revealed

11.Sher Ali: The heart of the Prophet lied not in seeing what he saw

12.Sher Ali: Will you, then, dispute with him about what he saw

13.Sher Ali: And, certainly, he saw him a second time

14.Sher Ali: Near the farthest lote tree

15.Sher Ali: Near which is the Garden of Eternal abode

16.Sher Ali: This was when that, which covers, covered the lote-tree

17.Sher Ali: The eye deviated not, nor did it wander

18.Sher Ali: Surely, he saw the greatest of the Signs of his Lord

19.Sher Ali: Now tell me about Lat and Uzzh

20.Sher Ali: And Manat, the third one, another goddess

21.Sher Ali: `What !  for you the males and for Him the females?

22.Sher Ali: That, indeed is an unfair division

23.Sher Ali: These are but names which you have named - you and your fathers - for which ALLAH has sent down no authority. They follow naught but conjecture and what their souls desire, while there has already come to them guidance from their Lord

24.Sher Ali: Can man have whatever he desires

25.Sher Ali: Nay, to ALLAH belong the Hereafter and this world

26.Sher Ali: And how many an angel is there in the heavens, but their intercession shall be of no avail, except after ALLAH gives permission to whomsoever HE wills and pleases

27.Sher Ali: Those, who believe not in the Hereafter, give the angels female names

28.Sher Ali: But they have no knowledge thereof. They follow nothing but conjecture; and conjecture avails naught against truth

29.Sher Ali: So turn away from him who turns his back upon Our remembrance, and seeks nothing but the life of this world

30.Sher Ali: That is the utmost limit of their knowledge. Verily, thy Lord knows best him who strays away from His way, and HE knows best him who follows guidance

31.Sher Ali: And to ALLAH belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, that HE may requite those who do evil according to what they have wrought and reward those who do good with what is best

32.Sher Ali: Those who shun the grave sins and all indecencies except minor faults. Verily, thy Lord is Master of vast forgiveness. HE knows you well from the time when HE created you from the earth, and when you were embryos in the bellies of your mothers. So ascribe not purity to yourselves. HE knows him best who is truly righteous

33.Sher Ali: Seest thou him who turns away from guidance

34.Sher Ali: And gives a little, and does it grudgingly

35.Sher Ali: Has he the knowledge of the unseen, so that he can see his own end

36.Sher Ali: Has he not been informed of what is in the Scriptures of Moses

37.Sher Ali: And of Abraham who fulfilled the divine commandments

38.Sher Ali: That no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of another

39.Sher Ali: And that man will have nothing but what he strives for

40.Sher Ali: And that the result of his striving shall soon be known

41.Sher Ali: Then will he be rewarded for it with the fullest reward

42.Sher Ali: And that with thy Lord is the final judgment

43.Sher Ali: And that it is HE WHO makes people laugh and makes them weep

44.Sher Ali: And that it is HE Who causes death and gives life

45.Sher Ali: And that HE creates the pairs, male and female

46.Sher Ali: From a sperm drop when it is emitted

47.Sher Ali: And that it is for him to bring forth the second creation

48.Sher Ali: And that it is HE Who enriches and gives contentment

49.Sher Ali: And that HE is the Lord of Sirius

50.Sher Ali: And that HE destroyed the first tribe of Ad

51.Sher Ali: And the tribe of Thamud and HE spared no one

52.Sher Ali: And HE destroyed the people of Noah before them - verily, they were most unjust and most rebellious

53.Sher Ali: And HE overthrew the subverted cities of the people of Lot

54.Sher Ali: So that there covered them that which covered

55.Sher Ali: Which, then, O man, of the bounties of thy Lord wilt thou dispute

56.Sher Ali: This Messenger of Ours is a Warner like the Warners of Old

57.Sher Ali: The Hour of Judgment which was to come has drawn nigh

58.Sher Ali: None but ALLAH can avert it

59.Sher Ali: Do you, then, wonder at this announcement

60.Sher Ali: And do you laugh and weep not

61.Sher Ali: While you make merry

62.Sher Ali: So prostrate yourselves before ALLAH and worship HIM

1.Sher Ali: The Hour has drawn nigh, and the moon is rent asunder

2.Sher Ali: And if they see a Sign, they turn away and say, `An oft-repeated sorcery.

3.Sher Ali: They have rejected the truth and follow their own fancies. But for everything there is an appointed time

4.Sher Ali: And there has already come to them accounts of events containing warnings

5.Sher Ali: Consummate wisdom; but the warnings profit them not

6.Sher Ali: Therefore, turn thou away from them and await the day when the Summoner will summon them to a disagreeable thing

7.Sher Ali: While their eyes will be cast down and they will come forth from their graves as though they were locust scattered about

8.Sher Ali: Hastening towards the Summoner. The disbelievers will say, `This is a hard day.

9.Sher Ali: The people of Noah rejected the truth before them; they called Our servant a liar and said, `He is a madman, afflicted by our idols.

10.Sher Ali: So he prayed to his Lord: `I am overcome, so come thou to my help !

11.Sher Ali: Thereupon WE opened the gates of heaven with water which fell in torrents

12.Sher Ali: And WE caused the earth to burst forth with springs, so the two waters met for a purpose that was decreed

13.Sher Ali: And WE carried him upon that which was made of planks and nails

14.Sher Ali: It floated on under Our eyes; a reward for him who had been denied

15.Sher Ali: And WE left it as a Sign for the succeeding generations. But is there anyone who would take heed

16.Sher Ali: How terrible, then, was MY punishment and how true MY warning

17.Sher Ali: And indeed, WE have made the Qur'an easy to remember. Is there anyone who would take heed

18.Sher Ali: The tribe of Ad rejected the truth. How terrible, then, was MY punishment and how true MY warning

19.Sher Ali: WE sent against them a furious wind on a day of unending ill-luck

20.Sher Ali: Tearing people away as though they were the hollow trunks of uprooted palm-trees

21.Sher Ali: How terrible, then, was MY punishment and how true MY warning

22.Sher Ali: And indeed, WE have made the Qur'an easy to remember. But is there anyone who would take heed

23.Sher Ali: The tribe of Thamud also rejected the Warners

24.Sher Ali: And they said, `What !  shall we follow a mortal, one out of ourselves?  Then, indeed, we would be in manifest error, and suffering from madness

25.Sher Ali: `Has the Reminder been revealed to him alone of all of us? Nay, he is an impudent liar.

26.Sher Ali: Tomorrow will they know who is the impudent liar

27.Sher Ali: We will send the she-camel as a trial for them. So watch them, O Salih, and have patience

28.Sher Ali: `And tell them that the water is shared between her and them, every drinking time shall be attended.

29.Sher Ali: But they called their comrade and he seized a sword and hamstrung her

30.Sher Ali: How terrible, then, was MY punishment and how true MY warning

31.Sher Ali: WE sent against them a single blast, and they became like the dry stubble, whittled down by a maker of hedges

32.Sher Ali: And, indeed, WE have made the Qur'an easy to remember. But is there anyone who will take heed

33.Sher Ali: Lot's people also rejected the Warners

34.Sher Ali: WE sent a storm of stones upon them except the family of Lot, whom WE delivered by early dawn

35.Sher Ali: As a favour from US. Thus do WE reward him who is grateful

36.Sher Ali: And he, indeed, had warned them of Our severe punishment, but they doubted the warning

37.Sher Ali: And they deceitfully sought to turn him away from his guests. So WE blinded their eyes, and said, `Taste ye now MY punishment and MY warning.

38.Sher Ali: And there came upon them early in the morning a lasting punishment

39.Sher Ali: `Now taste ye MY punishment and MY warning.

40.Sher Ali: And, indeed, WE have made the Qur'an easy to remember. But is there anyone who will take heed

41.Sher Ali: And, surely, to the people of Pharaoh also came Warners

42.Sher Ali: They rejected all Our Signs. So WE seized them like the seizing of the Mighty, the Powerful

43.Sher Ali: Are your disbelievers better than those?  Or, have you an immunity in the Scriptures

44.Sher Ali: Do they say, `We are a victorious host?

45.Sher Ali: The hosts shall soon be routed and shall turn their backs in flight

46.Sher Ali: Aye, the Hour is their promised time; and the Hour will be most calamitous for them and most bitter

47.Sher Ali: Surely, the guilty are in manifest error and suffer from madness

48.Sher Ali: On the day when they will be dragged into the Fire on their faces, it will be said to them, `Taste ye the touch of Hell.

49.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have created everything in due measure

50.Sher Ali: And Our command is carried out by only one Word as the twinkling of an eye

51.Sher Ali: And, indeed, WE have destroyed people like you before. But is there anyone who will take heed

52.Sher Ali: And everything they have done is recorded in the Books

53.Sher Ali: And every matter, small and great, is written down

54.Sher Ali: Verily, the righteous will be in the midst of Gardens and streams

55.Sher Ali: In an internal and honoured abode in the presence of the Omnipotent King

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Sher Ali: The Gracious God

2.Sher Ali: HE taught the Qur'an

3.Sher Ali: HE created man

4.Sher Ali: And taught him plain speech

5.Sher Ali: The sun and the moon run their courses according to a fixed reckoning

6.Sher Ali: And the stemless plants and the trees humbly submit to HIS Will

7.Sher Ali: And the heaven HE has raised high and set up the measure

8.Sher Ali: That you may not exceed the measure

9.Sher Ali: So weigh all things with justice and fall not short of the measure

10.Sher Ali: And HE has set the earth for HIS creatures

11.Sher Ali: Therein are all kinds of fruit and palm-tree with sheaths

12.Sher Ali: And grain with its husk and fragrant plants

13.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, O men and jinn, deny

14.Sher Ali: He created man of dry ringing clay which is like baked pottery

15.Sher Ali: And the jinn HE created of the flame of Fire

16.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

17.Sher Ali: The Lord of the two Easts and the Lord of the two Wests

18.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

19.Sher Ali: HE has made the two bodies of water flow. They will one day meet

20.Sher Ali: Between them there is at present a barrier; they cannot encroach one upon the other

21.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

22.Sher Ali: There come out from both of them pearls and coral

23.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

24.Sher Ali: And HIS are the lofty ships reared aloft on the sea like mountains

25.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

26.Sher Ali: All that is on earth will pass away

27.Sher Ali: And there will abide for ever only the Person of thy Lord, Master of Glory and Honour

28.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

29.Sher Ali: Of HIM do beg all that are in the heavens and the earth. Everyday HE reveals himself in a different state

30.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

31.Sher Ali: Soon shall WE attend to you, O ye two big groups

32.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

33.Sher Ali: O company of jinn and men !  if you have power to break through the confines of the heavens and the earth, then break through them. But you cannot break through save with authority

34.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

35.Sher Ali: There shall be sent against you a flame of fire, and molten copper; and you shall not be able to help yourselves

36.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

37.Sher Ali: And when the heaven is rent asunder and become red like red hide

38.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

39.Sher Ali: On that day neither man nor jinn will be asked about his sin

40.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

41.Sher Ali: The guilty will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet

42.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

43.Sher Ali: And they will be told: `This is the Hell which the guilty denied

44.Sher Ali: `Between it and the fierce boiling water will they go round.

45.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

46.Sher Ali: And for him who fears to stand before his Lord there are two gardens

47.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

48.Sher Ali: Having many varieties of trees

49.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

50.Sher Ali: In each of them there are two fountains flowing freely

51.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

52.Sher Ali: Therein will be every kind of fruit in pairs

53.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

54.Sher Ali: The inmates thereof will recline on couches over carpets, the linings of which will be of thick brocade. And the fruit of the two Gardens will be within their easy reach

55.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

56.Sher Ali: Therein will also be chaste maidens restraining their glances, whom neither man nor jinn will have touched before them

57.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

58.Sher Ali: As if they were rubies and small pearls

59.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

60.Sher Ali: Is the reward of goodness anything but goodness

61.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

62.Sher Ali: And besides these two, there are two other gardens

63.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

64.Sher Ali: Dark green with foliage

65.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

66.Sher Ali: Therein also will be two springs, gushing forth with water

67.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

68.Sher Ali: In both of them there will be all kinds of fruit, and dates and pomegranates

69.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

70.Sher Ali: Therein will be maidens, good and beautiful.

71.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

72.Sher Ali: Fair maidens with lovely black eyes, guarded in pavilions

73.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

74.Sher Ali: Whom neither man nor jinn will have touched before them

75.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

76.Sher Ali: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful carpets

77.Sher Ali: Which, then, of the favours of your Lord will ye twain, deny

78.Sher Ali: Blessed is the name of thy Lord, Master of Glory and Honour

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Sher Ali: When the Inevitable event comes to pass

2.Sher Ali: There is no denying its coming to pass

3.Sher Ali: Some it will bring low, others it will exalt

4.Sher Ali: When the earth will be shaken with a terrible shaking

5.Sher Ali: And mountains will be scattered - a complete scattering

6.Sher Ali: They shall all become like dust particles scattered about

7.Sher Ali: And you shall be divided into three groups

8.Sher Ali: Those on the right hand - how lucky are those on the right hand

9.Sher Ali: And those on the left hand - how unlucky are those on the left hand

10.Sher Ali: And the foremost; they are truly the foremost

11.Sher Ali: They will be those near to God

12.Sher Ali: And will be in the Gardens of Bliss

13.Sher Ali: A large party from among the first believers

14.Sher Ali: And a few from among the later ones

15.Sher Ali: Seated on couches inwrought with gold and jewels

16.Sher Ali: Reclining thereon, facing each other

17.Sher Ali: There will wait on them youths who will not age

18.Sher Ali: Carrying goblets and ewers and cups filled out of a flowing spring

19.Sher Ali: No headache will they get therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated

20.Sher Ali: And carrying such fruits as they choose

21.Sher Ali: And flesh of birds as they may desire

22.Sher Ali: And there will be fair maidens with wide, lovely eyes

23.Sher Ali: Like pearls well-preserved

24.Sher Ali: As a reward for what they did

25.Sher Ali: They will not hear therein any vain or sinful talk

26.Sher Ali: Except only the word of salutation - `Peace, peace.

27.Sher Ali: Those on the right hand - how lucky are those on the right hand !

28.Sher Ali: They will be amidst thornless lote-trees

29.Sher Ali: And clustered bananas

30.Sher Ali: And extended shade

31.Sher Ali: And flowing water

32.Sher Ali: And abundant fruit

33.Sher Ali: Neither failing, nor forbidden

34.Sher Ali: And they will have noble spouses

35.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have created them a good creation

36.Sher Ali: And made them virgins

37.Sher Ali: Loving, of equal age

38.Sher Ali: For those on the right hand

39.Sher Ali: A large party from among the first believers

40.Sher Ali: And a large party from among the later ones

41.Sher Ali: And those on the left hand - how unlucky are those on the left hand !

42.Sher Ali: They will be in the midst of scorching winds and scalding water

43.Sher Ali: And under the shadow of pitch-black smoke

44.Sher Ali: Neither cool nor wholesome

45.Sher Ali: Before this they lived in a life of ease and plenty

46.Sher Ali: And persisted in extreme sinfulness

47.Sher Ali: And they were wont to say, `What !  when we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we, indeed, be raised again

48.Sher Ali: `And our fathers of yore too?

49.Sher Ali: Say, `Yes, the earlier ones and the later ones

50.Sher Ali: `Will all be gathered together unto the fixed time of an appointed day

51.Sher Ali: `Then, O ye that have gone astray and have rejected the truth

52.Sher Ali: `You will, surely, eat of the tree of Zaqqhm

53.Sher Ali: And will fill your bellies therewith

54.Sher Ali: `And will drink boiling water, on top of that

55.Sher Ali: `Drinking as the insatiable thirsty camels drink.

56.Sher Ali: This will be their entertainment on the Day of Judgment

57.Sher Ali: WE have created you. Why, then do you not accept the truth

58.Sher Ali: What think ye of the sperm-drop that you emit

59.Sher Ali: Is it you who have created it, or are WE the Creator

60.Sher Ali: WE have ordained death for all of you; and WE cannot be hindered

61.Sher Ali: From bringing in your place others like you, and from developing you into a form which you know not

62.Sher Ali: And you have, certainly, known the first creation. Why, then, do you not reflect

63.Sher Ali: Do you see what you sow

64.Sher Ali: Is it you who cause it to grow, or are WE the grower

65.Sher Ali: If WE so pleased, WE could reduce it all to withered stubble, then you would keep lamenting

66.Sher Ali: `We are laden with debt

67.Sher Ali: `Nay, we are totally deprived of everything.

68.Sher Ali: Have you considered the water which you drink

69.Sher Ali: Do you send it down from the clouds, or are WE the Sender

70.Sher Ali: If WE so pleased, WE could make it bitter. Why, then, do you not give thanks

71.Sher Ali: Have you considered the fire which you kindle

72.Sher Ali: Is it you who produce the tree for it, or are WE the Producer

73.Sher Ali: WE have made it a reminder and benefit for the wayfarers

74.Sher Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Great

75.Sher Ali: Nay, I cite as proof the shooting of the stars

76.Sher Ali: And, indeed, that is a grand testimony, if you only knew

77.Sher Ali: This is, indeed, a noble Qur'an

78.Sher Ali: In a well-preserved Book

79.Sher Ali: Which none shall touch except those who are purified

80.Sher Ali: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds

81.Sher Ali: Is it this divine discourse that you would reject

82.Sher Ali: And do you make the denial thereof your means of livelihood

83.Sher Ali: Why, then, when the soul of the dying man reaches the throat

84.Sher Ali: And you are at that moment looking on

85.Sher Ali: And WE are nearer to him than you, but you see not

86.Sher Ali: Why, then, if you are not to be called to account

87.Sher Ali: You cannot bring it back if you are truthful

88.Sher Ali: Now if he be of those who are near to God

89.Sher Ali: Then for him is comfort and fragrance of happiness and Garden of bliss

90.Sher Ali: And if he be of those of the right hand

91.Sher Ali: Then, `Peace be ever on thee,  O thou, of those of the right hand !

92.Sher Ali: But if he be of those who reject the truth and are in error

93.Sher Ali: Then for him will be an entertainment of boiling water

94.Sher Ali: And burning in Hell

95.Sher Ali: Verily, this is the certain truth

96.Sher Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Incomparably Great

1.Sher Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and the earth glorifies ALLAH; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Sher Ali: HIS is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; HE gives life and HE causes death, and HE has power over all things

3.Sher Ali: HE is the First and the Last, and the Manifest and the Hidden, and HE has full knowledge of all things

4.Sher Ali: HE it is Who created the heavens and the earth in six periods, then HE settled Himself on the Throne. HE knows what enters the earth and what comes out of it, and what comes down from the heaven and what goes up into it. And HE is with you wheresoever you may be. And ALLAH sees all that you do

5.Sher Ali: HIS is the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and to ALLAH are all affairs returned for final judgment

6.Sher Ali: HE causes the night to pass into the day and causes the day to pass into the night; And HE knows well all that is in the breasts

7.Sher Ali: Believe in ALLAH and His Messenger, and spend in the way of ALLAH out of that to which HE has made you heirs. And those of you who believe and spend will have a great reward

8.Sher Ali: Why is it that you believe not in ALLAH, while the Messenger calls you to believe in your Lord, and HE has already taken a covenant from you, if indeed you are believers

9.Sher Ali: HE it is Who sends down clear Signs to HIS servant, that HE may bring you out of every kind of darkness into light. And, verily, ALLAH is Compassionate and Merciful to you

10.Sher Ali: And why is it that you spend not in the way of ALLAH, while to ALLAH belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Those of you who spent and fought before the Victory are not equal to those who did so later. They are greater in rank than those who spent and fought afterwards. And to all has ALLAH promised good. And ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

11.Sher Ali: Who is he who will lend to ALLAH a goodly loan?  So HE will increase it manifold for him, and he will have a noble reward

12.Sher Ali: And think of the day when thou wilt see the believing men and the believing women, their light running before them and on their right hands, and angels will say to them, `Glad tidings for you this day of Gardens through which streams flow, wherein you will abide. That is the supreme triumph.

13.Sher Ali: That is the day when the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women will say to those who believe,  `Wait for us a while that we may borrow some of your light,'  it will be said to them, `Go back if you can, and seek for light.' Then there will be set up between them a wall with a door in  it. The inside of it will be all mercy and outside of it, in front, will be torment

14.Sher Ali: The hypocrites will call out to believers saying, `Were we not with you?'  The believers will answer, `Yea, but you let yourselves fall into temptation and you hesitated and doubted and your vain desires deceived you till the decree of ALLAH came to pass. And the deceiver deceived you concerning ALLAH

15.Sher Ali: `So this day no ransom shall be accepted from you, nor from those who disbelieved. Your final abode is the Fire; that is your comrade; and an evil destination it is.

16.Sher Ali: Has not the time yet arrived for those who believe that their hearts should feel humbled at the remembrance of ALLAH and at the truth which has come down to them, and that they should not become like those who were given the Book before them, but because the period of the bestowal of ALLAH's grace upon them was prolonged for them, their hearts became  hardened, and many of them became rebellious

17.Sher Ali: Know, then, that ALLAH quickens the earth after its death. WE have made the Signs manifest to you, that you may understand

18.Sher Ali: Surely, the men who give alms and the women who give alms, and those who lend to ALLAH a goodly loan - it will be increased manifold for them, and theirs will also be a honourable reward

19.Sher Ali: Those who believe in ALLAH and HIS Messengers, they are the Truthful and the Witnesses in the sight of their Lord. They will have their full reward and their light. But those who disbelieve and reject Our Signs, these are the inmates of Hell

20.Sher Ali: Know that the life of this world is only a sport and a pastime, and an adornment, and a source of boasting among yourselves, and of rivalry in multiplying riches and children. It is like the rain, the vegetation produced whereby rejoices the tillers. Then it dries up and thou seest it turn yellow; then it becomes worthless stubble. And in the Hereafter there is severe punishment for the wicked and also forgiveness from ALLAH, and His pleasure for the righteous. And the life of this world is nothing but temporary enjoyment of delusive things

21.Sher Ali: Vie, then, with one another in seeking forgiveness from your Lord and for a Garden the value whereof is equal to the value of the heaven and the earth; it has been prepared for those who believe in ALLAH and His Messengers. That is ALLAH's grace; HE bestows it upon whomsoever HE pleases, and ALLAH is the Lord of immense grace

22.Sher Ali: There befalls not any calamity either in the earth or in your own persons, but it is recorded in a Book before WE bring it into being - surely, that is easy for ALLAH

23.Sher Ali: That you may not grieve over what is lost to you nor exult because of that which HE has bestowed upon you. And ALLAH loves not any conceited boaster

24.Sher Ali: Such as are niggardly and also enjoin upon men to be niggardly. And whoso turns his back, then surely, ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, Worthy of all praise

25.Sher Ali: Verily, WE sent Our Messengers with manifest Signs and sent down with them the Book and the Balance that people may act with justice; and WE sent down iron, wherein is material for violent warfare and diverse uses for mankind, and that ALLAH may know those who help HIM and HIS Messengers without having seen Him. Surely, ALLAH is Powerful, Mighty

26.Sher Ali: And indeed WE sent Noah and Abraham, and WE placed among their seed Prophethood and the Book. So some of them followed the guidance, but many of them were rebellious

27.Sher Ali: Then WE caused Our Messengers to follow in their footsteps; and WE caused Jesus, son of Mary, to follow them, and WE gave him the Gospel. And WE put compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. And monasticism they invented - WE did not prescribe it for them - for the seeking of ALLAH's pleasure; but they observed it not as it should be observed. Yet WE gave those of them, who believed, their due reward, but many of them are rebellious

28.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  fear ALLAH and believe in HIS Messenger. HE will give you a double portion of HIS Mercy, and will provide for you a light wherein you will walk, and will grant you forgiveness - verily, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

29.Sher Ali: Thus it is that the People of the Book may know that they have no power over anything of the grace of ALLAH; and that grace is entirely in the hands of ALLAH, HE gives it to whomsoever HE pleases. And ALLAH is the Master of immense grace

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Sher Ali: ALLAH has, indeed, heard the talk of her who pleads with thee concerning her husband, and complains unto ALLAH. And ALLAH has heard the two of you conversing together. Verily, ALLAH is All-Hearing,  All-Seeing

2.Sher Ali: Those among you who put away their wives by calling them mothers - they do not thereby become their mothers ; their mothers are only those who gave them birth. They certainly utter words that are manifestly evil and untrue; but, surely, ALLAH is the Effacer of sins, Most Forgiving

3.Sher Ali: Those who put away their wives by calling them mothers, and then would go back on what they have said, must free a slave before they touch one another. This is what you are admonished with. And ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

4.Sher Ali: But he who does not find a slave, he must fast for two consecutive months, before they touch one another. And he who is not able to do so shall feed sixty poor people. This is enjoined on you so that you may have faith in ALLAH and HIS Messenger. And these are the limits prescribed by ALLAH; and for the disbelievers is a painful punishment

5.Sher Ali: Those who oppose ALLAH and HIS Messenger will, surely be abased even as those before them were abased; and WE have already sent down clear Signs. And the disbelievers will have an humiliating punishment

6.Sher Ali: On the day when ALLAH will raise them all together. And HE will inform them of what they did. ALLAH has kept account of it, while they have forgotten it. And ALLAH is Witness over all things

7.Sher Ali: Seest thou not that ALLAH knows all that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth?  There is no secret counsel of three, but HE is their fourth, nor of five but HE is their sixth, nor of less than that, nor of more, but HE is with them wheresoever they may be. Then on the Day of Resurrection HE will inform them of what they did. Surely, ALLAH has full knowledge of all things

8.Sher Ali: Seest thou not those who were forbidden to hold secret counsels, then they return to that which they were forbidden, and confer in secret for sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger?  And when they come to thee, they greet thee with a greeting with which ALLAH, has not greeted thee; but among themselves they say, `Why does not ALLAH punish us for what we say?'  Sufficient for them is Hell, wherein they will burn; and a most evil destination it is

9.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  When you confer together in private, confer not for the purpose of promoting sin and transgression and disobedience to the Messenger, but confer for the purpose of promoting virtue and righteousness, and fear ALLAH unto Whom you shall all be gathered

10.Sher Ali: Holding of secret counsels for evil purposes is only of Satan, that he may cause grief to those who believe; but it cannot harm them in the least, except by ALLAH's leave. And in ALLAH should the believers put their trust

11.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  when it is said to you, `Make room in your assemblies,' then do make room. ALLAH will make ample room for you. And when it is said, `Rise up' then rise up; ALLAH will raise those who believe from among you, and those whom knowledge is given to degrees of rank. And ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

12.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  when you consult the Messenger in private, give alms before your consultation. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not anything to give then ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

13.Sher Ali: Are you afraid of giving alms before your consultation? So when you do not do so and ALLAH has been Merciful to you, then observe Prayer and pay the Zakaat and obey ALLAH and HIS Messenger. And ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

14.Sher Ali: Seest thou not those who take for friends a people with whom ALLAH is wroth?  They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to falsehood knowingly

15.Sher Ali: ALLAH has prepared for them a severe punishment. Evil, indeed, is that which they used to do

16.Sher Ali: They have made their oaths a shield for their falsehoods, and thereby they seek to turn men away from the path of ALLAH; for them therefore, will be an humiliating punishment

17.Sher Ali: Neither their wealth nor their children will avail them aught against ALLAH. They are the inmates of the Fire wherein they will abide

18.Sher Ali: On the day when ALLAH will raise them all together, they will swear to HIM, even as they now swear to you, and they will think that they have something to stand upon. Now, surely, it is they who are the liars

19.Sher Ali: Satan has gained mastery over them, and has made them forget the remembrance of ALLAH. They are Satan's party. Now, surely, it is Satan's party that are the losers

20.Sher Ali: Certainly those who oppose ALLAH and His Messenger are among the most abject

21.Sher Ali: ALLAH has decreed: `Most surely, I will prevail, I and MY Messengers.' Verily, ALLAH is Powerful, Mighty

22.Sher Ali: Thou wilt not find any people who believe in ALLAH and the Last Day and yet they love those who oppose ALLAH and His Messenger, even though they be their fathers, or their sons, or their brethren, or their kindred. These are they in whose hearts ALLAH has inscribed true faith and whom HE has strengthened with inspiration from Himself. And HE will admit them into Gardens through which streams flow. Therein they will abide; ALLAH is well-pleased with them and they are well-pleased with HIM. They are ALLAH's party. Hearken !  it is ALLAH's party who are the successful

1.Sher Ali: All that is in the heavens and all that is in the earth glorifies ALLAH; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Sher Ali: HE it is Who caused the disbelievers of the People of the Book to go forth from their homes at the time of the first banishment. You did not think that they would go forth and they thought that their fortresses would defend them against ALLAH. But ALLAH came upon them whence they did not expect, and cast terror into their hearts, so that they demolished their houses with their own hands and with the hands of the believers. So take a lesson, O ye who have eyes

3.Sher Ali: And had it not been that ALLAH had decreed exile for them, HE would have, surely, punished them otherwise in this world. And in the Hereafter they will, certainly, have the punishment of the Fire

4.Sher Ali: That is because they opposed ALLAH and HIS Messenger; and whoso opposes ALLAH - then, surely, ALLAH is severe in retribution

5.Sher Ali: Whatever palm tree you cut down, or left standing on their roots, it was by ALLAH's leave that HE might humiliate the transgressors

6.Sher Ali: And whatever ALLAH has given to HIS Messenger as spoils from them, is of ALLAH's grace. You urged neither horse nor camel for that; but ALLAH gives authority to HIS Messengers over whomsoever HE pleases; and ALLAH has power over all things

7.Sher Ali: Whatever ALLAH has given to HIS Messenger as spoils from the  people of the towns, it is for ALLAH and for the Messenger and for the near of kin and the orphans and the needy and the wayfarer, in order that it may not circulate only among those of you who are rich. And whatsoever the Messenger gives you, take it, and whatsoever he forbids you, abstain from it. And fear ALLAH, surely, ALLAH is Severe in retribution

8.Sher Ali: And it is also for the poor refugees who have been driven out from their homes and their possessions; they seek the grace of ALLAH and HIS pleasure; and help ALLAH and HIS Messenger. These it is who are true in their faith

9.Sher Ali: And for those who had established their home in this City and had accepted the Faith before them. They love those who come to them for refuge, and find not in their breasts any desire for that which is given them (the Refugees), but give preference to the Refugees above themselves, even though poverty be their own lot. Whoso is rid of the covetousness of his own soul - it is these who will be successful

10.Sher Ali: And for those who came after them. They say, `Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in the Faith, and leave not any rancour in our hearts against those who believe. Our Lord, Thou art, indeed, Compassionate, Merciful

11.Sher Ali: Seest thou not the Hypocrites?  They say to their brethren who disbelieve from among the People of the Book, `If you are turned out of Medina, we will, surely, go out with you and we will never obey anyone against you, and if you are fought against, we will, certainly, help you. But ALLAH bears witness that, surely, they are the liars

12.Sher Ali: If they are turned out, they will never go out with them, and if they are fought against, they will never help them. And even if they help them, they will, certainly, turn their backs, and then they themselves shall not be helped

13.Sher Ali: Assuredly, they have greater fear of you in their hearts than of ALLAH. That is because they are a people who understand not

14.Sher Ali: They will not fight you in a body except in strongly fortified towns or from behind the walls. Their fighting among themselves is severe. Thou thinkest them to be united, but their hearts are divided. That is because they are a people who have no sense

15.Sher Ali: Their case is like the case of those people who passed away only a short time before them. They tasted the evil consequences of their evil conduct. And for them is a painful punishment

16.Sher Ali: Or it is like that of Satan, when he says to man, `Disbelieve,' but when he disbelieves, he says, `I have nothing to do with thee, I fear ALLAH, the Lord of the worlds.

17.Sher Ali: The end of both is that they are both in the Fire, abiding therein. Such is the reward of the wrongdoers

18.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  be mindful of your duty to ALLAH and let every soul look to what it sends forth for the morrow. And fear ALLAH, verily, ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

19.Sher Ali: And be not like those who forgot ALLAH, so HE caused them to forget their own souls. It is they that are the transgressors

20.Sher Ali: The inmates of the Fire and the inmates of the Garden are not equal. It is the inmates of the Garden that are the triumphant

21.Sher Ali: If WE had sent down this Qur'an on a mountain, thou wouldst, certainly, have seen it humbled and rent asunder for fear of ALLAH . And these are similitudes that WE set forth for mankind that they may reflect

22.Sher Ali: HE is ALLAH and there is no god beside HIM, the Knower of the unseen and the seen. HE is the Gracious, the Merciful

23.Sher Ali: HE is ALLAH and there is no god beside HIM, the Sovereign, the Holy One, the Source of peace, the Bestower of security, the Protector, the Mighty, the Subduer, the Exalted. Holy is ALLAH, far above that which they associate with HIM

24.Sher Ali: HE is ALLAH, the creator, the Maker, the Fashioner. HIS are the most beautiful names. All that is in the heavens and the earth glorifies HIM, and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  take not MY enemy and your enemy for friends. Would you offer them love, while they have disbelieved in the Truth which has come to you and have driven out the Messenger and yourselves from your homes, merely because you believe in ALLAH, your Lord?  When you go forth to strive in MY cause and to seek MY pleasure, some of you send them messages of love in secret, while I know best what you conceal and what you reveal. And whoever of you does it has, indeed, strayed away from the right path

2.Sher Ali: If they get the upper hand of you, they will be your active enemies, and will stretch forth their hands and their tongues towards you to do you harm; and they ardently desire that you should become disbelievers

3.Sher Ali: Neither your ties of kindred, nor your children will avail you aught on the Day of Resurrection. ALLAH will decide between you. And ALLAH sees all what you do

4.Sher Ali: Indeed there is a good example for you in Abraham and those who were with him when they said to their people, `We have nothing to do with you and with that which you worship beside ALLAH. We disbelieve all that you believe in. There has become manifest enmity and hatred between us and you for ever, until you believe in ALLAH alone' - except that Abraham said to his father, `I will surely ask forgiveness for thee, though I have no power to do aught for thee against ALLAH.'  Their prayer was:  `Our Lord, in thee do we put our trust and to thee do we turn in repentance, and towards thee is the final return

5.Sher Ali: `Our Lord, make us not a trial for those who disbelieve, and forgive us, our Lord; for, Thou alone art Mighty, the Wise.

6.Sher Ali: Surely, there is a good example in them for you - for all who have hope to see ALLAH and the Last Day. And whosoever turns away - truly, ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, Worthy of all praise

7.Sher Ali: It may be that ALLAH will bring about love between you and those of them with whom you are now at enmity, and ALLAH is All-Powerful; and ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

8.Sher Ali: ALLAH forbids you not respecting those who have not fought against you on account of your religion, and who have not driven you out from your homes, that you be kind to them and deal equitably with them; surely, ALLAH loves those who are equitable

9.Sher Ali: ALLAH only forbids you respecting those who have fought against you on account of your religion and have driven you out of your homes, and have helped others in driving you out, that you make friends with them, and whosoever makes friends with them - it is these that are transgressors

10.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  when believing women come to you as Refugees, examine them. ALLAH knows best their faith. Then if you find them true believers, send them not back to the disbelievers. These women are not lawful for them, nor are they lawful for these women. But give their disbelieving husbands what they have spent on them. Thereafter it is no sin for you to marry them, when you have given them their dowries. And hold not to your matrimonial ties of the disbelieving women, but should they join the disbelievers, then demand the return of that which you have spent; and let the disbelieving husbands of believing women demand that which they have spent. That is the judgment of ALLAH. HE judges between you. And ALLAH is All-Knowing, Wise

11.Sher Ali: And if any of your wives goes away from you to the disbelievers, and afterwards you retaliate and get some spoils from the disbelievers, then give to those believers whose wives have gone away the like of that which they have spent on them. And fear ALLAH in Whom you believe

12.Sher Ali: O Prophet ! when believing women come to thee, taking the oath of allegiance at thy hands that they will not associate anything with ALLAH, and that they will not steal, and will not commit adultery, nor kill their children, nor bring forth a scandalous charge which they themselves have deliberately forged, nor disobey thee in what is right, then accept their allegiance and ask ALLAH to forgive them. Verily, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

13.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  take not for friends a people with whom ALLAH is wroth; they have, indeed, despaired of the Hereafter just as have the disbelievers despaired of those who are in the graves

1.Sher Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies ALLAH; and HE is the Mighty, the Wise

2.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  Why do you say what you do not

3.Sher Ali: It is most hateful in the sight of ALLAH that you say what you do not

4.Sher Ali: Verily, ALLAH loves those who fight in HIS cause arrayed in solid ranks, as though they were a strong structure cemented with molten lead

5.Sher Ali: And call to mind when Moses said to his people, `O my people, why do you malign me and you know that I am ALLAH's Messenger unto you?'  So when they deviated from the right course, ALLAH caused their hearts to deviate; for ALLAH guides not the rebellious people

6.Sher Ali: And call to mind when Jesus, son of Mary, said, `O children of Israel, surely, I am ALLAH's Messenger unto you, fulfilling that which is before me of the prophecies of the Torah, and giving glad tidings of a Messenger who will come after me, his name being Ahmad. And when he came to them with clear proofs, they said, this is manifest sorcery.

7.Sher Ali: But who does greater wrong than he who forges a lie against ALLAH while he is invited to Islam?  ALLAH guides not the wrongdoing people

8.Sher Ali: They desire to extinguish the light of ALLAH with the breath of their mouths, but ALLAH will perfect HIS light, however much the disbelievers may dislike it

9.Sher Ali: HE it is Who has sent HIS Messenger with the guidance and the Religion of truth, that HE may cause it to prevail over all religions, however much those who associate partners with ALLAH may dislike it

10.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  shall I point out to you a commerce which will deliver you from a painful punishment

11.Sher Ali: That you believe in ALLAH and His Messenger, and strive in the cause of ALLAH with your wealth and your persons. That is better for you, if you did but know

12.Sher Ali: HE will forgive you your sins, and admit you to Gardens through which streams flow, and to pure and pleasant dwellings in Gardens of Eternity. That is the supreme triumph

13.Sher Ali: And HE will bestow upon you another favour which you love: help from ALLAH and a nigh victory. So give glad tidings to the believers

14.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  be helpers of ALLAH, as said Jesus, son of Mary, to his disciples, `Who are my helpers in the cause of ALLAH?'  The disciples said, `We are helpers of ALLAH.'  So a party of the Children of Israel believed while a party disbelieved. Then WE aided those who believed against their enemy, and they became predominant

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Sher Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies ALLAH, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Mighty, the Wise

2.Sher Ali: HE it is Who has raised among the unlettered people a Messenger from among themselves who recites unto them HIS Signs, and purifies them, and teaches them the Book and Wisdom though before that they were in manifest error

3.Sher Ali: And HE will raise him among others of them who have not yet joined them. HE is the Mighty, the Wise

4.Sher Ali: That is ALLAH's grace; HE bestows it on whom HE pleases; and ALLAH is the Lord of immense grace

5.Sher Ali: The likeness of those who were charged with the Law of Torah, but did not carry out its commandments, is as the likeness of an ass carrying a load of books. Evil is the likeness of the people who reject the Signs of ALLAH. And ALLAH guides not the wrongdoing people

6.Sher Ali: Say, `O ye who are Jews, if you claim that you are the friends of ALLAH to the exclusion of all other peoples, then wish for death, if, indeed, you are truthful

7.Sher Ali: But they will never wish for it, because of that which their hands have sent on before them. And ALLAH knows well those who do wrong

8.Sher Ali: Say, `The death from which you flee will, surely, overtake you. Then you will be returned unto HIM Who knows the unseen and the seen and HE will inform you of what you had been doing.

9.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  When the call is made for Prayer on Friday, hasten to the remembrance of ALLAH, and leave off all business. That is best for you, if you only knew

10.Sher Ali: And when the Prayer is finished, then disperse in the land and seek of ALLAH's grace, and remember ALLAH much that you may prosper

11.Sher Ali: But when they see some merchandise or amusement, they break up for it, and leave thee standing. Say, `That which is with ALLAH is better than amusement and merchandise, and ALLAH is the best providers.

1.Sher Ali: When the Hypocrites come to thee, they say, `We bear witness that thou art the Messenger of ALLAH.'  And ALLAH knows that thou art indeed HIS Messenger, but ALLAH also bears witness that the Hypocrites certainly are liars

2.Sher Ali: They have made their oaths a cloak; thus they hinder men from the way of ALLAH. Surely, evil is that which they have been doing

3.Sher Ali: That is because they first believed and then disbelieved. So a seal was set upon their hearts and consequently they understand not

4.Sher Ali: And when thou seest them, their figures please thee; and when they speak, thou listenest to their speech. They are as though they were blocks of wood propped up. They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. ALLAH's curse be upon them, how are they being turned away from the truth

5.Sher Ali: And when it is said to them `Come, that the Messenger of ALLAH ask forgiveness for you,' they turn their heads aside, and thou seest them holding back disdainfully while they are big with pride

6.Sher Ali: For them it is equal whether thou ask forgiveness for them, or ask not forgiveness for them. ALLAH will never forgive them. Surely, ALLAH guides not the rebellious people

7.Sher Ali: They it is who say, `Spend not on those who are with the Messenger of ALLAH that they may disperse and leave him;' while to ALLAH belong the treasures of the heavens and the earth; but the Hypocrites understand not

8.Sher Ali: They say, `If we return to Medina, the one most exalted will, surely, drive out therefrom the one most mean,'  while true honour belongs to ALLAH and to HIS Messenger and the believers; but the Hypocrites know not
