9.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  let not your wealth and your children divert you from the remembrance of ALLAH. And whoever does so - it is they who are the losers

10.Sher Ali: And spend out of that which WE have given you before death  comes upon one of you and he says, `My Lord !  if only Thou wouldst respite me for a little while, then I would give alms and be among the righteous.

11.Sher Ali: And ALLAH will not grant respite to a soul when its appointed time has come; and ALLAH is Well-Aware of what you do

1.Sher Ali: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth glorifies ALLAH.  HIS is the Kingdom and HIS is the praise, and HE has power over all things

2.Sher Ali: It is HE Who has created you, but some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. And ALLAH sees what you do

3.Sher Ali: HE created the heavens and the earth with an eternal purpose and HE gave you shape and made your shapes beautiful, and to HIM is the ultimate return

4.Sher Ali: HE knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and HE knows what you hide and what you disclose; and ALLAH knows full well all that which is hidden in the breasts

5.Sher Ali: Has there not come to you the account of those who disbelieved before?  They tasted the evil consequences of their conduct, and for them is decreed painful punishment

6.Sher Ali: That was because their Messengers came to them with manifest Signs, but they said, `Shall mere mortals guide us?'  So they disbelieved and turned away, but ALLAH had no need of them; And ALLAH is Self-Sufficient, Worthy of all praise

7.Sher Ali: Those who disbelieve think that they will not be raised up. Say, `Yea, by my Lord, you shall, surely, be raised up; then you shall, certainly, be informed of what you did. And that is easy for ALLAH.

8.Sher Ali: Believe, therefore, in ALLAH and HIS Messenger, and in the Light which WE have sent down. And ALLAH is Well-Aware of all that you do

9.Sher Ali: The day when HE shall gather you for the Day of Gathering; that will be the day of the determination of losses and gains. And whoso believes in ALLAH and acts righteously - HE will remove from them the evil consequences of their deeds, and HE will admit them into Gardens through which streams flow, to abide therein for ever. That is the supreme achievement

10.Sher Ali: But those who disbelieve and reject Our Signs, these shall be the inmates of the Fire, wherein they shall abide; and an evil destination it is

11.Sher Ali: There befalls not any affliction but by the leave of ALLAH. And whosoever believes in ALLAH - HE guides his heart aright. And ALLAH knows all things well

12.Sher Ali: And obey ALLAH and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, then Our Messenger is responsible only for conveying the Message clearly

13.Sher Ali: ALLAH !  there is no god but HE; so in ALLAH let the believers put their trust

14.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  surely, among your wives and your children are some who are your enemies, so beware of them. And if you overlook and forgive and pardon, then, surely, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, ever Merciful

15.Sher Ali: Verily, your wealth and your children are but a trial; but with ALLAH is an immense reward

16.Sher Ali: So be mindful of your duty to ALLAH as best you can, and listen and obey, and spend in HIS cause, it will be good for yourselves. And whoso is rid of the covetousness of his own soul -it is they who shall succeed

17.Sher Ali: If you lend to ALLAH a goodly loan, HE will multiply it for you, and will forgive you; and ALLAH is Most Appreciating, Forbearing

18.Sher Ali: The Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty, the Wise

1.Sher Ali: O Prophet !  when you divorce women, divorce them for the prescribed period, and thereafter reckon the period; and fear ALLAH, your Lord. Turn them not out of their houses, nor should they themselves leave unless they commit manifest indecency. These are the limits set by ALLAH; and whoso transgresses the limits of ALLAH, he, indeed, wrongs his own soul. Thou knowest not; it may be that thereafter ALLAH will bring something new to pass

2.Sher Ali: Then, when they are about to reach the limit of their prescribed term, retain them with kindness, or part with them in a suitable manner, and call to witness two just persons from among you; and bear true witness for ALLAH. Thus is admonished he who believes in ALLAH and the Last Day. And he who fears ALLAH - HE will make for him a way out

3.Sher Ali: And will provide for him from whence he expects not. And he who puts his trust in ALLAH - HE is sufficient for him. Verily, ALLAH will accomplish HIS purpose. For everything has ALLAH appointed a measure

4.Sher Ali: And if you are in doubt as to the prescribed period for such of your women as have despaired of monthly courses, then know that the prescribed period for them is three months, and also for such as do not have their monthly courses yet. And as for those who are with child, their period shall be until they are delivered of their burden. And whoso fears ALLAH, HE will provide facilities for him in his affair

5.Sher Ali: That is the command of ALLAH which HE has sent down to you. And whoso fears ALLAH - HE will remove the evil effects of his deeds and will enlarge his reward

6.Sher Ali: Lodge the divorced women during the prescribed period in the houses wherein you dwell, according to your means, and harass them not that you may create hardships for them and thus force them to leave. And if they be with child, spend on them until they are delivered of their burden. And if they give suck to the child for you, give them their due recompense, to be fixed in consultation with one another according to what is customary; but if you meet with difficulty from each other, then let another women suckle the child for the father

7.Sher Ali: Let him who has abundance of means spend out of his abundance. And let him whose means of subsistence are straitened spend out of what ALLAH has given him. ALLAH burdens not any soul beyond that which HE has bestowed upon it. ALLAH will soon bring about ease after hardship

8.Sher Ali: How many a city rebelled against the command of its Lord and HIS Messengers, and WE called it to severe account and punished it with dire punishment

9.Sher Ali: So it tasted the evil consequences of its conduct, and the end of its affair was ruin

10.Sher Ali: ALLAH has prepared for them a severe punishment; so fear ALLAH, O ye men of understanding who have believed. ALLAH has, indeed, sent down to you a Reminder

11.Sher Ali: A Messenger, who recites unto you the clear Signs of ALLAH, that HE may bring those who believe and do good deeds out of every kind of darkness into light. And whoso believes in ALLAH and does righteous deeds - HE will make him enter Gardens, through which streams flow, to abide therein for ever. ALLAH has, indeed, made excellent provision for him

12.Sher Ali: ALLAH is HE who created seven heavens, and of the earth the like thereof. The Divine command comes down in their midst, that you may know that ALLAH has power over all things, and that ALLAH encompasses all things in HIS knowledge

1.Sher Ali: O Prophet ! why dost thou forbid thyself that which ALLAH has made lawful to thee. Thou seekest the pleasure of thy wives? And ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

2.Sher Ali: ALLAH has, indeed, enjoined on you the expiation of such of your oaths as would occasion trouble, and ALLAH is your friend; and He is All-Knowing, Wise

3.Sher Ali: And when the Prophet confided a matter unto one of his wives and she divulged it, and ALLAH informed him of it, he made known to her part thereof, and avoided mentioning part of it. And when he informed her of it, she said, `Who has informed thee of it?'  He said, `The All-Knowing, the All-Aware God has informed me.

4.Sher Ali: Now if you two turn unto ALLAH repentant - and your hearts are already so inclined - it will be better for you. But if you back up one another against him, surely, ALLAH is his helper and Gabriel and the righteous among the believers, and all the angels besides are his helpers

5.Sher Ali: Maybe, his Lord, if he divorces you, will give him instead wives better than you - resigned, believing, obedient, always turning to God, devout in worship, given to fasting, both widows and virgins

6.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  Save yourselves and your families from a Fire whose fuel is men and stones over which are appointed angels, stern and severe, who disobey not ALLAH in what HE commands them and do as they are commanded

7.Sher Ali: O ye who disbelieve !  Make no excuse this day. You are requited for what you did

8.Sher Ali: O ye who believe !  turn to ALLAH in sincere repentance. It may be that your Lord will remit the evil effects of your deeds and admit you into Gardens through which streams flow, on the day when ALLAH will not abase the Prophet nor those who have believed with him. Their light will run before  them and on their right hands. They will say, `Our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us; surely, Thou hast power over all things.

9.Sher Ali: O Prophet !  strive hard against the disbelievers and the Hypocrites; and be stern with them; their resort is Hell, and an evil destination it is

10.Sher Ali: ALLAH sets forth an example for those who disbelieve, the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under two righteous servants of Ours, but they acted treacherously to them. So they availed them naught against ALLAH, and it was said to them,  `Enter the Fire, ye twain, along with those  who enter it.

11.Sher Ali: And ALLAH holds forth as an example, for those who believe, the wife of Pharaoh when she said, `My Lord !  build for me a house with Thee in the Garden; and deliver me from Pharaoh and his work, and deliver me from the wrongdoing people

12.Sher Ali: And sets forth as an example Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity - so WE breathed into him of Our Spirit -and she fulfilled the prophecy conveyed to her in the words of her Lord contained in HIS Books and she was one of the obedient

1.Sher Ali: Blessed is HE in Whose hand is the Kingdom, and HE has power over all things

2.Sher Ali: Who has created death and life that HE might try you -which of you is best in deeds; and HE is the Mighty, the Most Forgiving

3.Sher Ali: Who has created seven heavens in harmony. No incongruity canst thou see in the creation of the Gracious God. Then look again. Seest thou any flaw

4.Sher Ali: Aye, look again, and yet again, thy sight will only return unto thee confused and fatigued, having seen no incongruity

5.Sher Ali: And verily, WE have adorned the lowest heaven with lamps, and WE have made them the means of driving away satans, and WE have prepared for them the punishment of the blazing Fire

6.Sher Ali: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord, is the punishment of Hell, and an evil resort it is

7.Sher Ali: When they are cast therein, they will hear it roaring as it boils up

8.Sher Ali: It would almost burst with fury. Whenever a host of wrongdoers is cast into it the wardens thereof will ask them `Did no Warner come to you?

9.Sher Ali: They will say, `Yea, indeed, a Warner did come to us, but we treated him as a liar, and we said, `ALLAH has not revealed anything; you are but in manifest error.

10.Sher Ali: And they will say, `Had we but listened or had sense, we should not have been among the inmates of the blazing Fire.

11.Sher Ali: Thus will they confess their sins; but far removed from God's mercy are the inmates of the blazing Fire

12.Sher Ali: Verily, those who fear their Lord in secret - for them is forgiveness and a great reward

13.Sher Ali: And whether you conceal what you say or say it openly, HE knows well all that which is in your breasts

14.Sher Ali: Does HE, Who has created you, not know it?  HE is the Knower of all subtleties, the All-Aware

15.Sher Ali: HE it is Who has made the earth even and smooth for you; so walk in the spacious paths thereof, and eat of HIS provision. And unto HIM will be the resurrection

16.Sher Ali: Do you feel secure from HIM Who is in the heaven that HE will not cause the earth to sink with you?  When lo !  it begins to shake

17.Sher Ali: Do you feel secure from HIM Who is in the heaven that HE will not send against you a heavy sand-storm?  Then will you know how terrible was MY Warning

18.Sher Ali: And, indeed, those before them also rejected MY Messengers, then how grievous was MY punishment

19.Sher Ali: Do they not see the birds above them, spreading out their wings in flight and then drawing them in to swoop down upon the prey?  None withholds them but the Gracious God, HE sees all things well

20.Sher Ali: Can those, who are counted your hosts, help you against the Gracious God?  The disbelievers are only the victims of self-deception

21.Sher Ali: Or, who is he that will provide for you, if HE should withhold HIS provision?  Nay, but they obstinately persist in rebellion and aversion

22.Sher Ali: What !  is he who walks groveling upon his face better guided, or he who walks upright on the straight path

23.Sher Ali: Say, `HE it is Who brought you into being, and made for you ears and eyes and hearts; but little thanks do you give.

24.Sher Ali: Say, `HE it is Who multiplied you in the earth, and unto HIM will you all be gathered.

25.Sher Ali: And they say, `When will this promise come to pass, if, indeed, you are truthful?

26.Sher Ali: Say, `The knowledge of it is with ALLAH, and I am but a plain Warner.

27.Sher Ali: But when they see it nigh, the faces of those who disbelieve will be grief-stricken, and it will be said, `This is what you repeatedly asked for.

28.Sher Ali: Say, `Tell me, if ALLAH should destroy me and those who are with me, or have mercy upon us, who will protect the disbelievers from a painful torment?

29.Sher Ali: Say, `HE is the Beneficent God, in HIM have we believed and in HIM have we put our trust. And you will soon know who is in manifest error.

30.Sher Ali: Say, `Tell me, if all your water were to disappear in the depths of the earth, who then, will bring you pure running water?

1.Sher Ali: By the inkstand and the pen and by that which they write

2.Sher Ali: Thou art not, by the grace of thy Lord, a madman

3.Sher Ali: And for thee, most surely, there is an unending reward

4.Sher Ali: And thou dost, surely, possess sublime moral excellences

5.Sher Ali: And thou wilt soon see and they, too, will see

6.Sher Ali: Which of you is afflicted with madness

7.Sher Ali: Surely, thy Lord knows best those who go astray from HIS way, and HE knows best those who follow guidance

8.Sher Ali: So comply not with the wishes of those who reject the Truth

9.Sher Ali: They wish that thou shouldst compromise so that they may also compromise

10.Sher Ali: Yield thou not to any mean swearer

11.Sher Ali: Backbiter, one who goes about slandering

12.Sher Ali: Forbidder of good, transgressor, sinful

13.Sher Ali: Ill-mannered and, in addition to that, of doubtful birth

14.Sher Ali: Only because he possesses riches and children

15.Sher Ali: When our Signs are recited unto him, he say, `Tales of the ancients.

16.Sher Ali: WE will brand him on the snout

17.Sher Ali: WE will, surely, try them as WE tried the owners of the garden when they vowed to each other that they would, certainly, gather all its fruit in the morning

18.Sher Ali: And they made no exception and said not `If God Please.

19.Sher Ali: Then a visitation from thy Lord visited it while they were asleep

20.Sher Ali: And the morning found it like a garden cut down

21.Sher Ali: So they called to one another at the break of dawn

22.Sher Ali: Saying, `Go forth early in the morning to your field, if you would gather the fruit.

23.Sher Ali: And they set out talking to one another in low tones

24.Sher Ali: Saying, `Let no poor man today enter it while you are there.

25.Sher Ali: Thus they went forth early in the morning, determined to be niggardly

26.Sher Ali: But when they saw it, they said, `Surely, we have lost our way

27.Sher Ali: `Nay we have been deprived of all our fruits.

28.Sher Ali: The best among them said, `Did I not say to you, why do you not glorify God?

29.Sher Ali: Thereupon, they said, `Glory be to our Lord !  Surely, we have been wrongdoers.

30.Sher Ali: Then some of them turned to the others, reproaching one another

31.Sher Ali: They said, `Woe to us !  We were indeed, rebellious

32.Sher Ali: `May be, if we repent, our Lord will give us instead a better garden than this; we do humbly entreat our Lord.

33.Sher Ali: Such is the punishment of this world. And, surely, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater. Did they but know

34.Sher Ali: For the righteous, indeed, there are Gardens of Bliss with their Lord

35.Sher Ali: Shall WE, then, treat those who submit to US as WE treat the guilty

36.Sher Ali: What is the matter with you?  How judge ye

37.Sher Ali: Have you a book wherein you read

38.Sher Ali: That you shall, surely, have in it whatever you choose

39.Sher Ali: Or, have you taken any covenant binding on US till the Day of Resurrection that you shall, surely, have whatever you judge

40.Sher Ali: Ask them, which of them will vouch for that

41.Sher Ali: Or, have they any associate-gods?  Let them, then, produce their associate-gods, if they are truthful

42.Sher Ali: On the day when the truth shall be laid bare and they will be called upon to prostrate themselves, they will not be able to do so

43.Sher Ali: Their eyes will be cast down, and humiliation will cover them; and they were, indeed, called upon to prostrate themselves when they were safe and sound, but they did not

44.Sher Ali: So leave ME to deal with those who reject this word of Ours. WE shall draw them near to destruction step by step whence they know not

45.Sher Ali: And I shall grant them long respite; for MY plan is sure

46.Sher Ali: Dost thou ask a reward of them that they feel weighed down by its burden

47.Sher Ali: Have they the knowledge of the unseen so that they write it down

48.Sher Ali: So be thou steadfast in carrying out the command of thy Lord, and be not like the Man of the Fish when he called to his Lord and he was full of grief

49.Sher Ali: Had it not been that a favour from his Lord had reached him, he would have, surely, been cast upon a barren waste to be blamed by his people

50.Sher Ali: But his Lord chose him and placed him among the righteous

51.Sher Ali: And those who disbelieve would fain have dislodged thee from thy God-given station with their angry looks when they heard the Reminder; and they keep saying, `He is, certainly, mad.

52.Sher Ali: Nay, it is naught but a source of honour for all the worlds

1.Sher Ali: The Inevitable

2.Sher Ali: What is the Inevitable

3.Sher Ali: And what should make thee know what the Inevitable is

4.Sher Ali: The tribes of Thamud and Ad treated as a lie the sudden calamity

5.Sher Ali: Then, as for Thamud, they were destroyed with a blast of utmost fury

6.Sher Ali: And as for Ad, they were destroyed by a fierce howling wind

7.Sher Ali: Which God caused to blow against them for seven nights and eight days continuously, so that thou mightest have seen the people therein lying prostrate, as though they were trunks of palm trees fallen down

8.Sher Ali: Dost thou see any trace of them

9.Sher Ali: And Pharaoh and those who were before him, and the overthrown cities persistently committed sins

10.Sher Ali: They disobeyed the Messenger of their Lord, therefore, HE seized them - a severe seizing

11.Sher Ali: Verily, when the waters rose high, WE bore you in the boat

12.Sher Ali: That WE might make it a reminder for you, and that retaining ears might retain it

13.Sher Ali: So that when a single blast is sounded on the trumpet

14.Sher Ali: And the earth and the mountains are heaved up and then are crushed in a single crash,

15.Sher Ali: On that day will the Great Event come to pass

16.Sher Ali: And the heaven will cleave asunder, and it will be very frail that day

17.Sher Ali: And the angels will be standing on its borders, and above them on that day eight angels will bear the Throne of thy Lord

18.Sher Ali: On that day you will be presented before God; and none of your secrets will remain hidden

19.Sher Ali: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, `Come, read my record.

20.Sher Ali: `Surely, I knew that I would meet my reckoning.

21.Sher Ali: So he will enjoy a delightful life

22.Sher Ali: In a lofty Garden

23.Sher Ali: Whereof clusters of fruit will be within easy reach

24.Sher Ali: It will be said to him, `Eat and drink joyfully because of the good deeds you did in the days gone by.

25.Sher Ali: But as for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, `O, would that I had not been given my record

26.Sher Ali: `Nor known what my reckoning was

27.Sher Ali: `O, would that death had made an end of me

28.Sher Ali: `My wealth has been of no avail to me

29.Sher Ali: `My authority is gone from me.

30.Sher Ali: The angels will be commanded: `Seize him and fetter him

31.Sher Ali: `Then cast him into Hell

32.Sher Ali: `Then bind him with a chain, the length of which is seventy cubits

33.Sher Ali: `Verily, he did not believe in ALLAH, the Great

34.Sher Ali: `And he did not urge the feeding of the poor

35.Sher Ali: `No friend, therefore, has he here this day

36.Sher Ali: `Nor any food save the washing of wounds

37.Sher Ali: `Which none but the sinners eat.

38.Sher Ali: But nay, I swear by that which you see

39.Sher Ali: And that which you see not

40.Sher Ali: That it is, surely, the word brought by a noble Messenger

41.Sher Ali: And not the word of a poet; little is it what you believe

42.Sher Ali: Nor is it the word of a soothsayer; little is it that you heed

43.Sher Ali: It is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds

44.Sher Ali: And if he had forged and attributed any sayings to US

45.Sher Ali: We would, surely, have seized him by the right hand

46.Sher Ali: And then, surely, WE would have cut his life-vein

47.Sher Ali: And not one of you could have held Our punishment off from him

48.Sher Ali: And verily, it is a reminder for the righteous

49.Sher Ali: And, surely, WE know that there are some among you who reject OUR Signs

50.Sher Ali: And, verily, it will be a source of regret for the disbelievers

51.Sher Ali: And, surely, it is the absolute truth

52.Sher Ali: So glorify the name of thy Lord, the Great

1.Sher Ali: An inquirer inquires concerning the punishment about to befal

2.Sher Ali: The disbelievers, and which none can repel

3.Sher Ali: It is from ALLAH, Lord of great ascents

4.Sher Ali: The angels and the Spirit ascend to HIM in a day, the measure of which is fifty thousand years

5.Sher Ali: So be patient with admirable patience

6.Sher Ali: They see it to be far off

7.Sher Ali: But WE see it to be nigh

8.Sher Ali: The day when the heaven will become like molten copper

9.Sher Ali: And the mountains will become like flakes of wool

10.Sher Ali: And a friend will not inquire after a friend

11.Sher Ali: Though they will be placed in sight of one another. The guilty one would fain ransom himself from the punishment of that day by offering his children

12.Sher Ali: And his wife and his brother

13.Sher Ali: And his kinsfolk who gave him shelter

14.Sher Ali: And by offering all those who are on the earth, if only thus he might save himself

15.Sher Ali: But no !  surely, it is a flame of Fire

16.Sher Ali: Stripping off the skin even to the extremities of the body

17.Sher Ali: It shall call him who turned his back and retreated

18.Sher Ali: And hoarded wealth and withheld it

19.Sher Ali: Verily, man is created impatient and miserly

20.Sher Ali: When evil touches him, he is full of lamentations

21.Sher Ali: But when good falls to his lot, he is niggardly

22.Sher Ali: Except those who pray

23.Sher Ali: Those who are constant in their Prayer

24.Sher Ali: And those in whose wealth there is a known right

25.Sher Ali: For those who ask for help and for those who do not ask

26.Sher Ali: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment to be a reality

27.Sher Ali: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord

28.Sher Ali: Verily, from the punishment of their Lord none can feel secure

29.Sher Ali: And those who guard their private parts

30.Sher Ali: Except from their wives and from those whom their right hands possess; such indeed, are not to blame

31.Sher Ali: But those who seek to go beyond that, it is these who are transgressors

32.Sher Ali: And those who are watchful of their trusts and their covenants

33.Sher Ali: And those who are upright in their testimonies

34.Sher Ali: And those who are strict in the observance of their Prayer

35.Sher Ali: These will be in the Gardens, duly honoured

36.Sher Ali: But what is the matter with those who disbelieve that they come hurrying on towards thee

37.Sher Ali: From the right hand and from the left, in different parties

38.Sher Ali: Does every man among them hope to enter the Garden of Bliss

39.Sher Ali: Never !  WE have created them of that which they know

40.Sher Ali: But nay !  I swear by the Lord of the Easts and of the Wests that WE have the powe

41.Sher Ali: To bring in their place others better than they, and WE cannot be frustrated in Our plans

42.Sher Ali: So leave them alone to indulge in idle talk and to sport until they meet that day of theirs which they are promised

43.Sher Ali: The day when they will come forth from their graves hastening as though they were racing to a target

44.Sher Ali: Their eyes cast down; and humiliation covering them. Such is the Day which they are promised

1.Sher Ali: WE sent Noah to his people, with the commandment:  `Warn thy people before there comes upon them a grievous punishment.

2.Sher Ali: He said, `O my people !  surely, I am a plain Warner unto you

3.Sher Ali: `That you serve ALLAH and be mindful of your duty to HIM and obey me

4.Sher Ali: `HE will forgive you your sins and grant you respite till an appointed time.' Verily, the time appointed by ALLAH cannot be put off when it comes, if only you knew

5.Sher Ali: He said, `My Lord, I have called my people night and day

6.Sher Ali: `But my calling them has only made them flee from me all the more

7.Sher Ali: `And every time I called them that Thou mightest forgive them, they put their fingers into their ears, and drew close their garments, and persisted in their iniquities and were disdainfully proud

8.Sher Ali: `Then, I called them to righteousness openly

9.Sher Ali: `Then preached to them in public, an appealed to them in private.

10.Sher Ali: And I said, `Seek forgiveness of your Lord; for HE is the Great Forgiver

11.Sher Ali: `HE will send down rain for you in abundance

12.Sher Ali: `And HE will grant you increase of wealth and children, and will cause gardens to grow for you and will cause rivers to flow for you

13.Sher Ali: `What is the matter with you that you hope not for greatness and wisdom from ALLAH

14.Sher Ali: `And HE has created you in different forms and different conditions

15.Sher Ali: `See you not how ALLAH has created seven heavens in perfect harmony

16.Sher Ali: `And has placed the moon, therein a light, and made the sun a lamp

17.Sher Ali: `And ALLAH has caused you to grow out of the earth as a good growth

18.Sher Ali: `Then HE will cause you to return thereto, and HE will bring you forth a new bringing forth

19.Sher Ali: `And ALLAH has made the earth for you a wide expanse

20.Sher Ali: `That you may traverse the spacious ways thereof.

21.Sher Ali: Then Noah said, `My Lord, they have disobeyed me, and followed one whose wealth and children have only added to his loss

22.Sher Ali: `And they planned a mighty plan.

23.Sher Ali: `And they say to one another `Forsake not your gods, and forsake neither Wadd nor Suwa, nor Yaghhth and Ya`hq and Nasr.

24.Sher Ali: `And they have led many astray; so increase Thou not the wrongdoers in aught but error.

25.Sher Ali: Because of their sins they were drowned and made to enter Fire. And they found no helpers for themselves against ALLAH

26.Sher Ali: And Noah said, `My Lord, leave not of the disbelievers even one dweller in the land

27.Sher Ali: `For, if thou dost leave them, they will only lead astray Thy servants and will beget none but sinners and disbelievers

28.Sher Ali: `My Lord !  forgive me and my parents, and him who enters my house as a believer, and the believing men and the believing women; and increase Thou not the wrongdoers in aught but in ruin.

1.Sher Ali: Say `It has been revealed to me that a company of the jinn listened to the Qur'an and they said: `Truly, we have heard a wonderful Qur'an

2.Sher Ali: `It guides to the right way; so we have believed in it, and we will not associate anyone with our Lord

3.Sher Ali: `The truth is that - exalted be the Majesty of our Lord - HE has taken unto Himself neither wife nor son

4.Sher Ali: `And that the foolish amongst us used to utter extravagant lies concerning ALLAH

5.Sher Ali: `And we thought that men and jinn would never utter a lie concerning ALLAH

6.Sher Ali: `And, indeed, some men from among the common folk used to seek the protection of some men from among the jinn, and thus they increased the jinn in arrogance

7.Sher Ali: `And, indeed, they thought, even as you think that ALLAH would never raise any Messenger

8.Sher Ali: `And we sought to reach heaven, but we found it filled with strong guards and shooting stars

9.Sher Ali: `And we used to sit in some of its seats to listen. But whoso listens now finds a shooting star in ambush for him

10.Sher Ali: `And we know not whether evil is intended for those who are in the earth, or whether their Lord intends to bestow guidance upon them

11.Sher Ali: `And some of us are righteous and some of us are otherwise - we are sects following different paths

12.Sher Ali: `And we know that we cannot frustrate the plan of ALLAH in the earth, nor can we escape HIM by flight

13.Sher Ali: `So when we heard the call to guidance, we believed in it'. And he, who believes in his Lord, has no fear of loss or of injustice

14.Sher Ali: `And some of us submit to God and some of us have deviated from the right course.'  And those who submit to God - it is they who seek the right course

15.Sher Ali: And those who deviate from the right course, they are the fuel of Hell

16.Sher Ali: And if the Meccan disbelievers keep to the right path, WE shall, certainly, provide them with abundant water to drink

17.Sher Ali: That WE may try them thereby. And whoso turns away from the remembrance of his Lord - HE will drive him into an over-whelmingly severe punishment

18.Sher Ali: And all places of worship belong to ALLAH; so call not on anyone beside ALLAH

19.Sher Ali: And when the servant of ALLAH stands up praying to HIM, they crowd upon him, well-nigh stifling him to death

20.Sher Ali: Say, `I pray to my Lord only, and I associate no one with HIM

21.Sher Ali: Say, I have no power to do you either harm or good.

22.Sher Ali: Say, `Surely, none can protect me against the punishment of ALLAH, nor can I find any place of refuge beside HIM.

23.Sher Ali: `My responsibility is only to convey what is revealed to me from ALLAH and HIS Messages.' And those who disobey ALLAH and HIS Messenger, surely, for them is the Fire of Hell, wherein they will abide for a long period

24.Sher Ali: They will continue to disbelieve until they see that which they are promised, but soon they will know who is weaker in helpers and fewer in numbers

25.Sher Ali: Say, `I know not whether that which you are promised is nigh, or whether my Lord has fixed for it a distant term.

26.Sher Ali: HE is the Knower of the unseen; and HE reveals not HIS secrets to anyone

27.Sher Ali: Except to a Messenger of HIS whom HE chooses. And then HE causes an escort of guarding angels to go before him and behind him

28.Sher Ali: That HE may know that HIS Messengers have delivered the Messages of their Lord. And HE encompasses all that is with them and HE keeps count of all things

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Sher Ali: O thou wrapped up in thy mantle

2.Sher Ali: Stand up in Prayer at night except a small portion thereof

3.Sher Ali: Half of it, or reduce from it a little

4.Sher Ali: Or, add to it a little - and recite the Qur'an a good recital

5.Sher Ali: Verily, WE are about to charge thee with a weighty Word

6.Sher Ali: Verily, getting up at night for Prayer is the most potent means of subduing the self and most effective in speech

7.Sher Ali: Thou hast, indeed, during the day a long chain of engagements

8.Sher Ali: So remember the name of thy Lord and devote thyself to HIM with full devotion

9.Sher Ali: HE is the Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but HE; so take him for thy Guardian

10.Sher Ali: And bear patiently all that they say; and withdraw from them in a decent manner

11.Sher Ali: And leave ME alone with those who reject the truth, possessors of ease and plenty; and give them a little respite

12.Sher Ali: Surely, with US are heavy fetters and a raging fire

13.Sher Ali: And food that chokes, and a painful punishment

14.Sher Ali: On the day when the earth and the mountains shall quake, and the mountains will become like crumbling sand-hills

15.Sher Ali: Verily, WE have sent to you a Messenger, who is a witness over you, even as WE sent a Messenger to Pharaoh

16.Sher Ali: But Pharaoh disobeyed the Messenger, so WE seized him with a terrible seizing

17.Sher Ali: How will you then, if you disbelieve, guard yourselves against a day which will turn children grey-headed

18.Sher Ali: The day when the heaven will be rent asunder; and HIS promise is bound to be fulfilled

19.Sher Ali: This, surely, is a reminder. So let him, who will, take a way unto his Lord

20.Sher Ali: Surely, thy Lord knows that thou standest up praying for nearly two-thirds of the night, and sometimes half or a third thereof and also a party of those who are with thee. And ALLAH determines the measure of the night and the day. HE knows that you cannot calculate the time accurately, so HE has turned to you in mercy.  Recite, then, as much of the Qur'an as is easy for you. HE knows that there will be some among you who may be sick, and others who may travel in the land, seeking ALLAH's bounty, and others who may fight in the cause of ALLAH.  So recite of it that which is easy for you, and observe Prayer and pay the Zakat and lend to ALLAH a goodly loan.  And whatever good you may send on before you for your souls, you will find it with ALLAH. It will be better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of ALLAH. Surely, ALLAH is Most Forgiving, Merciful

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Sher Ali: O thou who hast covered thyself with thy cloak

2.Sher Ali: Arise and warn

3.Sher Ali: And thy Lord do thou magnify

4.Sher Ali: And thy clothes do thou purify

5.Sher Ali: And uncleanliness do thou shun

6.Sher Ali: And bestow not favours seeking to get more in return

7.Sher Ali: And for the sake of thy Lord do thou endure trials patiently

8.Sher Ali: And when the trumpet is sounded

9.Sher Ali: That day will be a hard day

10.Sher Ali: For the disbelievers it will not be easy

11.Sher Ali: Leave ME alone to deal with him whom I created

12.Sher Ali: And I gave him abundant wealth

13.Sher Ali: And sons, dwelling in his presence

14.Sher Ali: And equipped him with all necessary things

15.Sher Ali: Yet he desires that I should give him more

16.Sher Ali: Certainly not !  for he was stubbornly opposed to Our Signs

17.Sher Ali: I shall inflict on him an increasingly overwhelming torment

18.Sher Ali: Lo !  he reflected and calculated

19.Sher Ali: Ruin seize him !  how he calculated

20.Sher Ali: Ruin seize him again !  how he calculated

21.Sher Ali: Then he looked around him

22.Sher Ali: Then he frowned and scowled

23.Sher Ali: Then he turned away and was disdainful

24.Sher Ali: And said, `This is nothing but magic handed down

25.Sher Ali: `This is nothing but the word of a man

26.Sher Ali: Soon shall I cast him into the fire of Hell

27.Sher Ali: And what will make thee know what Hell-fire is

28.Sher Ali: It spares not and it leaves naught

29.Sher Ali: It scorches the face

30.Sher Ali: Over it are nineteen angels

31.Sher Ali: And none but angels have we made wardens of the Fire. And WE have not fixed their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve, so that those, who have been given the Book, may attain certainty and those who believe may increase in faith, and those, who have been given the Book as well as the believers, may not doubt, and that those in whose hearts is disease and the disbelievers may say, `What does ALLAH mean by such an illustration?'  Thus does ALLAH leave to go  astray whom HE pleases and guide whom HE pleases. And none knows the host of thy Lord but HE. And this is nothing but a reminder for man

32.Sher Ali: Nay, by the moon

33.Sher Ali: And by the night when it departs

34.Sher Ali: And by the dawn when it shines forth

35.Sher Ali: Verily, it is one of the greatest calamities

36.Sher Ali: A warning to man

37.Sher Ali: To him among you who wishes to advance in virtue or hang back

38.Sher Ali: Every soul is pledged for what it has earned

39.Sher Ali: Except those on the right hand

40.Sher Ali: They will be in Gardens enquirin

41.Sher Ali: From the guilty ones

42.Sher Ali: `What has brought you into Hell?

43.Sher Ali: They will say, `We were not of those who offered Prayer

44.Sher Ali: `Nor did we feed the poor

45.Sher Ali: `And we indulged in idle talk with those who indulge therein

46.Sher Ali: `And we continued to deny the Day of Judgment

47.Sher Ali: `Until death overtook us.

48.Sher Ali: So the intercession of intercessors will not avail them

49.Sher Ali: Now what is the matter with them that they are turning away from the Exhortation

50.Sher Ali: As if they were frightened asses

51.Sher Ali: Fleeing from a lion

52.Sher Ali: Nay, every man among them desires to be given an open Book

53.Sher Ali: This cannot be !  Verily, they fear not the Hereafter

54.Sher Ali: Never !  for, this Qur'an is an exhortation enough

55.Sher Ali: Let him, then, who will, remember it

56.Sher Ali: And they will not remember unless ALLAH so pleases. HE alone is worthy to be feared and HE alone is worthy to forgive

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Sher Ali: Nay, I swear by the Day of Resurrection

2.Sher Ali: Nay, I swear by the self accusing soul, that the Day of Judgment is a certainty

3.Sher Ali: Does man think that WE shall not assemble his bones

4.Sher Ali: Yea, WE have the power to restore his very finger-tips

5.Sher Ali: But man desires to continue to send forth evil deeds in front of him

6.Sher Ali: He inquires `When will be the Day of Resurrection?

7.Sher Ali: When the eye is dazzled

8.Sher Ali: And the moon is eclipsed

9.Sher Ali: And the sun and the moon are brought together

10.Sher Ali: On that day man will say, `Wither to flee?

11.Sher Ali: Not at all; there is no refuge

12.Sher Ali: With thy Lord alone will be the place of rest that day

13.Sher Ali: On that day will man be informed of that which he has sent forward and of that which he has left behind

14.Sher Ali: In truth man is a witness against himself

15.Sher Ali: Even though he puts forward his excuses

16.Sher Ali: Move not thy tongue, O Prophet, with the revelation of the Qur'an that thou mayest hasten to preserve it

17.Sher Ali: Surely, upon US rests its collection and its recital

18.Sher Ali: So when WE recite it, then follow thou its recital

19.Sher Ali: Then upon US rests the expounding thereof

20.Sher Ali: Hearken !  you love the present life

21.Sher Ali: And you neglect the Hereafter

22.Sher Ali: Some faces on that day will be radiant

23.Sher Ali: Looking eagerly towards their Lord

24.Sher Ali: And some faces on that day will be dismal

25.Sher Ali: Knowing that a back-breaking calamity will befall them

26.Sher Ali: Hearken !  when the soul of the dying man comes up to the throat

27.Sher Ali: And it is said, `Who is the Wizard to save him?
